Reviews.Title: “A good choice in Midtown East”
Reviews.Author: JWeiden
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit back to NYC since moving to Singapore a year ago, and I wanted to stay somewhere near where I used to live. The Hilton Manhattan East fit that bill, and I'm pleased to say that it was a great choice. The rooms are a bit small, but clean and comfortable (although it could have used a desk!). The staff was friendly. The rate I received on Expedia.sg was excellent, which made this a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: sugarlover14
Reviews.Content: We requested a room with a balcony and had a lovely big room with a balcony for our 5 nights. The location is excellent, very safe and easy walking distance to Grand Central station and Times Square. The staff were friendly and the room was cleaned to a very high standard. There was a little pizza place right around the corner that had great slices of pizza for $3. The only downside was that wifi was $15 a day. We paid it but thought it was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Michael T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel. It may not be the most attractive from the outside, but inside was great. Very clean and the staff were very helpful and polite whenever we needed their help. Its only a few minutes to grand central station and about a 10-15 minute walk to time square.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Hilton mahattan East Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: jamyou
Reviews.Content: Stay period : Feb 24 to Feb 26. 1. Location : Middle Town near Grand Central Station, from Grand Central Station walk to Hilton Manhattan East Hotel take 7 to 10 mins just a straight way, it's easy and not hard to found. The area there is save, lot of expensive shop, famous building like Empire State Building, New York Public Library around there, and it took 10 to 15 mins or 20 mins walk to Time Square. Taxi driver have no problem to found there. 2. Hotel Lobby : Nice decorated, Free Wifi, have desk for trourist information like map, guide, comfortable sofa, nice desk lady, I had several time at midnight asking question, the Front Desk Manager (men, forgot the name) is really helpful, like asking for help how to make the free wifi working on my Galaxy Note, where to buy cigarette........ 3. Room : a - Room is small and you can say nice. The most important to me is the TV and music player, my one is not Ipod, but the have the clock radio which can put my Galaxy Note to play my own music. TV have not much channel but enough for a tried night when you fell very sleepy, they don't have much movie channel also music channel. The movie Channel is AMC and HBO, movie was old and boring. b - The bed is very comfortable, they have 4 pillow and it's also comfortable, the bed also have a long and big cushion and it occupied my bed a 1/3 portion so I just put it away. c - The bathroom is dated, bath tub have some dirty spot, the amenities like shampoo, conditioner, is not really plenty, and the most weird thing is they don't have hair dryer ~!! On Feb 24 Friday night when I arrrived from Virginia to NYC at 5:30pm, strong wind and crazy rain make me all wet even my hair, and they don't have HAIR DRYER !!! and the room have coffee and tea complimentary but I can't found the water even the water bolier, and there have no mini bar so I need to go to near supermarket at 3am to buy a can of beer! d - When I want to have hair dryer I call front desk and they send me hair dryer and water within 15 mins. At least I don't need to wait a long time with my wet and dirty hair, and I want to sleep very much! e - The view of the room is different from the site I saw. I got a room on 1616 (16/F), left and right side window is facing the back or roof or window of other building, no city view. f - When I asking is there any business center or the place which provide internet service, and they show me the business center but charges is expensive. g - For sleeping, the room is quiet , no noise to disturb you, and there have a nice mirror which stick on the bathroom door so when you close the bathroom door the whole door mirror will be the part of the room's wall. So lucky my bed is not facing the mirror or I can't get in sleep. 4. Awful thing : When I come back at midnight want to go to washroom, I found the washroom at lobby end the toilet bowl is full of pp and lot of tissue, floor is not clean, the whole washroom is very dirty, how can it happen on a Hilton Hotel????!!!!!! 5. Front desk staff : When I want to add one more night on Monday, the lady of front desk help me to check price, she give me a good advise that if book in the front desk they can make it for me without problem but the price is US$199 (not including tax), and the price I booked from Agoda on site is US$169, so she told me book on site if want to get the same price. On the whole the staff of this hotel is friendly and helpful. But some facilities like the lobby washroom is awful, the room should be get everything really before the tourist move in, The bathroom is look very nice little bit older, and the bath tub look not really decent, I think hair dryer is the MUST HAVE ITEM in the bathroom, the advantage of the room is lot of adapter for charging. So I can charge my camera and Galaxy Note. Totally this hotel not bad for the price US$169 from Feb 24 to 26, But now I checked it already turn to US$299. I won't move in for this price. Lot of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Tough one to review - poor room but better than expected location and service”
Reviews.Author: section
Reviews.Content: Extremes in several categories. The location was a pleasant surprise since it's close to Grand Central but on a quiet street. Service at check-in and breakfast was prompt and friendly. The biggest negative was I did not get the King I asked for and ended up with 2 twin beds. I was immediately offered breakfast vouchers and a King when it became available. Friendly service. Now that twin room had a shower with no tub or partition of any kind. In such a small bathroom it just meant every shower made the floor wet all over. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfiest bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: Twigs31
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at this hotel. Was in a perfect location for visiting all New Yorks attractions. It had the comfiest beds I have ever slept in and the coffee machine in the room was a great touch. We were here at the time of hurricane Irene and all the staff were really helpful at keeping us informed on what was going on and extending our stay. We had a problem with a leak through our ceiling from the room above and we were moved instantly with no fuss and received free breakfast for the inconvenience. This will definitely be my first choice for a New York hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Mandy J
Reviews.Content: My mom and I take a girls weekend trip to NYC every other year or so and usually stay at the Hyatt above Grand Central. We decided to stay here this time because I could get the Hilton points. We were extremely pleased with the switch! The staff was extremely accommodating, especially the manager Tessa Marie, who let us check in early and even upgraded our room. The room was relatively small, but more than adequate. Besides, who spends much time in their room during a vacation to NYC? The hotel bar was a little pricey, but that's pretty par for the course for hotel bars. The location is great. We'd definitely stay here again and recommend others do the same!

Reviews.Title: “Service is good, rooms very small”
Reviews.Author: Brian R
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, the rooms are very small even for NY standards. Breakfast staff is terrible, I have stayed here many times and the staff at breakfast is aggressive and not very helpful. Don't get up to go to the bathroom, you come back and your food is gone, happened twice. I take the 1,000 points instead of breakfast at this hotel. The front desk staff is great, very friendly, the Concierge could use ampersonality, when you say good morning you get a grunt back in return. Overall not a bad place to stay, very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: RevenueManager78
Reviews.Content: Great location and quiet the staff was super friendly - rooms are small but it is NYC. Lobby has free WIFI and a nice seating area - breakfast was good - staff was too helpful just needed some quiet time. This is a great Hilton super clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price & location”
Reviews.Author: Soonerguy99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Manhattan East, stayed on 3/2 to 3/4. Hotel staff was nice and helpful. For Manhattan, you cannot beat the room size. The bathroom was not crammed like other hotels in Midtown. WiFi is free in the lobby for hotel guest (charge for in room though). There is a bar and restaurant on site (didn't eat at the hotel so I cannot comment on the food). You are 2/3 blocks away from the subway station at Grand Central so you can go anywhere in the city in just a short walk. I would rate the hotel at a 3 star, but for the location/price you really can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: zeke0405
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure about this hotel based on some of the reviews, but it was outstanding in all areas. Upgraded to a very nice sized suite (For NYC standards) room 2013. Queen suite. Room service was fast, about 15 minutes for a well prepared club sandwich. So fast, that the fries were still hot. Front desk went out of their way to accomodate any request and despite what some have written, the service in the bar couldn't have been freindlier or more attentive. Not cheap - about $270/night, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotelb for a short business trip”
Reviews.Author: Khaled7691
Reviews.Content: On a 2 day business trip, having travelled all the way from Kuwait, I looked for a quiet place. The hotel location was good. The friendly staff in the front desk, resturant, concierge and even the maintainace guys made my stay tolerable. Unfortunately I was given a room next to a fire door, you can imagine the slamming of the door every so often waking me up during my rest. If it wasn't for this incinvience and a couple of bedbug bites it would have been a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Hilton?”
Reviews.Author: rhartogs
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in we were told that two beds were not available, but only a queen. So we asked for a roll-away, which was an additional $30. We took the small elevator up to the 9th floor of the south tower and had a feeling we were in for a small room when the hallways were very narrow. I hope other floors are wider, as I am not sure how a wheel chair can comfortably fit through. Upon entering our room, 908, an instant odor of urine started to pierce our noses. We called the front desk and they were able to put is in room 925. Both rooms were small, 925 a touch bigger. My $30 roll-away did not come with blankets or a pillow. I just slept in an extra shirt, but wished I called to get one, I was cold when I woke up. We had two angles of views or brick. I value Hilton as a good brand of hotel, and this was definitely not of Hilton Quality. The positive. The bathroom and shower were good, as were the soaps. The staff was nice and helpful. The lobby was nice, not big, but comfortable. $50 to park is cheaper than a lot of other places in mid-town, so to me, that isn't bad for a Manhattan hotel. If you need to drive to Queens or Long Island, the Queens Mid-town tunnel is very close and easy to get to. I will not stay at this hotel again and recommend no one to it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: IMWITHBOB
Reviews.Content: About the price and size you'd expect for NYC - a lot for a little but it was comfortable and clean. Great location within walking distance of lots to do and see. First problem was being told at check in that the type of room we reserved, paid for and confirmed twice before heading into the city (smoking with a king size bed) was not available. We were offered a room with a balcony which wouldn't have been so bad had it not been 20 degrees outside. Second problem ...A loud bang approx. every 15 minutes I'm assuming from the heat - after the first 5 or 6 hours I got use to it. (Yes I'm being sarcastic) Internet was available for $15 and ran veryyyyy veryyyyy slowwwwww. Lastly - and this may sound petty to some - but we didn't get robes.... On a positive note - the bed was very comfortable. Would we stay again? Eh.....it wasn't great - it wasn't horrible - it was average....and average isn't something I'd expect from a Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, near Grand Central”
Reviews.Author: JBCol
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times since it became a Hilton in 2010 (the NY office of my company is nearby) I have always found it to be clean, comfortable with very good service each time I stay here. (Excellent, fast room service, a great cheeseburger and fries for nights when you are too tired to leave the room!) Some rooms are on the small side so try and upgrade if you can, though since becoming an Honors Member, I've found they usually put me in a better room upon check in anyway. Hotel is very charming (not a mega Hotel as you may see elsewhere) and has a boutique, personal feel to it. I highly recommend it. Note, this hotel is off 2nd avenue, Midtown East is extremely quiet after business hours so you won't find many shops or activities open at night. However, it's a short walk to Grand Central and many subway lines. I've always had a very very pleasant experience at the hotel and it has become my hotel of choice when Im in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit pricy”
Reviews.Author: leegoffin54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Christmas and New Year. The location is good and is walking distance of most attractions Our room was on the 12th floor and all 3 lifts were fast. The room was a bit small but the bed was really comfortable. I expected it to be noisy but it wasn't. There was coffee making facilities but we did have to ask for extra coffee as there was only enough for 2 cups. There was also a cleaners strike while we were there so maybe that's why just the bed was made but towels were not replaced and the bin not emptied. The bar and restaurant were ok but expensive. We had a beer and a glass of wine and it was $19. Over the road at MacFaddens the same drinks were $8. We had one meal in the restaurant but considering it was Christmas, not much was done in the way of a festive menu and what we did have was expensive and also you pay tax on top of the bill. We ate out after this including breakfast. There are numerous good restaurants and coffee shops all over New York. I would stay here again for the comfy bed and location but wouldn't eat here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Be Serious”
Reviews.Author: rodioCT
Reviews.Content: Went here for 2 days with my brother who came from Houston. When I got to the hotel, he was already out and about. I was surprised to see the room only had one bed even though he had requested two doubles. So small that I could just about use the restroom and open the door at the same time...Small Small Small and it was $615 for two day stay. Even though I am an Silver Hilton Honors member, it meant nothing. They charge $15/day for Internet and forget hooking up your laptop or any other HDMI, USB, or S-Video cable device to the TV...It wont work because HiltonEast has ensured those connections have been disabled. So on to breakfast buffet the next morning. We arrived about 10am for buffet and the attendant tells us the hotel has changed the time on brkfst and will be shutting it down in 15 mins. So hurry and get your food. Needless to say, I had one plate and my brother had one plate. When I got the check, it was $66. Parking is $51/day @ the garage for the hotel...In some states, that is the cost of the hotel room. Oh, and by the way, I also ordered room service. When I called the number, no one answered, so I called the front dest and was told someone would call me right away. I had to call them both back after 20 mins. It took another 15 to actually order my food and another 30 for delivery. There is also no vending machines in this hotel, so make sure if u have rm svc, you order a soda(another joke) 10 oz for $5. They will also tell u to call the front desk to have your plate picked up bc the hallway is too small to place them out in it. I am a former NY'er and it gets more rediculous with every visit. I now live in Connecticut. Pros: It's in Manhattan; Free Internet in Lobby Cons: Over-priced, not such a great location, no parking($51/day), no view, slow service, super expensive, No perks for Honors members, Tiny rooms, No ventilation in bathroom, no HDMI connections, Pay per View for Internet($15/day)

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Relaxseeker
Reviews.Content: Kind staff, great location, good price. We stayed for a weekend, I am a New York regular and always hunting for a good priced hotel since I try to visit 3 to 5 times a year, I found this hotel and I thought when I reserved that it was to good to be true, and it was true. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Martinpasdecheveux
Reviews.Content: close by from Grand Central (5-10 min walk) and Times squares (15 Min walk) this is a good hotel and the price was decent considering downtown Clean and well Managed, Staff helpfull will be going back and would defenately recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Ten Good Hotel Staffers -WELL LED- Are Worth a Hundred - Without a Head!”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: Speaking of WELL LED.... the General Manager/TEAM LEADER at this property is: Mr. David Cohen. His Lobby Meet & Greet/Check IN/Check OUT people are: the friendly/helpful/efficient Team of Kevin L. , Cristina B., Jade C. at the Front Desk, the Affable Doorman/Cab Hailer, the Fine Chefs/Breakfast Servers at the Lobby Restaurant, the diligent, pleasant Housekeeping Person, the friendly Bellman checking IN luggage of DEPARTING Guests so they could sight-see NYC, hands-free, and the knowledgeable-informative Concierge...David!. Lobby ambience was OK. Check in was a smooth, seamless process thanks to Cristina. An Upgrade was available and provided. A short walk to the elevator took me past the well-equipped room-keyed Business Center. Elevator service was quick, and my room was easy to find. There was no city view but the room, though a bit "old", was good. King bed, big pillows, fresh sheets, Pull Out couch, chairs, table, flat panel - HDTV, working, unblocked, sink and shower, fresh towels, toilitries, roomy closet, enough hangers, two windows, room safe, working thermostat, phones, room lights, and alarm clock made up the features of this very clean room.. Buffet Breakfast/Pleasant Servers = Very Good. THe Toaster was slow but...so what?! The food was good! Framed NYC Views Photo Graphics added a nice touch to Lobby wall space. Mr. Kevin L. was quite helpful before my departure wih good site and HHonors information for future stays. Ms Jade did an efficient/accurate check out. I was impressed by her questions: "How was your stay?" and "Do you think you will stay here again?" It was my first experience in having a Front Desk person go after repeat business, so nicely, that my only answers were Yes and Yes! Conclusion: Long after the type of room , view, hi floor/lo floor aspects of one's stay are forgotten...the memory of the people working at the property remains. Pleasant, caring, cooperative, empowered hotel staffers with good attention to detail, I believe, almost guarantee a Guest's return - often. A lot of credit has to go to the excellent Staff Training, and Outstanding Leadership of Management at the Hilton Manhattan East Hotel! A happy combination of well-maintained facilities/well-trained, professional staff /affordable pricing all made for a good stay. Obviously, I was delighted that I selected this particular New York City Hilton property. AND...Yes...I would/will go back! I have no problem recommending this Hotel to my friends/family/associates/customers. :) Bill McCue, Master Cruise Counsellor * TRAVEL MATTERS INC. - "because YOUR travel...Matters!" - <travelmattersinc@aol.com> C: 205.276.7500.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankLisaNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is very nice and the staff tried to be very accommodating. The king room in which we stayed the MLK weekend was nice with a small sitting area off to one side. The room looks typical of some of the older Manhattan hotels. The three windows on different sides was excellent. We had a problem with the room safe which maintenance tried to fix but could not. We were offered another room but with a queen-size bed. We elected to stay in the room. Our only issue with room was the chilly bathroom. It was OK when taking a shower or bath, but during the night, it was too cold. The bar was good with a number of other people in our age group (50s). We had breakfast in the restaurant, which was good but not exceptional. We have stayed in five Hilton properties in Manhattan over the last few years and while this hotel in very nice it is not favorite. The rooms pale compared to the New York Hilton, where we usually stay. Our biggest issue with Manhattan East is the location. The area, known as Tutor City, is too residential for us. The one nice thing about the location is its proximity to Grand Central Terminal. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a quiet part of Manhattan, this would be a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, unique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: UpInTheAir80
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and both times were pleasant and uneventful. The first time I was upgraded to a suite (gotta love gold status) with a sitting area. This past time I had a nice room, a bit small, with a king size bed. The bathrooms have a tricky shower to operate but the water pressure is great. I didn't experience any issues with the hotel elevators which some other reviewers mentioned. I like the location because it's close to my office but I can see how some people might find it a bit off the beaten path. Hotels in NYC seem to have better prices in the winter and that's how I ended up at the Hilton Manhattan East, a good cheap rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: Pppancake5
Reviews.Content: Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square / 5th Avenue, yet close enough to walk to the main midtown area within 10 minutes along 42nd St. The best thing about this hotel is its position. The room was very nice with a comfortable bed, large TV and spacious bathroom, however you will be lucky to get a good view. Some staff let the establishment down; one of the front desk staff had a bad attitude and an annoying black taxi that was allowed to wait outside all day hasselling guests for spare cigarettes (a word of advice, yellow taxis are much cheaper). However, these were the only downsides. The restaurant was very quiet, the food exceptional (I recommend the steak). Room service was also prompt and tasty. Overall I would 100% recommend this hotel, for its convenience, comfort and the price was not too bad for Midtown Manahattan.

Reviews.Title: “No heater in 20 below weather”
Reviews.Author: ccb630
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but I think all should be warned!!! I'm so glad I only stayed here one night because I don't think I could have lasted another. My room temperature didn't reach anything above 64 degrees and my bathroom was so cold I could see my breath. How is the possible on the coldest day of winter no operating heater. On top of that there wasn't any additonal rooms I could switch into. I had to sleep in snow boots and my heavy outerwear jacket. Not fun when you have to brush your teeth in a hat and scarf.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good choice near the U.N.”
Reviews.Author: Hikemeister
Reviews.Content: I'll get the cons out of the way first. 1) The elevators are tiny (but fast and efficient). 2) The rooms are tiny (We were on the 7th floor, and I was looking at the floor plan described on the escape map on the back of the door, and our room was one of the biggest on the floor, and it was small, but the room was nice, the bathroom fairly spacious considering the size of the room, and the tub was very big). 3) They charge $20 for a portable fridge (The upside is that it is a one time fee, so one day is $20 total, 20 days also $20 total, so in that way not so bad). 4) The ice machines are on three of the twenty or so floors. Now the pros. 1) This is a great eating part of town. All along 2nd Avenue, especially heading uptown, there are dozens of restaurants. 2) Delis nearby. 3) Grand Central and all of its subway and train connections are 5 minutes walk away (And the best subway lines in NYC, in my opinion... the 4,5,6, and the Times Square Shuttle). 4) The bar has good beer on tap. 5) The bell staff is particularly friendly. 6) The UN is literally around the corner. 7) Times Square is straight away on 42nd Street about 15 minutes walk. And if you are willing to walk, the Empire State Building, Macy's, Broadway shows, Rockefeller, St. Patrick's, MoMA, Central Park, the New York City Public Library building and Bryant Park, 5th Avenue shopping, and a bunch of other stuff are all within about 15-20 minutes walk max. So, it's a good alternative to being right at Times Square (which we've always found tends to suck you into its vortex and keep you from hitting everything else) but still hanging in Midtown. Others we spoke to felt that this was a very good location as well, because the neighborhood is so localized (the locals are the ones in the eateries, delis, bars, etc.). The downside to being in hotels that are closer to Times Square is that the touristy factor increases exponentially with each step toward Broadway and 45th. 8) The WiFi was free. 9) The room, a corner room in our case, was quiet in terms of hotel noise (Manhattan is always noisy so one can blame that on the hotel). 10) If you pull out all of the stops, AAA, advance purchase, etc., it's not too bad on the wallet for a respectable Midtown hotel. 11) Everything is clean and everything functions correctly. So, the verdict is... we would definitely give them another shot in the future if the price remains competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: aceface77
Reviews.Content: The hotel had just been taken over by hilton prior to our stay. The rooms was very small but well equipped and also an extremely comfy bed and a great coffee machine. There was a bar on the ground floor which was very pricey that also served food which was also on the expensive side. The location of the hotel is fantastic, literally 2 minute walk to the UN buildings and also just a few blocks from the stunning chrysler building. Seeing that every time i left the hotel in the morning was worth the price alone. Also close to grand central station and times square. Also enjoyed the free newspapers every day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: muleman95
Reviews.Content: I didn't know anything about manhattan and the only reason I booked this hotel was that there was a great deal on a website on cyber monday. The location was awesome. We were only a few blocks from Grand Central Station, where you could take the subway just about anywhere. Overall it was very clean, quiet, and we were very happy with our stay. The room (615) was very nice. Small, but not terrible. It was very clean and quiet. For some reason there was a doorbell on our room. I was a little worried that would be tempting for kids in the middle of the night but no one rang it (it did work..I had to try it). There was no view, right next to another building. The concierge was very friendly and helpful with directions. Was pretty disappointed that the wi-fi cost $14.95 for 24 hours of use and the business center charged for use of the internet as well. There is a starbucks just down the road that has free wi-fi and is open until 9 p.m., go there. We hung out in the bar/lounge one evening to get a game plan for our days in NYC. Service in the lounge is incredibly slow and expensive. We ordered a cheap beer and a hot tea and it was $14. But if you are in New York I don't think you plan on spending a lot of tiem in a hotel lounge, so I don't think this is a big deal. If you can get this hotel for around $200 I think it is a good deal in NY, but I've seen them trying to charge upwards of $400...probably not worth that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but check the bill when checking”
Reviews.Author: b_carette
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from Oct 29th to November 5th. The hotel is nice but we had to pay the last full night even without using the room as we had a flight departure at midnight and needed to be at the airport at 9pm and left the hotel at noon. We informed both the hotel and the travel agency at our arrival that it was not normal to pay for a night we would not spend at the hotel. But they sent us back and forth between the hotel managers and the travel agency, to finally end up in a dead end, the hotel team pretending to have been informed at the last minute (which is not exact as we noticed the problem during check in and talked to multiple hotel people to try to solve it) and not being able to rent again the room. Nice room but very bad client service, to not say more, to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Not a boutique hotel, not an impressive hotel, not really a renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: helios5356
Reviews.Content: This location is listed on the Hilton website as the "boutique"--it sounded interesting as it was recently renovated. We wanted to try the Midtown East neighborhood, so we binged out our HHonors points, looking forward to a distinctive experience. We have stayed at nearly all the New York Hilton properties and are proud to be Diamond members. The hotel appears not to be really renovated--okay, the carpet, furniture and bedding are Hilton standard issue. But the archaic lighting controls are mostly broken and hard to use. The plumbing is noisy, low water pressure in the bath, HVAC is slow to adjust and the housekeeping was spotty. We observed old clothing tags and dust balls (as we were looking for a lost earring). The lighting in the breakfast room is too low for reading, but the food and service are adequate. There is a charge for the business center computers, 35 cents/minute. To be sure, computer speed is fast, but then, this room is not a Hilton operation--the computers are subbed out to a provider who gladly charges your credit card. The staff are nice-and forthcoming. One ride in the elevator with the maintenance technician revealed, "the heating pipes are old" and hard to modulate. We graded this Poor based on the promise of boutique charm and experience which did not deliver. The old feeling undersized rooms, the paint runs and the tile and grout gaps point to a renovation that was lacking comprehension and execution.

Reviews.Title: “bit tired, 80's look and feel.”
Reviews.Author: andrewv45
Reviews.Content: disappointing - bit tired. service at check in poor. uninterested. room was actually a decent size for nyc. downstairs bar and breakfast room dark and expensive. need try harder hilton

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Terrible hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: terrible_hilton_Manh
Reviews.Content: There are no words to define my disgust with this hotel and the staff! I have been a Gold HHonors member for years and have traveled to countless Hiltons around the world - including those in 3rd world countries - I can say that this is the WORST HILTON EVER! I have never been treated so poorly. The hotel was overbooked and I was made to wait for an hour before being told that room we booked was not available - my wife was then late for a wedding party, where she was speaking at the event - she was visibly upset... not that that matters to this hotel. We were then put in room that we did not reserve and told it was what we had requested (clearly not the case – king suite Vs standard - which was confirmed by manager on duty). One staff member told me that there was one room that we booked still available and then another whispered; “They cannot have that room”. Sarcastic staff that speaks down to customers – doesn’t the customer come first? Management is worse than the employees - they really know how to ensure that you will not be back spending more time complaining that I was rude than dealing with clear issues at their hotel.They would not honor the change in the room costs seeing that we booked a suite and we were given a standard room. We pre-paid online and then they proceeded to charge me again 3 days after my stay on my Hilton card! When I got upset with how I was treated they accused me of being the rude one… imagine! I am a loyal customer to the businesses that treat me well. All I can say is GOODBYE HILTON - HELLO STARWOOD! This will go for my friends and family as well. And my wife chooses the hotels her company stays at (a Fortune 500 company) and will ensure that no Hiltons are on the list.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: labsnabys
Reviews.Content: Having been told by someone "in the know" in the NYC hotel scene that this was not your average Hilton and the rooms had been renovated, I was expecting something better than what we got -- especially for the price. While the building itself seems interesting and the lobby attractively decorated, our room was what I would call "just okay." It was as small as I expected for a New York hotel room, but offered no indication of any "renovation." The room was not particularly clean, and the bathroom especially so. The floor looked as if it hadn't been properly mopped in ages, with dirt buildup along baseboards and in corners, and mold growing behind the door near the tub. It was nice to have a fairly spacious tub/shower, but I found the faucet control to be an overly complicated contraption. The room's lighting controls (little multi-button control panels) looked like something that was considered "space age" in the 1950s, and half of them were broken and inoperable. The smoke detector was missing with bare wires hanging from its spot on the ceiling. Maybe it was torn out the night before our arrival when we heard a power failure caused smoke alarms to go off willy-nilly? Stayed one night Dec. 8th...would not return due to the numerous nicer and less expensive options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: Sheila K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at this hotel for our 30th Wedding Anniversary. We were given a king suite which was a lovely room on the forth floor. The room was a good size with small seating area very clean, The staff were freindly, if not slow at the bar !. Our trip was going well until Wed 7 Dec when at 11.30pm our smoke alarm started to ring, we called reception and were told that they were working on it but it was the whole hotel. At 3.30am my husband gave up and tried to contact reception again but no lights were working and the lifts were also not working. Told eventually again they were working on it. We were due to check out on Thu 8th at 12 noon. In the monring we found we had no hot water and still no communication from the hotel staff (very dissapointing! ) we walked down a very dark utility staircase to find out that they planned to rebute the systems about 12.30 which would put everything off for an hour then everything would be back to normal. Therfore we had to check out at 13.00 with no offer of keeping a room to allow us the facility of a shower or some heat for our 22.50 flight back to London . It was very dissapointing for our final evening/ morning to be wrecked with no compensation in any form.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff & a good quality stay overall.”
Reviews.Author: WhiteGatesNewYork
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Manhattan East is on 42nd street and 2nd Avenue, a pretty good location that's close to Grand Central Station. You also get a terrific view of the Chrysler Builder when walking in. The hotel itself is an older building that used to be another hotel (The Crowne Plaza I believe?). So its interior is rather old-fashioned but functional and well looked after. Check-in was good except for one glitch. I'd booked a suite and they didn't have one available (they'd given it to someone else). I was traveling solo so this wasn't a huge deal to me. But the check-in clerk discounted my rate and gave me two free breakfasts and free drinks. I was happy with this resolution to the problem and they were very apologetic. The room was quite small but not bad for New York. It was clean. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was in good condition even if the shower was a bit complicated to use! I also had a really nice view from my window of some interesting old buildings. Housekeeping and all the staff I encountered were friendly and polite. Wireless internet was NOT free. I paid fifteen dollars for it. Free wireless should be standard at all hotels, in my opinion. (Take note of the Andaz brand, Hilton - they give you free wireless and free in-room snacks and drinks!) Overall, a fairly good hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Last Weekend - great hotel and wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Donald A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our three-day weekend in New York City. The Hilton Manhattan East was just the kind of place the doctor ordered. The staff was friendly. Our room was small, cozy, and very clean. The location was perfect, a few blocks from the heavily trafficked area. The doorman gave us a referral to a few great restaurants including Cantonese food at the Phoenix, just down the street. Everything was perfect and we plan to return next year. D.A. Irvine, California

Reviews.Title: “Great NY Neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Frank-Lisa
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a week stay in the Hilton Manhattan East on a recent holiday. This charming 1920's hotel is located in Tudor City, a lovely heritage neighbourhood on 42nd St. The location is convenient, two blocks from Grand Central but in a quiet area. We stayed in the one bedroom suite which was very spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was large and well maintained (shower over bath but that is expected in an older hotel). Bedroom had plenty of space and the living room had comfy sofas and writing desk. Lots of space to store luggage. Bed comfy and air conditioning effective and quiet. The room was spotless and everything was in good working order. We found the room rates very reasonable. Check in and check out were very efficient. Staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly the restaurant and bar staff. What is called a concierge is primarily a booking service for shows and tours. The booking fees are pretty steep so you might be better to book direct with the theatres if you know what you want to see. That said, she was happy to provide maps and give directions and suggestions about local attractions. There are a number of good local restaurants. There is a laundromat that will do 'wash and fold' around the corner in 41st which is very convenient for longer stays. The continental breakfast (which was included as we are Hilton Honors) is a bit limited but served a good range fresh fruit which was nice. Would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “small and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: benikana
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located on 42nd Street near the United Nations. may seem far away for those who think staying near Times Square but is not. I went several times to all sides and you're taking a taxi anywhere in the island in 10 minutes. very easy. hilton room spotless and beds that are excellent. you can be assured at this hotel. agile and quick reception at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Base for NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: Whinbrook
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights here. Room was large and contemporary. Had booked a Junior Suite but this just looked like a large room - maybe that is how they class it here. However, we got a good rate from a consolidator. There was no view - just a brick wall and other bedroom windows in close proximity. We all kept our blinds down (!) so the room was permanently gloomy despite the lovely sunshine outside but it was not a big deal. The bed was a BIG let down. XL king sized which looked good but the mattress was past its best being creaky and with a distinctive sag in the middle. It made for uncomfortable sleep. The bathroom was also disappointing. It was small and a little shabby, the convector heater covering was hanging off (don't they give a check around the rooms here before letting them out?). There must be small cleaners here too because the bathroom was dusty and full of fluff/lint at high level which was unpleasant. We had all other amenities though - large flat screen TV, good coffee maker and quite good towels too. The public areas are smart and modern too if on the small side but this is an old hotel built 1931. All the staff we came across were helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel feels like it is a bit out on a limb but is actually only 5-8 minute walk from Grand Central and a little further to 5th Ave. The UN complex is practically on the door step. I agree with the last reviewer about getting taxis from the hotel. When we wanted to leave for the airport, the bellman said he'd get us a taxi. We were expecting a yellow cab but a black limo was waiting for us. It was all very pleasant, plush and comfortable but the driver got a bit lost in the airport complex looking for our terminal. We were concerned that we would be charged a small fortune for this service but it turned out to be $65 including tip. We paid $51 plus tip when we arrived to get into the city so it cost no more and was much more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but be careful”
Reviews.Author: travelfly79
Reviews.Content: NIce hotel, good location but.... - TV was not working for 2 days. According to the front desk, this was due to an issue at the provider side. It can happen... - Asked for a taxi cab to go to the airport. I was surprised to see that the taxi was not yellow. I asked bellman who told me that this was exactly the same as the taxi. What he forgot to say is that the price was almost twice the price as a normal taxi but this I discovered only when I had to pay at the ariport. Didn't really appreciated that. When I ask for a taxi, I want a taxi...This works in all hotel around the world... but apparently not at Hilton Manhattan east. I would advise all guests not to ask for a taxi there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location ,nice Bar”
Reviews.Author: Jerome D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a private visit of New York, nice location , walking distance to time Sq, located near UN head office, i loved the bar, very friendly Bar Man, Jose. Reception staff very friendly and helpfull, i liked the french speaking bell boy, that advised me great restaurants and Night Clubs with very accurate information. Rooms are nice but too small, internet wifi didnt work very good in my room (pay as you go) but great free wifi near reception . Didnt like the pay Tv , No international tv Chanels only US news chanels in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, quiet room in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Elmer&Lizette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during marathon weekend. Our king room was spacious and even had a balcony. Room was very quiet, beds are comfy. Location is good if you don't need or want to stay in the middle of all the action. The hotel is situated in Tudor city, a nice and quiet neighbourhood just a 20 min walk from times square. It's close to the subway and has a busstop in front of the hotel. Swift check-in. Already made reservations for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: JMCAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with nice sized rooms, but a little pricey for the location, which is pretty far on the East side. The bed was very comfortable and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “NY”
Reviews.Author: atchys101
Reviews.Content: we stayed here with friends from 13th 0ct to 20th oct this year. The hotel was lovely. rooms small but very clean.not much of a view from the hotel room but were that busy during the day didnt do much else but sleep there. Room was very quite. Didnt even hear the thunder storm on the first night! The bed was very very comfortable. The pillows were a delight.Staff were helpful and very pleasant.Even arranging for their own transport to take us to J.F.K. on the day of our departure. Hotel we found was central for everything we needed and did in fact use the chrysler building as the land mark to get us home after a long day out.Friendly pubs just minutes away as well.A good time was had by all.Hoping to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leo263
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little out of the way from the major tourist sites but I enjoyed the walk. It’s just a few blocks from the Chrysler Building and Grand Central Station. Like all New York rooms the room was small but very nice. I didn’t go to New York to hang out in a hotel room so I didn’t care. It was very clean and a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Swanee59
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious, good location, flat screen TV. I even had a balcony. Very good internet connection speed, though they do charge for it ($15). No bar fridge, but they did have an ice machine on each floor and an ice bucket in the room

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, beautiful decor, spacious room and great location”
Reviews.Author: E H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 weeks ago for 7 nights, free wifi in the lobby which was an unexpected bonus. Location is great, nice and quiet and only a 15 minute walk to the madness of Times Square! Book in advance to get a good rate. NY hotels are pricy, we ended up booking one extra night (due to flight change) and had to pay $250.00 as it was only booked the day before. I was impressed with the room size as I have heard that hotel rooms in NY are usually small, I was very pleasantly surprised! Staff were all lovely, friendly, courteous and helpful. Hotel has recently been done up, the only thing that was not, was the bathroom, it was a little bit dated, however, the original marble is absolutely beautiful! It was very clean and a great shower so cannot complain. You get all the handy high quality Hotel toiletries (Peter Thomas Roth) which are my favourite hotel ones! Bar prices are a bit high, but I guess this is just the norm. Don't forget that tax is added to every price you see in New York, you are always quoted the base price. :-)

Reviews.Title: “A frightening level of neglect”
Reviews.Author: LB2502
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Manhattan East while in NYC to run in the 2011 Urbanathlon. As this hotel was right near the subway line I needed to take out to my race, I thought that booking a room would ensure my ability to get a good night's rest before a very important morning. I have a severe feather allergy-- I will very quickly experience symptoms when around anything down-filled, including getting headaches that can greatly impair my vision. I called the hotel TWICE before my reservation, in order to make sure that they were able to provide a feather-free room. TWICE. I arrived at the hotel, quickly dropped my stuff off in the room and went right back out the door for dinner. When I returned a couple hours later, I immediately checked the pillows to make sure that my requests had been honored. Nope-- 4 down-filled pillows, and I was already feeling it. I called the desk, very politely explained that I had a severe feather allergy and that I had called ahead to make arrangements-- the woman at the front desk apologized and sent someone right up. I asked her specifically if anything else in the room was down-filled, and she told me no. I take a shower, start feeling terrible, and realize that the entire comforter on the bed is down filled. I threw it into the hallway and called the front desk again, this time not so patiently. I ended up with an excruciating headache which lasted me through the first half of my race, and the situation could have been so much worse if I hadn't learned not to trust the employees of this hotel. I cannot believe how flippant this hotel is when it comes to VERY SERIOUS allergies. Can't wait until they get their first (well deserved) lawsuit. Also, when I brought all of this to the manager's attention, I hardly even received an apology. That is not how you treat guests, especially longstanding loyal ones, and I can honestly say I would never set foot in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Check in”
Reviews.Author: Skier1966
Reviews.Content: I had reservation for 2 rooms, with 2 beds in each. When checking in, they informed me that they only had 1 2bed room. Insisted I take room with pull out sofa. When I refused, manager got snotty. I advised her to find another property with 2 beds and she was unable to. I then suggested that she should just provide a third room and she flatly refused. Had to telephone Diamond desk to get them to intervene. Finally she provided third room after waiting more than half hour. Not the service I would expect after staying 150 nights a year for many years. And rooms very small.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: el323
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HIlton Manhattan East for 4 nights with family. It's a very nice hotel within walking distance of most major attractions but far enough( 20 mins) from Times Square to avoid the crowds and noise for a good nights sleep.Rates were reasonable for a city hotel , the staff were very helpful and friendly and we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kariMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: We walked everywhere from this hotel. Not cool to go when the UN is in session, as every street is blocked off, but we had a great time anyway. Rooms are very small and we looked right at a brick wall, but it's NY, so who spends time in the room anyway?? Great service. Worth the $ to be in Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “My first time in New York was made more memorable because I stayed in Hilton Manhattan East.”
Reviews.Author: fleridavlabanon
Reviews.Content: I went to New York last Sept. 05, 2011 and stayed at Hilton Manhattan East. I went there to attend a conference held at the UN Headquarters inManhattan. Due to the proximity of the hotel to the UN Headquarters, it was easy for me to keep with my schedules. The Hotel personnel were courteous and helpful. It is really a place if you want convenience. It could have been perfect if not for their failure to process the release of credit card as guarantee when I made my reservsations. We paid our account in cash 2 days before we checked out. Kindly facilitate release of my card. I cannot use it because of your omission. My name is MS.FLERIDA V. LABANON. We checked in on Sept. 05, 2011 and checkout Sept. 10, 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: jen h
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the Hilton Manhattan East. While not a luxury hotel by any means, the hotel was just fine for an individual or family planning to spend most of their time away from their hotel room. Frankly, my spouse and I booked this room since we were having trouble finding anything under $300 in Manhattan. We wanted something safe and clean and felt confident that a Hilton could satisfy these requirements. Aside from that, we had no demands or expectations. We were very surprised to a find a well-appointed room with a very comfortable bed, flat-screen TV, large bathtub and nice bathroom toiletries. Even more surprisingly, I could not hear street traffic even though we were on the second floor! The room was definitely tight- you better like your travel companion- but this is to be expected in NYC. I liked the layout of the floor; I never heard passerby in the halls or noise from the elevators. The gym is free and is open 24 hours, accessible with your room key. There are 2 treadmills, an eliptical machine, weights and water/towels. I appreciated the perfect temperature in the gym! Minor complaints include housekeeping coming despite our request that our room not be serviced and TVs not working on the gym treadmills. For $190 a night, I am willing to put up with those deficiencies. The hotel is just a few blocks from the Grand Central subway station, making to travel to both uptown and downtown very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Constantine-TA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hilton Manhattan East over the long weekend in October 2011. It's a reasonably priced hotel, located 5-7 minutes away on foot from the Grand Central. It's a little out of the way but close to both subway and several bus stops. A CVS shop is a block away. Our room (902) was very comfortable and clean. Bathroom was pretty big. The carpet needs some cleaning though as it smelled a little musty. Both breakfast and internet were included in the rate, which was great! I would recommend this hotel for a short-term trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “First room was terrible, Second room was nice”
Reviews.Author: Kathlyne
Reviews.Content: The first room was supposed to be a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor. The room reeked so badly of smoke that my eyes started watering within minutes. We opened the windows (a nice feature of the terrible room), but it didn't help. The TV didn't work, and the clock wasn't plugged in. We went back to the lobby and asked for another room. The staff was apologetic and immediately gave us a new room. The new room was much better. It was in the back of the hotel, so it was also much quieter. The elevator is small--if you care about that. The hotel is pretty far east. 0.3 miles from Grand Central Terminal according to Google. I didn't mind the walk at all. We walked up to Ess-a-Bagel for a real NYC bagel. It was great (after a long wait in line). All in all the hotel was fine, it was just our experience with the first room, which was terrible. We couldn't have stayed in that room. I my eyes were watering so much I was crying and my eyes became bloodshot. No way was that a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: polkadotsprinkles
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel which also included breakfast. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful at the front desk as well as, in restaurant where we had breakfast every morning. The rooms are a bit small but its what I would expect in the Manhattan. They looked newly renovated and were very clean. Another benefit to this hotel is the great location. It was my first trip to New York and won't be my last. I'll definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but let down by lack of free/cheap WiFi and room faults”
Reviews.Author: Andy N
Reviews.Content: Our Family and 2 friends stayed here in August for 3 nights. Very nice building, rooms were clean and functional. The bar prices are a bit on the expensive side, but then again everything in NYC is over-priced. What lost a rating point and lets this place down was the fact that there is no Free WiFi, or even reasonably priced access. Every other Hotel I've stayed in in New York has had free or very cheap WiFi, Here you had to use the business centre or pay what I consider an extortionate amount for daily access. I'm not sure if this is just this Hotel or the policy of the Hilton Group It 2011 !, Internet access should be a basic service in ALL hotels. It's as vital as clean towels or coat hangers ! As we were visiting from the UK, having access to Twitter and Facebook is a vital way of communicating with relatives and friends, even looking up and booking things in New York. As such it was actually cheaper to use data roaming on our smartphones for the short periods we needed access rather than pay for the WiFi. Our friends had several problems with their room which had to be reported more than once to get anything done, so a point lost on service. Overall, everything else about the hotel is fine, it's in a good location on 42nd St and an easy 15 min walk to Grand Central and Times Square but located far enough away to be quiet and away from the crowds. Rooms were clean, Tea and Coffee facilities, Large Flat-screen TV and In-room Safe. Staff were not un-pleasant, but were not exactly full of smiles either.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very average, staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: Cinthom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline's Negotiator. Considering the price we paid per night, $150, it was a great deal. With that being said, I would not consider this a four star hotel which it was portrayed to be. The front desk staff, bell men, and concierge were wonderful. Our maid service could have been better - two days without wash towels, coffee station was not filled, etc. Minor details for the great price. The beds and pillows are wonderful. Our view, from the 5th floor was roof tops of other buildings. The location is within 5 walking minutes to Grand Central Station which is nice if you are a subway rider. The room was very small and so was the elevator as other reviewers had warned. There was also some loud, clunking noise in the ceiling evertime the air turned on....I just think this place is old. Just wanted people that might be paying full price to not be disappointed with what is billed as a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Paul L
Reviews.Content: Great location, just 15 minutes walking to Time SQ. Hotel, friendly and welcoming. Clean and tidy. WIFI, free but just in lobby area. Breakfast good, but expensive, would recommend you eat where the local eats, cheaper and gives you a great NY experience

Reviews.Title: “United Nations Area”
Reviews.Author: NOAAtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the UN, Grand Central Station, and Times Square. The price is high but considered normal for Manhattan. There's a couple of Irish Pubs within a block as well as a 24 hour Dunkin Donut. The staff were all very professional and gracious. Use the complimentary internet in the lobby as it costs ~ $15/day in your room. The rooms were nice, a little small, with no view. The exercise room was average. If I have business at the UN, I'd probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: MrsPDartford
Reviews.Content: I booked this relying heavily on the Hilton Brand. I know some reviews have been negative but this is our family opinion. Excellent value for money. We did an 'e standby' request and upgraded to a one bed suite which was perfect as our 16yr old daughter had the 'living room' ie bed tv and washbasin and my husband and I had our own room with the bathroom which had a whirlpool (basic) bath. We could see the river from one window and the back of the public library ( i think) from the other. It is a bit tired I will accept but by no means unacceptable. Clean and wonderful bed ( I spent 5 years working in and out of hotels so think I can give a balanced view ) extra pillows when asked for. Reception staff wonderful; both in and out. Even let me print off my boarding cards! Just friendly and genuinely 'nice'. Nice restaurants around, pleasant walk around the block afterwards around the UN building. Didn't use restaurant so can't comment but lounge looked snug and inviting; daughter used free wifi. Paid for wifi in room for one day, I think 24hrs @ $15 not bad. Summary; Good value for money, lovely room, good location right near Grand Central Station, lovely staff (all of them) and I really hope this review means something positive as I am the first to complain - No complaints here! Memory - waking up in the morning and making coffee in the room ( not the best machine so I guess a gripe but a tiny one ) and sitting talking waiting for teenager to wake up in the next room ready for a heavy day in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Worked!!!”
Reviews.Author: sedch
Reviews.Content: The hotel met my needs. It was an easy check in, the room was clean, quiet and had quality personal care amenities. I didnt utilize anything but the room, but common areas appeared clean and in good condition. The location is just a couple blocks from Grand Central and your access to anything in Manhattan. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: angusbtp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel from 09/09/2011 till 13/09/2011 during 9/11period. I am a retired London Police Officer and I have stayed in many Hotels in New York during 9/11, and many years prior to 9/11, with my wife. This is a very good Hotel at the best end of 42nd Steet. This was my first stay and I asked for a quiet room, knowing how noisy the traffic can be. They gave me a room in the quiet zone which overlooks some brownstone buildings, but I have to say there was no noise. Nice bedrooms and bathrooms and the staff were very helpfull and pleasant. Room rate for 60+ for that period was 199$ per night plus taxes ,sounds expensive, but for those who have been to n.y.c. this is a good rate. Lots of nice eating places nearby but visitors must try the food court at Grand Central Station. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place in a Not So Nice City”
Reviews.Author: Phrumph
Reviews.Content: A nice stay, but after garaging the car we found getting anywhere after is impossible. Went to Andrea Bocelli's Central Park by Subway, since the Cabs screen where your go to suit themselves, not the visitors. Had to loose a prepaid 3 course dinner because Bellhops and us could not get a crosstown cab and then not get one to Central Park. I WILL NEVER GO TO NYC AGAIN. Oh and in the morning one cab got us to the Empire State Building, but the hack on the way back really took us for a ride at twice the cost of getting there. We also tried to see the 911 Memorial and there is no parking, or 22.00 for the hour we would have needed. NYC is extortion and not raising tolls, and ordered to issue more tickets. What a mess of a town. STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “We will go back”
Reviews.Author: Miriam_x_chu
Reviews.Content: Definitely, we will go back to the hotel. It was great location to take train and walking distance to Times Square. Everything our family needed was there. The hotel is aged but it was well maintained and we had pleasant stay. Yes, you could get nice Hilton ocean front property in the Hawaii for that price but it is New York. This was most moderate price of Hilton I could find in the Manhattan. The hotel serves free Starbucks coffee and fruits in the morning. For the price I paid, I think it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: howrunow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Manhaton East. Great service, location is perfect. Rooms small but very clean. Nice breakfast each morning was included in price.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel with excellent service and extremely comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: NERoth
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical Hilton. The hotel was converted but retains its historical character. The room I got would have slept five comfortably. It was quite elegant and fully updated. The staff (including the concierge and the front desk) was very helpful. The hotel is smaller than most Hiltons and benefits substantially from the calm atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay in Midtown!”
Reviews.Author: djh5723
Reviews.Content: Business has brought me to Midtwon many times this year. I've stayed at several places, but have come to rely on the Hilton Manhattan East. Good location. Clean rooms. Nice bar. And good prices

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ForzaMaterazzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the run-up and during Hurricane Irene. Initially for 2 nights, but as our flight was cancelled we stayed for 3 in the end. Obviously it was a stressful time for the staff, but they were very calm and helpful, Tessa on front desk especially. We had booked a suite, and due to the circumstances we were able to stay in the same room at a lower rate for the last night which was greatly appreciated. We have stayed in several NYC hotels before and they can be variable & expensive, but this one was in a great location and nicely furnished and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “It was great and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: franktenerife
Reviews.Content: We were made very welcome and made to feel special. The manager Lesley was exceptionally good and went out of his way to ensure our stay was fantastic. All in all the staff were friendly and so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: stomjoh
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to NYC. I live in an extremely quiet town so I typically only get a couple hours of sleep due to the the noise of The Big Apple. Not so with this hotel - lights out, awakened refreshed! The room was very clean and all of the staff were exceptionally helpful, courteous and friendly. I will definitely be staying here more in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I know the city is overcrowded and dirty but seriously. It's the Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: LoZav
Reviews.Content: I was up north visiting my husband on the weekend of the 12th through the 15th of August while he was out of town for business. We had booked a hotel room at the Hilton in the city because we were visiting friends for a couple nights as well. On a Saturday, at 6PM, we made our way to the Hilton, only to be told our room was not ready and they were still cleaning it. We were fine with waiting, because they gave us drink vouchers for the bar, plus the decor was so nice and plush, we didn't mind hanging around downstairs to wait. We were on a time schedule though and had to be back at our friends house by 8. So we waited about 20 minutes, and they came and got us and sent us up to our room. The first thing we always do whenever we get a hotel in any city is strip the bed and check everything for bed bug signs, which is exactly what we did. We didn't find any bed bugs, but we did find a pubic hair, a clearish white stain, and a brown stain on the sheets. By this time we only had an hour to shower, iron our clothes, and get where we needed to go, so I called downstairs and told them what happened. They did send an apologetic person up to change the sheets and remake the bed. It was quite obvious the room had not been cleaned at all. The floor had not been vacuumed and the bed was nasty. I was pissed because: A. We are Hilton Honors members and even if we weren't I would still expect a certain level of cleanliness from a Hilton. B. Check in for most of these hotels is generally 3 or 4, so I was a little miffed when she showed up at 6 and they had no room for us. C. They obviously lied to us when they said they were cleaning the room, because they weren't. D. Even though we didn't pay for the room, we used Hilton points my husband had saved up for a fun trip, and we basically wasted them on a bed filled with bodily fluids. Like I said, I knew New York was a dirty, overcrowded city, so I sort of knew what to expect, but I didn't expect it would be that gross.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not so 4 star service”
Reviews.Author: xddaisy
Reviews.Content: The first day when we checked in, we found the house-keeping's still working in our tiny little room while watching tv...he finished in a few minutes, but still... Later on, during our 4-nights stay, we had plumbing issues (It was really noisy. We talked with the front desk, she said she'd fix it. It improved a little bit the following night, but still noisy. Then we ran into a manager the day before we leave. I complained a bit, and he really fixed it completely. But still, we had three noisy nights.); the bathtub got stuck once (it took the engineer half an hour to fix it); and finally, on the last day that we stayed, the house-keeping didn't do the job. When we came back after a whole day sightseeing, we found our room the same condition as we left that morning. They apologized and gave us two continental breakfast which turned out to be poor quality. Well, the price was good, location was great, but service really was not so 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Well located , efficient staff , we'll return !”
Reviews.Author: BICOUDUR
Reviews.Content: Everything great except the lifts too slow and too busy , in addition one of them out of order at a peak period .

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean + friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MrAlbarino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton Manhattan East for 5 days and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is very central without being loud at all - Grand Central is 5 minutes walk, Empire State Building is 10 mins away and Times Square is 15mins which we thought was perfect. Our room was large and had everything we needed. With regards to service, every memeber of staff we dealt with was very friendly and efficient. The hotel is also close to many small food shops should you wish to pick up provisions - we also loved the wine shop 2 mins walk from the front door. I would stay here again next time i'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: chrispy253
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and I just spent 3 nights at the Hilton East. We loved it! The staff was terrific ,from the desk to the bell hops, to the bus boys. The room was very clean. The jacuzzi was a nice treat after walking all day long. I know that choosing a hotel in New York can be a crap shoot and this hotel hits the mark.

Reviews.Title: “Average for the price.”
Reviews.Author: anon789
Reviews.Content: Pros: The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was nice. The TV was kinda small but had a good picture. Room service was average. The hotel is in a great location if you have business/tourism in eastern Manhattan. The doormen and bell service was very good. Cons: The room was on the smaller side for the price. The TV was unplugged when I arrived so it took a while to get it working. The view was one small window overlooking the street.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: playausa
Reviews.Content: For business in midtown this hotel does the trick. Many good restaurants in walking distance. Your close to both UES and financial district. Staff is helpful and friendly. On occasion dignitaries from UN in residence and large security details. c

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Olchik0102
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton last weekend for 3 nights and really liked it. No bed bugs, that was the 1st thing we asked about and checked ourselves! Very nice contemporary hotel, in a great location! I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Dripping condensation from A/C and mold on ceiling”
Reviews.Author: swaynewilson
Reviews.Content: I was in New York City to attend a business meeting with one of the United Nations organizations so I wanted to stay as close to the UN as possible - hence this hotel. Will not be returning. The air conditioning unit was installed in the ceiling and the condensation was dripping on to the desk and my laptop. Also there was mold growing on the edges of the a/c filter vent. There are many hotels quite a bit nicer than this one in the same price point.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back.”
Reviews.Author: PierreLasVegas_Nv
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, food pricey and slow elevators. But overall nice room and polite help.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nico_bigollo
Reviews.Content: Room decor was modern, good breakfast buffet. Stayed here on business Recommendable. It was cute and agreeable. The building is beautiful, interesting architecture makes it worth a look, at the very least.

Reviews.Title: “nicely renovated hotel with charm”
Reviews.Author: travelprofi
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Manhattan East appears to be a recently renovated charming hotel. It is located in a quiet part of town, but within walking distance of some nice restaurants, Grand Central Station and many other places. I walked across town from the Javits Center one day. Another day I took the crosstown bus that stops right across the street from the hotel. I had heard that the rooms can be very small in this hotel. Mine was small, but not cramped. It had a queen bed, a easy chair, desk and still plenty of room to walk around. The staff was helpful. The room, restaurant and other public places were clean and bright. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: joaner11
Reviews.Content: This was a great value for a very good hotel. The locstion was very good since it is an easy stroll to Times Square. Parking was reasonable. The rooms were very clean and the linens were ironed.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit out of the way from Times Sq area but still a fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: deputycz
Reviews.Content: Historic building, beautifully redecorated and reasonably priced (at least when I stayed there) for NYC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Below what I expect from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: TorbenFromDenmark
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife, her sister and niece in may for one week In general the hotel rooms are well below normal Hilton standards. I had booked two rooms and called in advance to ensure that both rooms would be on same (high) floor but were informed that this could not be requested before check-in as all rooms were assigned at check-in only. At check-in the front desk were not able to accommodate us on the same floor. High floors were available either. In general the service at check-in was poor. Room 1 was on 3rd floor with a view of a concrete wall some 30 inches from the window – like living in a cellar. Room 2 was on 7th floor. Both rooms were of the same layout except for the bed configuration: One small window, quite old bathroom in need of updating and very low ceilings. Room size on the small side but this is normal for NY. The low ceilings and lack of windows/daylight makes for a gloomy perception of the rooms. The neighborhood is quiet for NY standards and within good reach of many midtown sights if you don’t mind walking a bit. I have contacted the hotel with different issues after coming home. An issue about missing Hhoners points were dealt with swiftly but general issues with the hotel has still not been replied to in spite of writing back for an answer more than 5 times. We had a very good rate from Hilton.com - this means that by NY standards the value for money was quite good but standard and service not at all up to what we expect from a Hilton. I would not stay here again until the hotel has been refurbished. I think the hotel should be placed in one of the “lower” Hilton brands until then.

Reviews.Title: “"Just following orders" wasn't even a good excuse in 1945”
Reviews.Author: travelgal11
Reviews.Content: My husband booked us into the Hilton Manhattan East on Priceline. When we got there at midnight, we were informed that a floor had no air conditioning, so we would be 'walked over' to another hotel but would have to return to the hotel on the second night of our stay. Since today (the day when we're supposed to return to the hotel) is the day of a memorial service for my mother, we requested help - from the manager of the hotel, from our "walk over" hotel, from Priceline, and from HIlton Hhonors. All roads led back to the manager of the hotel, who informed everyone that his director said that no exceptions were to be made to the one night only walk over policy. When we called Hilton Hhonors, we were informed that a Mr. Luis Paz, the manager of the hotel, would be contacting us. Apparently he couldn't be bothered. When we called Hhonors a second time, they called Mr. Paz, and he 'magnanimously' told them that we wouldn't be penalized for not staying there (whatever the hell that means), but that since we had booked on Priceline, we were SOL in terms of any help or any alternate arrangement. Mr. Paz and the unnamed 'just following orders' flunkie manager epitomize everything that customer service should NOT be. Some customer service experiences are so good that one remembers them forever. This is the kind that is so bad that it will be etched in my memory for years to come. Hhonors gold member since 2005, now no more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: nardz01
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. Not fabulous, just nice. We stayed here for 10 nights whilst travelling. The rooms are tiny...and I mean tiny. But we were only sleeping in them at night so it wasnt that big of a deal. The one complaint I would have is the female concierge. She was terrible. Very rude and not interested in helping guests at all. I think she was on facebook everytime I went to the desk (which was only about 4 times) but everytime I went there to ask for some information it was if I was inconveniencing her. Didn't make it any better when the 3 times we asked for directions of where something was she sent us the complete other way?? Anyway we learnt our lesson and started asking the staff at the front desk for things and not concierge. I would try and stay a little closer to 5th ave next time but still on 42nd st...

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: nadezdam
Reviews.Content: Room was small and infected with bed bugs. I would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for NYC exploring”
Reviews.Author: will1980
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in late May. We booked this hotel because the price was great and included breakfast each night (just over $200 US per night). We had a budget and wanted to stick to it. Not wanting to spend more than $200US a night in NYC (notoriously known for some of the most expensive accommodation holdings in the world) we were expecting alot less than what we received. Room was very large for manhattan standards as was the bathroom. We were on the 11th floor but had no views, both windows faced brick walls, however we didnt expect much at this price, actually we expected to be facing brick walls so this was not a problem. Bed was comfortable, probably to comfy as we slept in a few mornings fairly late. Rooms dont have a min-bar fridge, there is a ice bucket with ice machines on several floors but a fridge would have been handy. Bathroom products provided (PeterThomasRoth) were great. Breakfast was ok, was included in our room rate so can't complain but wouldnt pay for it if it wasnt as selection was limited. Reception and bell staff were fine, not amazing but pleasant, breakfast attendants were pleasant also and the housekeepers were extremely pleasant, always smiling and so friendly and even left friendly post notes wishing us a great day. There was a lady who worked in the kitchen for the breakfast service who was rude, when she came out to put food out we saw her push past people and yell at the other staff and you could hear her yelling from the kitchen, we didnt get her name though. Apart from her though overall service was perfectly fine. The location of the hotel is a little removed from the centre of the action but we liked this. It's in a quieter part of town, a relaxing place to rest for the night.
