Its still in manhattan so you can never get away from the noise and excitment but its makes for a welcoming change at the end of a long day to come back to somewhere with a slightly more inviting and peacful feel. Its located in the Tudor City neighbourhood which is definately worth a walk around and is opposite the Ford foundation building which has a unique indoor garden open to the public. NYC is all about the walking but if you dont want to walk there are so many transport options. The cross town bus stops right outside the hotel and runs from the hotel along 42nd street right to the other end at peir 83. The 42nd street subway is also close by with a stop near 43rd street and runs under 42nd street with a stop at 7th Ave, perfect for Times Square. Grand Central is only about a 7 min walk away and has a great indoor food market place of Lexington Ave. You can walk from the hotel to Times Sqaue and Broaway Theatres in around 15-20 mins, with so much to look at along the way and high pedestrian traffic it may take longer but thats part of the NYC experience. If you are only in NYC for a few nights and spending most of your time around Times Square then this hotel may not be the best for you as you may get over the walk or transport quickly but you wont get the same value at the Times Sqaure hotels, you will mostly likely pay more for less. Overall the hotel offered more than we expected for the price we paid. Would reccommend and would stay again. Thank you Hilton Manhattan East and thank you NYC, we miss you.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel on 42nd street.”
Reviews.Author: voorentje
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything a traveller needs: a great room with a great view, a terrific bed, an LCD tv and a nice bathroom. Moreover, it is located at the eastend of 42nd Street, which makes for a nive walk towards midtown. The only thing I didn't like were the rates for wireless internet: $16 per day. That's a little steep.. But all in all a great hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyholidays1962
Reviews.Content: Had a 7 night break at this lovely hotel,All staff very friendly will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & efficient”
Reviews.Author: Tinker01
Reviews.Content: Having had a long long day involving travel, presentations and business meetings, I was delighted by the friendly check in process in reception. Armed with my room key I was soon able to freshen up with a powerful shower so that I could stand my own company once more. Having been given a restaurant recommendation from a friend, the staff went out of their way to provide me with directions / approximate walking time etc. Certainly making me feel like a valued guest. One surprise was check-out - the invoice intimated fast speedy check-out using a phone function ... that didn't exist. No problem however - the heartfelt thank you for staying with us when I was leaving will certainly ensure I consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great for business. You can do much better for the price.”
Reviews.Author: andyhr70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two nights. Paid nearly $600 per night for the room (high season in New York I guess, there was nothing for less than $400 in the city). To be clear: overall rating would be average-to-good if the value for money weren't so bad. Check-in was efficient rather than friendly; service generally was of the "we're here if you want to ask us for something" kind rather than the "anticipating your needs and at least pretending to be interested in you as a human being" kind that I'd hope for this kind of location. Room was not huge but average for NYC, just about fit the 2 queen beds. Bathroom was functional and clean. Bed was comfortable and I slept well. My main issue was around lack of working internet. Wireless was a joke - the signal was so weak that it would stay up for at most 30 seconds. Wired had some DNS problem so I couldn't get an IP address. I was popping in and out of the room for various meetings and told them at the front desk of the issues. They said they'd send an engineer up to fix it, but he didn't have a laptop so couldn't actually test it (so of course he didn't end up fixing it). If I'm paying $600 a night I expect the on-site engineer to be able to at least hook up to the cable and see if it's working, without me having to be there. I also think at that price they could throw the internet in for free. Second issue was service at breakfast. We were hosting someone for a breakfast meeting and clearly wanted to order from the menu, but it took 10-15 minutes to get a menu (the waiter tried to convince us the buffet would be better - when we had made clear we wanted to order from the menu to enable us to meet at the table) and then another 10-15 minutes to get someone to take an order. Probably would not have irked me if the breakfast menu items weren't so expensive - but if I'm paying $30+ for breakfast, I expect someone to actually care about taking my order. I'm not generally a very fussy business traveller: give me a bed and working internet, and I'm happy. To paraphrase Meat Loaf, "1 out of 2 ain't good".

Reviews.Title: “Great location, love the art deco, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: spetron
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great if you want to be in a quieter area of town. It's a quick walk from Grand Central where you can easily grab the subway or train to many points. It's in a quieter neighborhood that turns residential within a block or two. The hotel has a nice lobby area that's not massive but isn't cramped. The lobby bar is pretty good but most people don't hang around for that. There is a large restaurant on site but I did not try it. The staff was quick and efficient on check-in though we arrived early and our room wasn't ready. They took our luggage and we simply headed right out. Fairly easy to get a cab from the front. Once we got into our room I was impressed with the size of the room. However, the rooms (at least mine) are definitely in need of updating. A bit musty and old. It had all the typical Hilton amenities by was still a remnant of an old hotel room. The good: the bathroom was large, great shower, very spacious room with a little sitting area and table. The not-so-good: the air conditioning barely worked (basically blew air but did not cool), the bed was so-so, the view was a brick wall and a roof. Overall, if it wasn't for the lack of A/C in the room, it wouldn't have been bad. But that just made things uncomfortable to sleep. Fortunately, we didn't spend much time in the room. We did have breakfast in the room before we checked out. The food was fantastic. Very fresh fruit, great pancakes and waffles. Since we had a great sitting area we really enjoyed it. However, for $74 (for 2) it probably should have come with a massage.

Reviews.Title: “It Wasn't Bad BUT It Wasn't Good Either.”
Reviews.Author: sfk0418
Reviews.Content: I won a good bid on this hotel at Priceline. I believe I paid $175/night which is pretty good for a 3-4ish Star hotel. This was the former Tudor Hotel, which is apparently a historical hotel in NYC. Historical indeed. Despite the modern furniture and bathroom design, everything else feels old. The elevator is tiny and the hallways ignited the cloister-phobic in me. Everything else is pretty much "vanilla". The room is clean but it's very tiny. The location is not bad but it's not that great either. The closest subway is Grand Central station. After 6pm, the area is pretty much dead which is fine if you are a business traveler and you just really want to unwind at the end of the day. I got what I deserved for the price I paid. Will I return? Possibly not unless I get another great deal but most likely, I will shell out a few extra bucks to be closer to where the action is.... wherever that may be.

Reviews.Title: “Awful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: nicnj22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here awhile ago and were supposed to stay again recently. However, I got very sick and we couldn't. My husband is a Diamond member and when he called the hotel to tell them we wouldn't be coming, they told him he had to get a doctor's note to show them I was indeed sick. What is this, high school?? My husband called his Diamond line and they were horrified to hear this. Needless to say they took care of it. We will NEVER stay here again! Whoever manages this staff needs to do a better job!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: psandps
Reviews.Content: Although part of the Hilton group the hotel does not feel like a characterless, international hotel. The building dates from the 1930s and has kept some of its period charm. Although it has 300 rooms, it seems much smaller. My corner room was a good size, very quiet and well equipped. Hotel is in a quiet location but only a few blocks from Grand Central Station and the subway. Didn't eat at the hotel as there are plenty of restaurants and breakfast places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant overnight!”
Reviews.Author: PaulusHookJC
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline to book a room because I needed to stay late at work in the city. The total cost for the one night stay way about $145, a bargain for a Hilton in NYC. Check-in was easy. And for once, I feel like I wasn't given the dumpiest room in the hotel as punishment for using Priceline. As it's an older hotel, getting the the small wing with the room (1105) was a bit unusual, but very private! I did use room service because I didn't have time to run out before going back to work. I ordered a caesar with shrimp ($24). For once, a salad not drowning in dressing! A couple of the shrimp were a bit over-cooked, but at least they were grilled and not those gross shrimp from a can. The bed was very comfortable. Lots of great pillows. The view consisted of the space between 42nd and 41st streets, which was just fine with me. Less chance for noise! I had a hard time finding the hair dryer. Turns out it was in a small bag on the top shelf of the closet. A small bag on the top shelf of the closet? How about in the bathroom? Or in a drawer in the wardrobe? The shower was HUGE with great water pressure. My only real complain is the television. I realize that people don't stay in Manhattan to sit in their room and watch t.v., but really? Why buy the fancy HD flat screens if you're just going to have a handful of channels without HD? In the grand scheme of things, not a big deal. Check-out was simple, and I was out the door in the morning and off to work without a hitch. I'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Russellwbennett
Reviews.Content: When I stay at a Hilton hotel I expect a certain level of service. This stay did not meet my expectations. The staff were not rude but certainly not friendly, they were often preoccupied with whatever else they were doing to attend to guests. My room was spacious and comfortable. There were no bath towels in the bathroom, a fact that I did not discover until I was exiting the shower. Fortunately I was alone and there were enough smaller towels provided. The breakfast was a joke. it seems 3 staff members were expected to handle all the guests, greeting, allocating tables, providing coffee and juice and then clearing tables. When I arrived the line of guests was out of the door of the dining area, at least 15 tables were vacant but not getting cleared. When I eventually got shown to a table, I had to wait over 5 minutes to get a coffee. The buffet breakfast was in such a cramped space the line barely moved. I eventually just gave up. I did complain at check-out and they did listen and they did adjust my bill a little as compensation.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Genevieve A
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with the Hilton Manhattan East through Priceline.com for a three night stay in late May 2011. We arrived at the hotel at about 9:00am which was quite early for check-in so they didn't have a room for us yet but they held our bags with the bellhop no trouble. Everything else was wonderful...the staff were all very pleasant and polite. Our room was very clean, the sheets, towels, washroom, everything! I was very impressed with this hotel and would stay here again in a heart beat. My only reason for not giving 5/5 is that you have to pay for wifi. A little ridiculous considering this is a Hilton and I have stayed in much less expensive hotels and hostels who alway provide free wireless. I am always disgusted when an expensive hotel nickel and dimes you by charging for wireless internet. Honestly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value in East Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: ATLconsultant
Reviews.Content: I think I got a room during the work week for under $200. Are you kidding me? A room in NYC under $200!? And in a decent neighborhood?!? The hotel has recently undergone renovations. It looks like Hilton bought 2 small hotels that were close together and formed them into one Hilton hotel, so this is not your traditional Hilton property. It's more like a 2 towered boutique hotel. I made the mistake of going up the wrong set of elevators and into the wrong tower. That's how I found out! Anyway, backing up a bit, I checked in on a Tuesday night. Check-in staff very friendly and helpful. I was told that I received a Hilton Gold member upgrade. Great! However, I got to the room and thought, "Really? This is an upgraded room?!?" It was very small...even for Manhattan. Probably about 180 square feet. The view was non-existent. I wonder what my original room looked like! But, for the price, I really couldn't complain. And the room was cute,clean, and appointed with normal Hilton stuff, and the bed slept perfectly fine. I had no issues whatsoever. I would stay here again, easily, for the price. I was just 2 blocks away from the Shuttle to Time Square and I could walk to Time Square in about 20 minutes. A great great alternative to the uber expensive properties around W. 42nd St.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomidating and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mmoodlight
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this Hotel at first glance the hotel is very classy. Upon approaching the hotel I was welcomed by the evening doorman Chris Colon who was very helpful and informative about the parking garage and referred us to a couple of different attractions in the area...you can tell he lives in the city. Chafik the bellman graciously took our bags from the front desk and waited for us to check in and escorted us to our room. The front desk representative was very pleasant. The room was clean and smelling good... the bed was awesome loved the pillows and comforter.... My favorite is the french onion soup from the restaurant in the lobby of the Hotel our waiter Felician was on point with everything serving us in a timely fashion and giving us everything before we asked as if he was reading our minds..... Thanks to all those employees in the Hitlon Manhattan East that made our stay a memerable one ... look foward to my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimdebs
Reviews.Content: Having been to New York previously, we knew the location of this hotel and that it would allow us to get away from all the crowds and noise but still be within a short walk to Times Square etc. Hotel is nice and quiet, staff friendly and helpful and although the rooms are a bit on the small side it was ambple for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in midtown with quiet rooms!”
Reviews.Author: rmwhitt
Reviews.Content: We won a Priceline bid at the Hilton Manhattan East for an astoundingly low price ($117) but Tripadvisor reviews were luckily good. Everything that the other reviews say are true. Hotel lobby is smallish but has some nice seating areas, and the bar/lounge towards the back of the long lobby looked cozy and comfortable. There was fresh fruit on the check-in counter, apples and oranges (the container disappeared over the weekend). Our corner room in the South Tower overlooked 41st St., a lovely residential street. The room was smallish, with 1 queen bed, but nicely appointed, with a flat screen TV and a snug, modern bathroom. Our corner room had 2 windows, covered in lovely roman shades, and another one in the bathroom, oddly placed in the shower/bathtub. Two of the nicest things about the room: the windows opened--a rarity in ANY hotel--and since they were double-paned, they sealed out all of the noise in the streets below. Sleeping was wonderful! Unfortunately, the walls are thin and the pipes (when others are using their bathrooms) are a bit noisy, so our early morning started with noises from other rooms. My second favorite thing was the comfort of the bed. It was JUST perfect--not too hard, not too soft. The pillows were fluffy and gave good neck support. The sheets were wonderful with a high thread count 'feel'. The hotel has a small, nicely appointed gym, but even better is the 24 hour dry sauna in the gym's locker room. What a treat! The gym is open 24/7 (use your room key to get in), and you must heat the sauna up for 15 minutes before it's ready to use. But at 11pm, after a lovely evening at the theater, the sauna and gym were empty so we enjoyed a muscle-relaxing sauna before bedtime. Front desk and bellman service was excellent. We didn't eat in the restaurant (since breakfast was not included in our room rate) but the breakfast buffet, while it looked nice and complete, costs a whopping $16 for continental and $26 for a hot breakfast. Outrageous prices! For the price we paid through Priceline.com, this hotel was a STEAL. For a higher price, it is still worth considering if you can reserve a larger room with double beds or a king bed. The corner rooms (end in 12) are a bit bigger than some of their other rooms, we were told.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for busines travel”
Reviews.Author: SGtravelgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April 2011. It was a very nice hotel with modern decor and a very friendly bell staff. We were able to drop our bags off in advance of check in. The front desk offered us many ideas for dinner close to the hotel because it was raining that day. The room was nice, I would've thought it was too small if I was staying multiple days but just for overnight it was fine. The bathroom was great and very clean. I had plenty of towels and toiletries. I was disappointed that night when I called housekeeping a few times around 9pm for extra tea and sugar and got no answer. Breakfast in the morning was very good, it was set up continental-style with both hot and cold items. The eggs, meats, and other items were very fresh and very good. They had a cooler with small bottle of juices and yogurts which were great. This hotel is very close to 30 Rock and Times Square but isn't in a busy area so it was ideal for a business stay.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was nice, the room was average nothing special... no issues though.”
Reviews.Author: AngieL11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently on a trip with my children to NYC, although the room that we got was nothing fancy we had no issues at all with the hotel itself or the staff... all were very courteous and helpful. The lobby was nice, trendy and hip. The location was ok, close to GCT and accessible to other popular areas in Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: CheshireGreen
Reviews.Content: Good location, room was clean, not huge but had a nice bathroom. Just used hotel for sleeping, didn't use any other facilities so can't comment. Recommend Pershing Square opposite Grand Central Station for breakfast, magnificent!

Reviews.Title: “Better than i thought hotel”
Reviews.Author: boldy33
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the evening on our arrival date and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is very tidy and the staff very pleasant. We checked in and found because it was our honey moon we were given a complementary free upgrade to our room. The room was beautiful. Well laid out with a huge plush bed, lounge and a large bathroom. The wardrobe was a little small for the room size but that was made up for with a large chest of drawers. The room had a 47inch flat screen TV on the wall which you could swivel to watch either in bed or in the lounge area. On arriving in the room there was a complementary bottle of champaigne and a fruit platter on the table. VERY NICE TOUCH! My only gripe with the hotel was the concierge. The lady wasn't really that clued up and had to use a guide book a lot so we decided to speak to the bell boys for better information. Of which is what we got. They gave us great places to eat and some small places to visit. Overall great hotel and will definately be using it agin when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Sirena6
Reviews.Content: I was visiting New York for the first time in March 2011. I was traveling with my family, but was sharing a room with my boyfriend. I am so satisfied with my stay at the hotel. The service was just perfect, everyone was so nice and helpful. The room was excellent, everything about it. The bed, the bathroom, the bathroom products, the tv, the view, everything was just perfect. I didn't try the restaurant, but it looked good. I recommend it 110%! Thank you Hilton for a great week!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton aka Tip-ton”
Reviews.Author: csy7
Reviews.Content: The rooms themselves were great though, comfy beds, good temperature control, and we had a beautiful view down snowy 42nd street - trees, buildings, nice. The lobby and bar area were also well-decorated. Classy with a bit of edge. The service at the front desk was good, except for the first day when we tried to check in. Ended up having to wait until after 5:30 pm for our rooms to be cleaned/show up on the system. The phones in the rooms were strange though, would get a lot of interference when trying to call down or retrieve messages. Unfortunately we left the hotel on a sour note, the bellhops don't have much grace when it comes to asking for tips. We had to leave our bags as our flight wasn't until nearly midnight, and the man who received the bags was great, very sweet. I tipped him as I understood his shift would finish by the time we returned. When we came back, I explained we had already tipped the bellhop from the morning. The man giving us back our bags said "well, he put them in, and I'm the one taking them out". So we tipped him as well for the 9 bags. Another one of the bellhops came to us multiple times mentioning that HE was booking the van to the airport, the the van was BOOKED, that the van was ON THE WAY, and even brought a trolley saying he wanted to get READY. We were fine to bring the bags ourselves to the front. After he INSISTED, we let him take some, and then had to tip him for 6 bags. Then when we got into the van, the driver who was a 'friend' of the bellhop, complained that he had to wait, and had to drive ALL THE WAY from the airport to come and get us. We could have just flagged one down, or got the taxi radio service to send one that was in the vicinity. He made it clear that we better "make it worth his time". Unfortunately after driving I realised I forgot something in the hotel, so we went back. When we got to the airport, I offered him $70, which meant a $20 tip. He said he wanted $80. So after all this, we ended up paying $54 in tips alone to get us and our bags from the hotel to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but noting special”
Reviews.Author: xtrimex
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed over valentines day for three nights. The first two nights we stayed in a deluxe room over looking the road. The room was nice a little small. The bathroom drain did not work and when we told the front desk nothing was done to fix the problem. The bed's are ok. But not what I have come to expect from a Hilton property. The 3rd night we had a regular room why they moved us is still anyone guess. The regular room was the smallest room I have ever stayed in in my life. It had one small window that faced a brick wall, and did not have any windows in the bathroom which would have been ok, but the fan did not work so if someone was showing it was really muggy in the entire room. Drain also did not work in this room A/C did not work in either room. The restaurant was decent, my girlfriend really liked her pasta, but my steak was nothing but fat. The Bar area was very nice. Staff was very kind even though they over looked all our issues with the drain and A/C. Also location was nice in relation to grand central. Currently working at two hotels one high end and one family friendly and being a active travel blogger with travel and leisure magazine. I have come to know what to expect and all sadly to say this property was lacking a little. I would stay again but not at the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “When you book, make sure they have an A/C”
Reviews.Author: RossfromCLT
Reviews.Content: I just checked out of the Hilton Manhattan East. Nice lobby. Clean, small rooms (oddly low ceilings). Before you book your room this month, you may want to call management to find out if the A/C is working in the hotel as it wasnt last night. Even more disconcerting was that the front desk didnt know they had an issue and maintenance was forced to break the news to everyone. So if you dont mind a cracked window when its 35 degrees outside, no problem. Secondly, and this is for Hilton members, when and if they give you a breakfast voucher, make sure you ask for the non Continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynnHarrisburg_PA
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel. The room was small but beautifully decorated and clean. Lobby is also very beautiful. The hotel is at 42nd and 2nd which is a bit out of the way of but I discovered you could take the "7" train down from Grand Central to Times Square if you didn't want to walk. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms infected with bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Classictraveller2011
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby but that's it. * small rooms * bed bugs * terrible shower * overall terrible value for money

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed a second time, and will stay again, but ...”
Reviews.Author: davidahsgr
Reviews.Content: My first review was from August 14, 2010, and I'm following up. I liked the place, but complained of the a/c being overbearing. So, I was there in the depths of the NYC winter -- really cold -- to see the contrast. When I got to my room, it reeked of Febreze (or whatever they use to clean & deodorize); in a hotel with sealed windows I would have asked to be moved to a different room because sickly-sweet chemical smell was so strong. However, I once again was glad for windows that open; aired the place out and it was just fine. Heater warmed the room right up again, too. Ate at the restaurant: very nice sandwich and sweet-potato fries, and an ice-cold beer. Would like to see recycling bins in the room as some other business hotels have. Unlike some other reviewers, I found the front-desk staff to be very nice and efficient. I avoided the bar this trip, and have my beer with dinner in the restaurant, so I'm not sure if the staff there is as tip-hungry as my first stay. I'd recomment this place, and plan to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet modest hotel off center of town”
Reviews.Author: TackyTouristAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I still remember this place to be called Tudor Hotel so the hotel might be a little different since we stayed. The location is great and it's a quick walk to check out the UN. I do agree that during night, might be good to buddy up but other than that, you get what you pay for and it's a great spot to make home base while you travel about town.

Reviews.Title: “could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: aly11
Reviews.Content: i was going to come to this hotel on the day of the big snow storm. we had to call and see if we could pospone it until the next day they kindly said yes. it was very clean. no bed bugs!!! when we were sleeping it was 75 degrees! we couldnt figure out how to turn the tempature down. the rooms could have been a bit bigger. are room was missing complientary water bottles and tour book. i could care less, but it was of putting. it was very small. the location was a good 15 minutes from time square, nothing i could not handle. i guess since i am used to staying at 5 star hotels this was a shock but over all it was ok. we survived!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but fork out the extra money and stay in times square”
Reviews.Author: veloche
Reviews.Content: This place is hard to find even with a gps. None of the rooms have a view. the lobby furniture is super ugly. the rooms are big but the tv's are all cockeyed because there's no wall big enough for them. All of the elevators were broken when we checked in. Fun times getting up to the 18th floor. I'm a gold member and was treated like a basic member. No fridges, not even in suites. no pool either. Just shell out the extra $$ and stay in times square

Reviews.Title: “Working out the kinks, but it's still a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: bsb616
Reviews.Content: I understand that this Hilton hotel used to be the Tudor Hotel, and it did not join the Hilton family of hotels until April 1st, 2010. The giant Tudor Hotel sign that is still on the top makes this Hilton pretty easy to find walking east from Grand Central Station. As a traveler who is used to the Hilton Gold and Diamond experience, I was disappointed in the quality of this hotel in comparison to the other ones at which I've stayed. There were definitely good points to the hotel, however. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, as one who regularly stays at Hiltons would expect. The blackout curtains kept the sunlight out and on the higher floors (I was on 13), there was very little street noise that made its way into the room. As is also typical with Hiltons, the decorations were tasteful and it was obvious that the company has invested a substantial amount of money in updating the hotel since its acquisition. The rooms were also very clean, which is particularly reassuring given the recent bedbug epidemic in NYC hotels. At no time did I fear that the cleanliness was subpar. There were also some substantial drawbacks to the hotel: - My room was not ready at my requested time that I included with my reservation. . -Being accustomed to the Gold and Diamond treatment, I was not offered a room upgrade (which I understand given it was NYC the weekend prior to Christmas) and there was no executive lounge. Complimentary bottles of water were also not provided in the room. -The elevators are excrutiatingly slow; not to mention tiny and only 2 out of the 3 were operating. Upon checkout, we waited in excess of five minutes for an elevator. Ordinarily, I would take the stairs; however, that is very inconvenient when you're on the 13th floor and have luggage to take with you. -The walls are paper thin. I mean, you literally hear EVERYTHING that is going on in the room next to you. This is hardly ideal for a romantic weekend away. So, all in all, kind of a mixed bag. At a macro level, it's a clean, comfortable place to stay and the appearance is on brand with what one would expect out of a Hilton. But, it is also very apparent that there are still improvements that need to be made in order for this to be an excellent choice for all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: camieLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 10th December for a 2 night shopping break from London. It was actually our 3rd choice as we were using Hilton points for our stay and the larger hiltons were unavailable. However we were pleasantly surprised by the hotel - the lobby and bar is small and intimate, almost all the staff were friendly and professional. The room was fantastic - very big and spacious for a Queen room & you couldn't hear a sound during the night / morning so a great sleep had by both of us! Location is great - just a short walk from Grand Central Station where you can get anywhere with ease. Breakfast was included for us and was plentiful, food quality was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Shame the service was not as good as the lobby decor”
Reviews.Author: HotelStoppa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in December 2010, Firstly the hotel lobby was imppressive and I was looking forwards to my stay, but it soon became obvious that not everything about this hotel would be as great ! The lady on the front desk was very nice and friendly and there are no complaints there, I arrive in my room to find human hair in the bath and sink, there is a terrible draft from ALL windows in the room and just as expected from a hotel in New York the only view is a brick wall about a metre from your window. The air conditioning would not get warm despite having it on the heat setting and ramping it up to 75F . The wardrobe fitted in my coat and a shirt before being practically full and the wireless internet in the room loses service every 5 minutes. The bed itself I must say was ver comfortable but due to the size of the room you did feel like you were sleeping in a box. Finally if you get hungry at unusuall times then this is NOT the hotel for you. Room service is available at 5.30pm until 10.30pm only so if you are arriving on a late flight or you take a lie in then chances of getting any food in this hotel are Nill even tho the room Service menu in your room states its open all day. I tried to order food and was told quite rudley NO because this time of year its slow so we dont do it ???? What kind of hotel ( of this supposed rating) do not even put on a lunch time menu or limited menu after hours. Having stayed at numerous ( often cheaper) hotels in NYC I would not reccomend this particular hotel. Its a shame considering its renovation you would think the management would be looking to encourage guests not turn them away

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cozy hotel- great location (especially if you're in town for the Marathon)”
Reviews.Author: Chica_and_Chico
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in New York City, so I can't compare to other hotels, but I was quite pleased with the overall experience. My friend and I were in town from Canada to run the New York Marathon... so from that perspective, it was an excellent location. The airport shuttle let us off at Grand Central, which is only a few blocks away from the Hotel. The International Fun Run was held in front of the United Nations... which was practically out our front door. The Marathon Shuttle Bus pick up the New York Public Library was conveniently close to the hotel as well. Yes, the hotel is quite small, but we were there to see the city... not the hotel... so we were just happy that it was clean and comfortable. The staff were very accommodating with our luggage (as we had to check out early due to the race). The hotel restaurant was a bit lacking. Beware of the $6 tea!! However, there is a great Irish Pub across the street, and markets selling fruit in the vicinity. Also, slightly disappointed that for the price, the WiFi was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: ShrewsburyShrewsbury
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many different hotels in NYC. Our stay at the Hilton Manahattan East was really enjoyable. The staff was friendly, competent, and helpful. We loved the clean fresh smell in the room upon arrival and everything was spotless. The beds were super comfortable. All in all, a great stay and only a few blocks from Grand Central and a short walk to Times Square. The funky decor in the lobby added to a fun atmosphere for our getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Good located - Service could be better!”
Reviews.Author: christawanner
Reviews.Content: This former Tudor Hotel belongs now to Hilton and was newly renovated in 2010. The interior is nice and free wireless is available in the lobby. We booked a Junior Suite to have a bit more space. The second room we checked was really quiet and nice. What they really could do better is to hire another bellman to be sure that if you will need their service one of them is available in shorter time. They preferred to take pictures outside while we were waiting for them, and so on...

Reviews.Title: “this can't be a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: gerdaNl
Reviews.Content: Sure, when Hilton bought the old Tudor hotel, they changed the name and updated the lobby, but it is still an old hotel that needs a redo. The rooms are very small, the bathroom old and worn out. The airco didn't cool the room, and allthough I like to sleep with open windows, in New York that is no option if you want to sleep. But the beds were nice, and without bedbugs, and the location is convenient. But for the price I paid I could surely find a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: tec411
Reviews.Content: This place was probably the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in. Given the recent bedbug issues in NYC, the first thing I did was practically rip the beds apart - they were absolutely spotless, and all the bedding is white. Someone said no ice machine, yes, there is one on the second floor. It is in a quieter area, but still a close walk to the subway. The 7 train will get you to Times Square in less than 5 minutes and from there you can go anywhere. The bartender here was very friendly, so were the doormen. We had to wait a few minutes to check into our room, but we went to the bar and the girl brought our keys over in less than 15 minutes. This also was one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed at. I don't come to NYC to hang out in a room, so I don't want to pay a fortune. I just want clean and comfy, and this fit the bill. I've certainly paid more for less.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: Wireless wifi, or wired, plenty of plugs. Room was spacious, linens were soft, bathroom is good-sized. Comfortable desk, fast elevators, nice staff. The lobby looks very new. Flatscreen HD tv's, it was nice. I don't think you would be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in New York”
Reviews.Author: Jane0117
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing the food was great we got an upgrade - we never asked but when they knew we were newly weds they upgraded us sent wine and cheese platter to our room the staff were ecellent we really enjoyed our stay everythng was fantastic only stayed 4 nights but could having easily stayed a fortnight defintely will be returning to the Hilton - recommend it 10 fold

Reviews.Title: “Not a real Hilton”
Reviews.Author: shopgirl007
Reviews.Content: Booked a Juniorsuite during Columbusday weekend (400 $ incl. taxes). On their website they show suites with nice balcony or terrace - for sure - we received one with NO balcony or terrace (extra request on reservation!) - just two small windows - view was ok. But they gave us a room on a high floor and away from elevator noice. Tried to change room, but for "our bad luck" we booked 5 nights - which was too long for the hotel to gave us a balcony suite... The room itself was quite ok; clean - bed was wonderful (nothing else expected), bathroom very large with 2 sinks and bidet. Separatet sitting area with 2 chairs and couch. They highly recommend their Lavazza coffee makers in the rooms. It´s def. not a Lavazza coffee maker - they just have Lavazza coffee pads and the machine is not working properly - no pressure to make coffee - good for us - we brought some tea from home. Had to talk to front desk regarding complimentary water - first day they brought some - then they ignored us. Need to write complain letter to manager on duty. I´m JUST a silver member - but paid a suite for full 5 days - so this is what you expect or not? Had some other issues: broken telephone cable (dangerous), no promissed bathrobes in room and a bad dínner experience. After this they gave us water for free, but never replaced bathrobes or telephone cable which was working. They wrote a nice letter I need to say and sent fruits and breakfast vouchers to our room, but I noticed in their attitude that they were not amused about complaining about their hotel! They concierge lady was very nice, but it seems that she´s not working for Hilton. You need to pay her in cash or by credit card - not possible to charge to your room. Bellmen were always nice and greeted when you enter the hotel - the front desk staff - well - they didn´t! Don´t need to say someting about location - very nice and not that busy than Times Square hotels. CVS 24h store 4 minutes away, Grand Central Station 10 minutes - as well as Bryant Park. Mc Faddens on other street side not recommended!!! Would I stay again - well hard to say - Juniorsuite for 400 was a good price during holiday-weekend, but size of the suite was the same than a regular room in Marriott Marquis. And I don´t like the feeling to stay in a hotel with no nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Niccam1
Reviews.Content: We really liked this place. The room was small but not as tiny as some of the other reviews suggest. We had 2 beds. We requested extra pillows and they were there when we arrived. The beds were plush and comfortable which is good because I have a difficult time sleeping in a bed that isn't a tempurpedic. The bathroom was very large and clean. The windowsill could have used a little attention (repainting) but there was not any mildew. The temperature dropped and there was no heating in the hotel (furnace is seasonal), but maintainence brought up a space heater which was more than enough. There was noise coming from the vent but once again-it was fixed within minutes! I loved the fact that the windows actually open. However, my daughter and boyfriend didn't like the night noise from the streets (sirens et al.) I never noticed any noise because the bed was so comfortable, I fell sound asleep as soon as my head hit the pillows. The location was perfect. The housekeeping and maintainence staff were wonderful!! Everything we needed was taken care of in a matter of 10 minutes. The bellperson was great!! The front desk personnel were professional, friendly and extremely accomodating! It was my 13 year old first visit to NYC and we had a blast. We would definitely stay here again. My only disappointments werethe conceirge. He was not friendly at all. And the fact that there was no free wifi access.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect when you hear the name Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Moonlight23
Reviews.Content: This is more like an upscale inn with really small rooms and narrow corridors and with the price you pay for the name Hilton, you would wanna pay a little more and upgrade to one of the many full service hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good... but not great”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMama79
Reviews.Content: My husband, 16-month-old daughter and I stayed at that hotel on Oct. 9-10, 2010. The people at the front desk were very helpful, and we were pleased with the room (we had a junior suite with balcony). The room was spacious enough, and the view from our balcony was unreal! I had called Hilton's a couple of days prior to our arrival to ensure that they could provide a Pack'n Play for our daughter. I was told this was not going to be a problem. Once we got to the room, there was no Pack'n Play. We had to call downstairs, and they came up with a very narrow rolling crib. This might not be so bad for smaller babies, but at 16 months, my daughter moves around a lot in her sleep. She ended up banging her head against the crib bars and waking up in the middle of the night. Another thing that bugged me was that, even though we had a balcony, we had to go back downstairs to get the key from the front desk; don't know why they couldn't give it to us when we checked in. We decided to have dinner at the downstairs restaurant, the Tudor Bar & Grill. What a disappointment! We tasted 4 different dishes in all, and all were bland. There was no garnish (a steak and mashed potatoes is just that -- steak and mashed potatoes. Nothing else on the plate, not even a lone carrot), no flavor, and too greasy. If you stay at this hotel, forget the restaurant; for NYC, it's just bad. I expected much more. The day of our departure, we called for someone to come pick up our luggage, but it took almost an hour before anyone came. Don't know if they had forgotten about us or what, but that was definitely not stellar service. That being said, we did enjoy the room and the balcony immensely. It was very tastefully decorated, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. It's a true Manhattan hotel -- it has a very authentic feel!

Reviews.Title: “Odd decore”
Reviews.Author: kitkatSouthJersey
Reviews.Content: While the rooms were very comfy and rather elegantly european, the entrance is non-welcoming and the lounge area is way outdated. Looks like something froom the groovy 70's. Lighting is also extremely bright. Dont think of enjoying a nightcap in a romantic or relaxing setting - this place was brighter than necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Brenda065
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton East Manhattan for five nights, upon arrival at 4.00pm our room was not ready for check in, this was disappointing although we were offered a free drink from the bar. Our room was small but very comfortable and immaculately clean. The location was not bad but its a 15 - 20 minute walk to Times Square. I have to admit the staff were not overly friendly, while we were staying there was a foreign primeminister also staying in the hotel and all other paying customers seemed to be completely dismissed, for instance we waited on our morning of departure for 20 minutes for the lift. If I visit New York again I would stay in a different hotel closer to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware: Small Room and Scary View”
Reviews.Author: ym8314
Reviews.Content: Before my trip I was very nervous about staying at this hotel because of the reviews I read about it's room size, location, and customer service. My husband and I just got back from last night after a two night stay and to be honest, I wasn't too pleased. We were waiting in line to be checked in and a young couple walked up and cut in front of us. The lady at the front desk saw this but ignored the situation and helped them before us. I was very UPSET but I didn't do anything because we were there on our anniversary and didn't want to start the trip with a bad vibe. Our room was dark and small but clean. Our one small window view was blocked by the back of an old scary church. The bathroom was small just enough for one person at a time. The hotel was at a safe and nice location but far from most attractions (several blocks to get to places). The two good things about this hotel were the door/bell men and the Asian guy at the front desk. They were VERY helpful and went out of their way to assist us. Would I stay at this hotel again? No.

Reviews.Title: “I vote yes for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tnightgirl
Reviews.Content: As a member of the Hilton honors group, I chose this hotel and felt right at home. I did have one exception, the concierge lady probably should work in the kitchen some place. I did not find her friendly nor very eager to help. I travel to NYC for fun every 3 months and so I know the city fairly well, but have a simple question every once in a while. Hotel was clean and easy to get to. Staff, aside from the one mentioned above, were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “An older hotel recently brought under...”
Reviews.Author: davidahsgr
Reviews.Content: An older hotel recently brought under Hilton brand. Not too conveniently located if you are in a rush in the morning, as it's several long blocks from Grand Central, and taxi going down Avenue "A" (I think) got stuck in traffic; make sure you leave some extra time in the morning to either walk to the subway at Grand Central, or to negotiate traffic (heading out of hotel, there is only one way for the cab to go, and that's to avenue "a"). Older hotel means the windows actually opened, which was great because the air conditioning was way, way too cold, as is often the case in Manhattan hotels in the summer, but it still made for an uncomfortable --not to mention planet-warming -- stay. I only give the room a "3" because of the arctic air that could not be stopped! Very comfortable bed, and room very clean. Nicely appointed bath with a great tub for soaking after a long day. Staff was friendly and helpful, although the bar staff practically demanded a tip, which I find very offputting, but once we tipped them on our first round of drinks, they brought snacks and were very attentive. Bellhop very friendly and jumped to get me a cab; did not demand a tip.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Early morning noise”
Reviews.Author: GurpalLondon_England
Reviews.Content: On vacation with my wife and daughter. Got to the Hotel around 1300hrs and had to wait for a room. Did not mind this as the company I had booked with had messed up. Instead of waiting at the hotel we went out to enjoy the city. The room was great on the 20th Floor. One major problem was that we were woken up in the morning from 0600hrs with a loud 'knocking' sound. I complained but nothing was done about this. This was a disappointment considering it was the HILTON group. We had to suffer this for the duration of our five night stay. There was not even any good will. The Gym on the 2nd floor was small but useful. Breakfast was very expensive, the solution to this was two blocks at PAX they have several branches in Manhattan and are excellent value. From the airport got to the hotel by NYAS bus at $15 per person on the way back got a cab which costs $45 plus toll ($6). The taxi is the better option. Travelling in the city is good as you can get a day pass for the Metro and buses for $8.25 per day. There are several sightseeing tour companies, I chose CitySights. Tipping is terrible as there is always a demand for tips in most places and in some places it is included in the bill. The tips vary from 15 - 20% and you get the shock when the bill is presented to you. Avoid the Cafe Napoli in Little Italy, the tip was 20% but the service was lousy. Be Careful! At Times Square there are several places to eat, watch a show or simply watch the street acts. During the final night the checking out bill was left under the door. Check this, as I was charged for a movie that I did not see. This was refunded. I have used the Hilton hotels before but here in Manhattan they need to improve especially with customer service. If this was improved I would recommend but not at present.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Z_richEve
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one week in August. The room was really big for NY standards, had 3 windows, was really bright and nicely furnished. I could even see the Chrysler building from one of the windows. It took me one night to get used to the sirens on the street, but I like city noise so it was ok. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the Eggs Benedict the Hotel has for Breakfast devine! Grand Central is really close, so is Bryant Park and 5th Avenue. There is also a bus stop close by. But you can easily reach Times Square in 10 Minutes . Once my room did not get cleaned and I had to ask for it to be done and laundry service is really expensive. Other than that a great hotel. I would certainly book there again!

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean Super Convenient”
Reviews.Author: funsville
Reviews.Content: Because I have bedbug paranoia, I first checked the room like a borderline crazy lady to make sure there were no signs of any. Not only were there no signs of ANY kind of bug whatsoever, but there was no sign of any dirt. Anywhere. Had to be one of the cleanest rooms ever. And here's a new one for you, when we left the tip for housekeeping our first night, housekeeping left us a thank you note the next day!! It's an easy walk from Grand Central and an even easier walk to the subway. Cabs wait right outside, so transportation is not an issue at all. If you are looking for a true full-service hotel, this one will fall a little short, but really, if you need a great place to sleep in a convenient location for a reasonable price (at least by NYC standards), this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: CFLA25
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hotel earlier than expected and the concierge recommended leaving our luggages with the bellman to be stored until room was available. One of the bellmans, Chris Colon went out of his way for us and gave us the best customer service ever! We were very happy with our stay! The lobby decor was very beautiful and had a very cozy feeling day or night! Room was spacious for 4 of us. The beds super comforter and feathered pillows a plus!!! I would totally recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Marylanders2
Reviews.Content: Great service and friendliness from all the staff throughout the property: front desk, restaurant, room service, doorman, etc. Recently renovated, good location a few blocks from Grand Central station. Definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: saicken
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find that they upgraded our room to a King Suite! Nice! Their breakfast was included in the package it was continental which had limited but a good selection of food. I found their color coded tags on food very helpful for nutritional information. Their location is very good. Approx 20 minutes walking distance to Time Square and to a lot of places. We walked the whole time there. Their lobby was clean and spacious and friendly staff. I would stay there again even though I waited at least 40 minutes for a bottle opener!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel-- but Services is Poor and Management is AWOL”
Reviews.Author: iqq
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice. Location is excellent and refurbishment since it was Tudor Hotel has made this a very nice Hilton hotel. Unfortunately service standards are very poor (see also review of July 22). Front desk staff are surely and not client oriented at all. My room was not ready until 3:30PM yet they continuously misinformed me of status of readiness making me wait for more than 11/2 hour at the lobby right in front of them. No one acknowledged my presence or attempted to do anything. Hotel is also understaffed at housekeeping meaning rooms are not made until 3Pm or later and you have to argue for even that. Understand there is no general manager on site. Lack of management results in that house keeping blames front desk for their inefficiency and front desk talks about housekeeping as if they belonged to another company and they are not responsible for what happens there. How different from the Hilton at 53d street which is a huge hotel but excellently managed and runs like a clock!!. I hope someone at Hilton reads this review and decides to train the staff and make this hotel as good as it can be. On the positive side, the bell staff are outstanding. I think they used to work there also when this was the Tudor Hotel--- that may be the reason.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: CGspouse
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a 2 night/3 day stay at this hotel. I arrived on Wed morning well before check-in time and the hotel staff was outstanding and helpful with getting me into a room before noon. While waiting for my room, I had breakfast, a long, leisurely one since I had no where to go. My waiter was excellent! He did not rush me, he was attentive but not overbearing and my coffee cup was kept full. My room was actually a little bigger than I expected in looking at photos and reading reviews. I had a queen. I did not have any sort of "view" but that was fine. The room was clean, bed very comfy and the AC worked well. I had room service twice and the staff were very pleasant and the food was good and arrived in a timely manner. My room was also very quiet. I had meetings at NY Med Center and it was an easy walk down a few blocks. I took short cab rides down to 3rd and 59th area for shopping and dining and it was only about $8.00 (probably could have walked if I had better shoes :) All in all, I would definitely stay there again. Every staff person I encountered was very professional, courteous and helpful. Thank you. :D

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: suntravlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our children for a Christmas vacation. The location was great for seeing all the sights, which we did on foot for the most part. Our room was very nice, as was the bathroom --kids loved the tub, and the Bath and Body Works lotion, shampoo, conditioner, and soap were great (Coconut Lime Verbena---smelled great!). It is across from the United Nations buildning, close to the Chrystler building, and Grand Central Station. We were very happy with our stay here, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but ok”
Reviews.Author: TomMoray
Reviews.Content: Fairly typical of a chain of hotels the service is fine if a little impersonal. Small reception that nobody really gathered in and we never ate at the restaurent so couldn't comment on that. The room 1503 was on the corner and very small. It did have windows on two walls from which we could see the east river but the pieces of furniture were so big that they just about filled every bit of floorspace. The air conditioning was very effective and extremely quiet. Would have been impossible to survive without it on around the clock. The location is fine but with temperatures 100+ degrees during mosr of our stay even the shortest walk had us bathed in sweat but this didn't stop us getting out and about even although the hotel is right at the end of East 42nd Street on foot or by subway. This does mean that the location is a little quieter than other areas. Grand Central Station, Top of the Rock, Central Park, Dakota, Times Sqaure, Staten Island and Greenich Village easily reached and indeed we managed to get tickets to see Phantom on Broadway. Staff were ok but the overall experience and feel about the place is that its a little impersonal although this is not exactly meant as a critisism, more an observation. The biggest drawback was the size of the room but I don't think that makes it unique in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Never going to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: sv16
Reviews.Content: We booked our tickets to land in NYC and arrive at the hotel such that we could check in at the standard time of 3 pm. We got there by 3:15 and were told that our two rooms were not available for check in and they had no idea of the status. The check in lady was not rude, but gave me a fake sorry and said she couldn't help it - they were just busy. In the meanwhile, my old parents were hungry and tired so we sat them in the lobby and went to get them food. We came back and by 4:30 pm, only one of the two rooms had been readied. We finally got the second one around 5:30 pm. My beef is with the first check in person who said "she couldn't help it, they were just busy". It's just ridiculous that the hotel wouldn't respect paying traveller's time and not have two rooms ready timely. They claimed that both rooms were really "nice" - but the first one was so typically small that there was no room to walk). The second one was better. A different check in person sent up the second room keys with upgraded breakfast coupons (we already had basic breakfast coupons as part of the package), which I appreciate. Unfortunately even the breakfast was so horrible that we refused to eat there every morning. For a Hilton in midtown, I would think they'd get a better chef/cooks and improve their breakfast. Overall, the hotel is small, in a good location, and has a cute lobby. But their check in procedures and restaurant food (at least for breakfast) need SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENT! Oh not to mention the random noises made by the AC unit at night! And the elevators that would keep getting stuck on floor 16! One positive note - their belldesk staff and door men were simply awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Just ordinary, no more no less ... ....”
Reviews.Author: David1958
Reviews.Content: We were staying at this somewhat ordinary, but ok hotel over Independence weekend. The location is very convenient with many deli/cafes within walking distance. Grand Central Station is a leisurely walk away (about 5 mins). This hotel was once caled the ''Tudor'' (it still has the old neon sign on the side of the building), so I guess Hilton has bought it. The inside and bedrooms have been recently renovated, so it looks somewhat better than from the outside. Our room was clean, tidy and presentable, but extremely small by American standards. The bathroom was just about acceptable, but looked like it needed a re-fit. We never ate in the restaurant, preferring to eat out. It seemed very over-priced for what it offered. The people we spoke to felt that the restaurant wasn't worth the cost. There is a well equipped gym available, although very small in size. The girls on the front desk were extremely warm and friendly and willing to help in any way possible, unlike the man of French origin on the front desk. The hotel is adequate for somewhere as a comfortable sleep-over, but expect any more than that and you may feel a little bit underwhelmed. Personally I would have preferred to have paid a little more for a slightly overall better hotel, rather than 3-star standard hotel which is what this hotel is in my opinion. Would I return to the hotel, on balance probably not. There are far better hotels available in New York with just as good locations, more importantly with better amenities and better-sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Jetten
Reviews.Content: This hotel has now been completely transformed to a Hilton hotel, although from the size of the floors (only 7 rooms per floor) it is still clear that it was not designed as a Hilton. I stayed here for 3 nights as an alternative to the Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea, where I stayed on a previous visit and which had surprised me with the size of the rooms and the grand views over downtown Manhattan. No such surprise here: the rooms are the typical mini-size found all over Manhattan, and windows are smallish with limited views due to the hotel being surrounded by higher buildings. The other big difference with the HGI was the ridiculously expensive wifi, which is free in any HGI. I fail to understand why a more luxurious chain in the Hilton family still charges customers for what is rightly considered a basic service in chains lower down in the same family. Where Hilton does better than HGI is in the decoration of the rooms (and the hotel as a whole) which is really nice, the subtle and quiet aircon. Beds were comfy, and a lovely bathroom (but again: small). The price I paid was higher than what I would have paid if the HGI Chealsea had been available, and I don't believe that the overall level of service sufficiently made up for the price difference, so next time I'll be in the HGI again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Southside
Reviews.Content: Just back from spending all of 12 hours in the hotel, having arrived at 6 p.m. and having left at 6 a.m. But based on that short time, I liked the place. As a Hilton Diamond got a quasi-upgrade had a corner room in a corner that had no view, but it was on the large side (by NYC standards) and was certainly nicely laid out and comfortable. Friendly, efficient staff downstairs. Also very nice that it's a refurbished older hotel, with the best features of a place that's been fixed up combined with a bit of the charm that comes with an older property. And it does have a boutique feel to it. Got free internet thrown in, but that was because my rate included a breakfast that I was entitled to anyway by virtue of my Hilton status. (Though I left too early for it in any event!) Possible that HH elites could trade their free breakfast for the free internet, but don't necessarily count on it. A few minor matters re the room: the desk is right beneath the overhead ventilation system, I didn't come across the normal variety of new channels (but maybe I just missed them in my haste) when doing a quick channel surf, and the toilet seemed to be kind of low pressure. But no big deal. A slightly bigger potential deal is that the concierge desk closes at 6 p.m. The front desk person was fine at recommending a few nearby restaurants, but the concierge hours seem a little odd to me, given that folks might need advice or help after 6 p.m. One thing I'd add for folks who don't know the neighborhood is that the hotel is about a block away from Tudor City, a pleasant little corner of NYC if you want to take a brief walk, hang out in the very relaxing smallish park there, and/or take in a view of the East River/UN. Bottom line, though, based on my 12 hours, is that I'd go back and might even consider it my first choice for a Hilton in NYC, considering location, quality and price ($260 advance purchase, at a rate that included breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Fosforita
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and liked it very much. The location was unbelievable and the staff was really wonderful. I would like to commend Vito Marangon at the front desk as he literally jumped through hoops for us to get us the room we had reserved. He was always pleasant and didn't bother us with the problem, just let us know when it had been fixed, and quickly. We travel extensively and I would say he was the best guest service person we have experienced. That said, the room #1701 where stayed was very small. If you didn't want to lie down all the time, there was no place where we could sit and relax. Very clean though and housekeeping was most attentive. The use of the computers involved a minimum of $5.00 had to be used @ $.34 per minute. Extra charge if you wanted to print something. I would say that the hotel is already hooked up for internet use so why a charge is necessary, I can only surmise. I agree that there should be a charge for printing to cover paper and ink. Otherwise, I do not feel this is a friendly situation for the casual traveler as I had to pay $5.00 + just to print 2 boarding passes. Drinks at the bar are minimum of $10 each. Breakfast was sufficient although the use of powdered eggs to make the scrambled eggs was awful. You could order omelets and eggs separately but we didn't know this until I complained about the scrambed style. I think the staff again won this race - very helpful and pleasant. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and it is a great base for seeing the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good Service, Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Southern-Saint
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Hilton Manhattan East, formerly Tudor Hotel, had a great stay. This hotel is in a good location for exploring the city, with Grand central a couple of blocks along 42nd St and a MTA bustop right outside the hotel. as previously stated by others the room we had was a bit small, but very clean and quiet. Large people may struggle to get along side the bed as it was very close to the wall of the room on one side and the desk on the other. The bed was very comfortable, this was one of those rare occasions when I was not glad to get back into my own bed when I got home. All the staff were friendly and helpful, The fitness room although compact was well fitted out, but full when five people were using the main equipment. We did not eat or drink in the hotel because of the prices. We found plenty of places to eat locally, the food concourse in Grand Central Station is very good for breakfast. Our stay in New York was made easier by purchasing a MTA 7 day ticket $45 for unlimited travel. We used the bus and Subways all the time. Very easy to use, even when going to the outer reaches of the city. We were travelling in a group of four so always felt secure, loan travellers would need to be more carefull, especially in the evenings or at night. New York is a great and colourfull place, the people we met were all very friendly and helpful, as soon as we looked the least bit lost or confused a New Yorker would ask if we needed help, give directions or recommend the best places to go. If you have never been to New York, it's a place everyone should try and get to and the Hilton Manhatten East was great base to explore from. (Might be a bit pricey now it is a Hilton)

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished to what point?”
Reviews.Author: Graham M
Reviews.Content: An old hotel brought up to date? - the double glazing cuts out the sounds of the City but the noise of the air conditioning does a great job of replacing it. The bathroom, as many in New York, was designed for PORGs and the service in the restaurant simply appalling. I stayed here because the hotel is a partner of British Airways which is a problem that airline does not need at the moment. It has a great location but absolutely nothing else goingt for it.

Reviews.Title: “The loudest room I've ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: jeffdrum
Reviews.Content: It is currently 2AM, and since I cannot sleep I figured I'd write a review. Upon arrival, the room I was given smelled like a locker room. So, they moved me down the hall. This room smells better, but the ventilation system is so loud it makes the room shake. It seems as though the toilets from all adjoining floors flush in this room. And, the walls are so thin, I hear every person that walks by. They claim the hotel is sold out, so they will not move me. Do not stay here! There are far too many hotels in NYC to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gregory09
Reviews.Content: Hilton Manhattan East is just a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station, the terminus for one of the airport buses from Newark which meant we could save on taxi fares and only have to wheel our luggage a short distance. The original room we were allocated (rear, 3rd floor) was close to the extractor fan for the restaurant so we asked to move and were accommodated the next day, moving to the 12th floor overlooking 42nd Street. The "double glazing" (extra sliding window behind the inside ledge) did a good job of cutting out traffic noise and sleeping was never a problem. The room was cleaned everyday and the standard was excellent, we returned to find everywhere spotless. We found all of the staff from receptionists, bellhops, doormen really friendly and helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel, breakfast not being included in our deal, and the menu prices looked on the pricey side but we were able to "improvise" with supplies from the local supermarket. The hotel has a number of ice machines on certain floors, ideal for keeping milk cool! We'd booked the hotel through a well known budget site and felt we got a great price for our money. We had a comfortable and enjoyable stay and being in the heart of central Manhattan was fantastic, our room view included the East River, the United Nations and Chrysler buildings. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlancaBunny
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Tudor after booking at the Milford Plaza and having our reservations switched due to renovations. the M switched us to the Tudor and it was a good move. The lobby is on the small side, but who cares! The staff was nice. The room was even better. Our Balcony ran almost the whole length of the room and was GREAT! The room was kinda small but you could move around. The bathroom had a spa tub and was nice. It was neat and clean. Only draw back was you could hear your neighbors doors close and open. So many small shops and restaurants near by which is good because room service was iffy not always available.. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “quaint, cosy and very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: littlemisscontent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tudor in December as part of our honeymoon. Like others we'd booked their sister hotel which ended up being closed for renovations. Not having been to New York before, and not understanding what "a block" meant we were unsure of the walk from 42nd and 2nd near the UN to say Times Square. Though, pleased to say that we walked this and further everyday no worries. In the snow, with wet shoes an all! It was so much fun. Location wise there is a great little asian supermarket around the corner where we got great bagels at 3am on the first night. It's a safe part of town, and like other reviews, the bus service and subway is close buy. We loved catching the subway from the 7 line or grand central and just going whereever we wanted. We also bought our statue of liberty tour pass from the concierge and strongly recommend that you take up the "express" tour ticket, it's like being a celebrity how quickly you get rushed up to the top! Definitelly worth the extra dollars. We didn't really eat at the hotel, with so much to do in New York we mostly ate out. We went to Tom's Restaurant (you know from Seinfeld) by catching the subway to Morningside Heights and walking up to the main road. Though a little daunting at first, being in a different sort of area, we found New York and all the suburbs of Manhattan Island to be so wonderfully friendly and secure. The police were also very helpful, and would openly ask us if we were ok when we looked confused! I particularly loved going for dinner in little italy, or china town, there is so much to choose from and great (cheap!) prices! Hotel room was AMAZING, we got a free upgrade for our honeymoon, and compared to some places in London or Europe, this place was dreamy. Super super comfy sleeps every night and no noise from others to wake us up. I used the gym a bit too and the sauna which was nice, for those that keep to routine!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Just Renovated in Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: nemfong
Reviews.Content: The pros: This hotel is located on 42nd St. and the corner of 2nd Ave. The 42nd St. bus line stops right in front of the hotel and the 2nd Ave. bus line is across the street. Grand Central Station is about 4 blocks from the hotel. Needless to say, transportation was great! It's set in a great location and very quiet. There are two towers for this hotel. There were renovations going on and only one elevator working almost every day. The night we checked in, the room they put us in was at the North Tower on the last floor (17th). The room was a typical small NYC room, but it was a nice room...just small. One problem, it was not made up. The bed looked like someone slept in it and there were towels on the bathroom floor. One elevator working was a little annoying because we had to wait for it to go all the way down to the check in area. The Asian guy (don't remember his name) was really nice and apologetic. He moved us to a suite in the South Tower, which was a much nicer and bigger room. We especially loved the space since we have a 6 year old with us. He enjoyed the room, especially the jacuzzi! There was no view for us though because we were on the sixth floor. We faced the top back of the church (next door), which was fine. The hotel will be a Hilton in a few days and the renovations were on the lobby area, dining area and elevators. Every night we returned to the hotel, it seemed like something different happened, which was nice. They even changed out the alarm clock in our room after a few days and it had the Hilton logo on it. They put gold labels over the Tudor name in the room. The cons: The housekeeping at this hotel is the only bad thing about this hotel. They would make the bed and clean the bathroom, but they wouldn't refill the coffee, sugar and didn't replace the toilet paper when it was empty. They just left the toilet holder piece sitting on the tray where the toiletries were. I'm sure when it becomes the Hilton, this will change. Overall, it was a great stay and we really enjoyed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: orourke136
Reviews.Content: I would recommend anyone to stay at the Tudor Hotel..Unfortunately, I believe after April, it will not be the "affordable, little Boutique hotel" that it once was. It is being bought by Hilton, hence my thoughts that although it will still be a beautiful place to stay, the cost will skyrocket! The rooms were so nice, my husband and I received a room with a balcony. It was not a great view, but nice enought to sit outside on a beautiful morning and enjoy the sights and sounds of New York!!! We did have breakfast included and it was decent. It was nice to be able to grab something before we had to leave and head back home. The room....The bed was sooo comfortable. We left the windows in our room open all night and the breeze came in, fresh air in a New York City hotel is unheard of...Well, not here. The concierege was second to none. Valeted my car, called for it and ten mins. later it was there. We walked everywhere we had to go, no need for public transportation. Now,, this might not be for everyone but on a beautiful spring Saturday in the high 60's it was nice to walk to the theater district. It was about 14 blocks, but such a nice chance to take in the East Side of Manhattan. I would highly recommend this to anyone that asks and have already! The Tudor is definitely on my list of keepers!

Reviews.Title: “The Tudor - NYC”
Reviews.Author: LennetteN
Reviews.Content: A good location. Average rooms but very nice and friendly staff. We got our room for a great price which made the stay well worth it. It was so easy to use the buses and subways from this location. UN and water tax very close.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room and friendly staff - Great!!”
Reviews.Author: aghasue
Reviews.Content: Stayed in The Tudor from 25-28 February 2010. I was wary before I arrived, because a number of reviewers had mentioned ongoing renovations. Thankfully by the time we had arrived nearly all work had been completed and there was no disruption at all. The reception staff were very helpful and polite and the hotel was in a great location just a few blocks from Grand Central Terminal and a short walk from Times Square. The room was quite large by New York standards and had everything we needed. It was also lovely and quiet. There was an ice machine available and a coffee maker in the room as well. The room was very warm (despite the 10 inches of snow outside!!) and I couldn't seem to lower the temperature on the thermostat, but the windows opened, so this wasn't a major problem. The water in the bathroom wasn't very warm when we arrived, but after we spoke to reception satff, they seemed to rectify this too and there were no other problems. The breakfast was lovely and there was a good variety of hot and cold food in the buffet. Overall, I would definitely visit again. Just a note though - the hotel is changing to a Hilton hotel in mid March, so you may need to revise your search accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Tudor Hotel-rocky start but ok”
Reviews.Author: pjl52
Reviews.Content: I had reservations for 4 days--I called the day of travel to inform them I would be arriving between 11pm-midnight. This was a priceline reservation (we paid only $100/night). When I arrived there I was told that there was no room for me---that I could go to their Holiday Inn property on Lafayette Street near Canal. I was very annoyed, as could be expected.
