I negotiated a better room and free breakfast buffet for the next three days. They paid cab fare to and fro. When I returned the next day, they could not be nicer. The room was great and had a comfortable stay. The breakfast buffet which is priced at 24$ was very good--much like that at a Court Yard hotel--not the most spectacular one could imagine. But it was free, and my hungry teenage son and I stocked up on food for the day. I would suggest that there are far more economical places for breakfast. The hotel is on the corner of Second Ave and 42 street. Several bus lines stop right in front of the hotel. It is easy to get around the entire city by careful study of the Manhattan bus map--get a one-day transit pass. It is a great deal. Overall we had an enjoyable stay despite the trouble at the start. Given the chance, I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay, loved the Tudor!”
Reviews.Author: SFRolla
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed comments I was a little wary about what our experience would be here at the Tudor. I have to comment that this was one of the best stays of my life. I have traveled from coast to coast and to the south pacific but this was my first trip to NYC. I don't know how this room may compare to other NY hotel rooms but in my eyes it could not get any better. It began with the basic need that my flight arrived at 8am and check in is at 3pm. I called ahead to see if I could arrange an early check in (AMEX actually called for me) and happened to inform them this was my anniversary. Well when we got to the hotel at around 9:30am they had our room ready and we got upgraded to a Jr. Suite on the 19th floor with a view of the river! In my eyes people from NY are more direct in dealing with you and please and thank you and small talk are not always prevalent. Not at the Tudor, I got all the hospitality I am used to from the entire staff. The room itself was just great, and from what I have heard rooms in NY can tend to be quite small. Not at all in our case, the room looked to be recently renovated and a decent size with couches a sitting area and large bathroom with jacuzzi. I really liked the large flat screen TV which swiveled so it could be viewed from the sitting area to the bed. I didn't come to NY to watch TV but I absolutely love the Olympics, and being on west coast time I would lay in bed watching them late into the night. The bathroom looked recently renovated as well, black granite countertops, toilet and bidet, and shower with jacuzzi tub. Housekeeping was fast when we needed some small. Very clean room and linens, we had to use the additional blanket in the closet as I don't like using the heater too much, and every day after that first night the bed was made up with the extra blanket already there. To some people this is not a big deal and should be expected, but to us the little things like that are just nice. We only used the hotel restaurant once for brunch and it was pretty good. The service again was great as the waiters would walk around bring us more muffins and pastries without asking. In addition to bringing us our drinks they asked if they could make us an omelet of our choosing even though there was no omelet station. All the staff was great about giving us tips about NY, particularly when we wanted a late night bite to eat or directions for wherever we wanted to go. We walked into the hotel around 2am one night and asked the front desk if there was anywhere to eat so late and she pulled out a menu of a local place which delivers 24hours with very reasonable prices, a very nice thing to have when you are hungry late at night in a strange city. On the last morning when we had to check out in took a matter of about 30 seconds to complete. We had to leave the hotel at 5am, and the pleasant woman at the front desk who helped with checkout also called our cab. Not only that but she called the cab to check on the status of when he would arrive after he did not come in the first three minutes, it felt nice to have someone so considerate of our time schedule even though we were not is such a rush that 5 min mattered. I know the reviews are quite mixed, but with satisfaction being so subjective you can’t please everyone. I actually recall reading one of the reviews complaining about the one-touch light switch which controls all the lights in the room, I mean c’mon pushing a button confuses some people. In our case my expectations were blown away with an outstanding stay at the Tudor.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: KATHYGOW
Reviews.Content: I`ve been meaning to write this review for a while, so better late than never. Went to NYC last October with my best friends to celebrate turning the big 4-0! Booked the Tudor based on price and location. It was a swift 10 minute walk to Grand Central Station and a further 10 minute walk to Times Square . We found a great breakfast and lunch spot called Pax on the way. Being apart from the action meant a quiet sleep at night. The rooms are small but have everything you need . Plenty of room (and mirrors! ) for 4 women to get ready. Lots of great restaurants nearby and we always felt very safe walking at night. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading and bad”
Reviews.Author: Niki1Lu2
Reviews.Content: We went to the Tudor on a work related trip to New York. We were told we would have a suite and the pictures online looked fabulous. We got there and the hotel was being renovated - no room service, no food in the hotel, no water bottles in the rooms. The entire front of the hotel was tarped over. No warning when we checked in. We also did not get our suite. The room was terrible, so small - smaller than most hotels in NY. We also couldn't open the bathroom door all the way - it hit the shower rod. Lighting was poor and the airvent was directly over the bed and filthy - really, really filthy. The room was clean, but no amenities - one of our co-workers had a used bar of soap in her room. Our little shampoo bottles had been clearly recycled and filled a few times over. This would have been tolerable if the staff had been remotely friendly or helpful. We had a loud banging in our room and when we called we were told "I have no idea" with no offer to help. It was miserable. Another reviewer commented on the odor and I would second that. We couldn't figure out how the entire hotel smelled like beef stew when there was no kitchen in operation during our stay. So odd.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you like walking.”
Reviews.Author: MississaugaNewton
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very clean and bright and great value. Didn't have a view but didn't care because we were out all day and at night too tired. Nice location, within walking distance to Times Square. Grand central station was close. The $8 subway pass was a great way to get around easily and quickly. Also, recommend first timers take one of the bus tours, you will learn alot about New York in a short amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: brattex
Reviews.Content: We scored this hotel at a reduced price on PRICELINE, so we came in with an open mind considering what we had actually paid for our room; please bear this in mind when reading this review; we paid a lot less than the going rate for the room so our views may be a bit skewed. We requested a room as high up as possible, and we were given a room on the 11th floor. Our view from the room was unfortunately of the building next to ours, but we couldn't complain since we had scored a leftover room so most of the decent ones were probably already requested by other patrons. We received good service from the staff in the hotel, and everyone was friendly and helpful. We took advantage of the in-house concierge to get tips and suggestions on what to do, but we didn't buy any Broadway tickets through the concierge, since they worked out at double the price to us booking them ourselves! Our room was a lot smaller than we had expected, since we had stayed in the Long Island City - Manhattan View Holiday Inn previously, but it was cleverly laid out and maximised the limited space. The HD TV lacked HD channels, but otherwise all the standard facilities were there (be sure to set parental control on the TV if you need to). Bathroom included a shower and bath which was a step up for us, and the coffee maker was located in the bathroom. The only problem we had was that the thermostat measured temperatures in F only, and we had to do mental conversions into C to get the temperatures we wanted, but it wasn't a big problem. Located near the east end of Manhattan, it was about four blocks away from the nearest subway station (Grand Central Station), but did have a very conveniently located bus stop right outside the hotel, so if you have a METRO pass, it's good for the bus stop or the subway, so you can catch the bus to the subway, and then transfer to whatever subway route you want. We didn't explore the hotel much since it was just meant to be a place to rest for us, but we did enjoy our stay nonetheless. Rooms were peaceful and quiet, and overall were very comfortable. We did have trouble opening our room window, but we gave the hotel the benefit of the doubt here and convinced ourselves during our stay that this was a security measure rather than a fault, but honestly we think it was a fault. The best part about our stay here was that it felt like a better-than-average hotel in Manhattan for a really good price. The biggest problems we had were the lack of any decent Manhattan view, and the distance from the SUBWAY (but as stated before this was overcome by the bus stop outside). I'm not sure if I would have felt as satisfied if I had had to pay full price for the room, but I have nothing to compare it to in Manhattan so I can't say for sure if it's a good Manhattan hotel or a poor Manhattan hotel!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: zobo1
Reviews.Content: recently stayed at the tudor hotel with my boyfriend for xmas shopping and sight seeing! had booked another hotel closer to time square but it decided to close for renovations! but the tudor hotel agreed the same rate of $125 per night so i was happy, on arrival the lobby is lovely the staff are extremely helpful at giving you directions and advice on subways and maps etc! our room was very spacious had a queen room on the 7th floor bathroom was big enough, overall this hotel is ideal for a trip to nyc is close to grand central and a 10min straight walk to time square! awesome loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: sophiafalcon
Reviews.Content: It is unfair to say that the Tudor is bad- the staff is competent, the location is near public transport, and the rooms are not unclean. For someone needing just a bed, this hotel suffices. It is the little things- lingering, stale smells from breakfast or past guests, bad lighting in the awkwardly dark rooms looking out to the sides of other buildings- that make this hotel joyless to stay at. WIth prices and services similar to a Club Quarters or a nicer Holiday Inn, I would suggest staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: bajan300
Reviews.Content: Like most others that were there around Christmas, I was also re-booked there because of "unexpected" renovations at my other hotel. Well.. the negative : it seems that because of the way the room doors are most ppl tend to slam them to close and that gets to you after a while but luckily you don't hear it too often as they're not many rooms per floor. That for me was the only negative. The hotel itself is clean, lounge area it tastefully set up and staff have been friendly throughout my stay. The room I must say is surprisingly big for Midtown Manhattan accommodation (Deluxe).... also a larger than expected bathroom. Everything was better than expected and have no regrets for being switched there !! FYI ... if you have a laptop with WiFi..... search for a signal you're guaranteed to find one that's open rather than paying the hotel access rates. It's not as close to Time's Square as I've usually been but the bus runs directly in front of the hotel and Grand Central is a short walk away. Would be happy to stay there again !!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: n2cats15
Reviews.Content: We had booked our room with another Hotel that decided they needed renovations during the Christams season! We we fortunate to be rebooked with the Tudor Hotel. They honored our rate from the other hotel. Each and every time I conatcted the Tudor the staff were very nice, very helpful. This continued to be true from the moment we walked in the front door untill check out. Everyone bent over backwards to help us. The room was very comfortable. We had requested a room with two beds at the original hotel but the Tudor did not have a double room available. We traveled with my 16 year old grandson and they were gratious enough to waive the $30.00 per night fee. All three of us were satisfied with the accomodations. I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: MSpiro
Reviews.Content: A few years ago I stayed in NY for 3 days during the holidays icluding New Years Eve! I recieved a good rate package! One night we even ate at the hotel, very luxurious!!! My room at the Tudor was small, but a boutique, luxurious room. Very pleasant overall!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: suzyqVermont
Reviews.Content: At first glance the room seemed small (deluxe queen) but once we settled in the room was fine. Clean and lovely decor. The bed was the best hotel bed I have ever slept in. Down comforter and pillows. Stephanie at the concierge desk was the best. She always had the answers we needed and more. Stay away from the bicycle rick shaw people they are ripoffs. The doorman and bell staff was the best. This was the first time my husband and I stayed at the tudor. We will definetly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful!! Customer service is NILL!!!”
Reviews.Author: etraveler_1969
Reviews.Content: As a family we really like the first impression.. The people at the front were efficient, but very very cold. I do understand that we were 2nd class due to me booking it the reservation on Priceline, so I figured I might not be the biggest spender. Little do they know!! We had a good time and overall the stay was vanilla, but did the trick. We travel to the New York city a lot from down south and we wanted to stay at the Tudor again. We book a reservation through the Hotel reservation line in the lobby (Not Priceline) and book another week during Thanksgiving. Me being the shopper I'm, I used my iphone and started looking for some place closer to the Parade Rout and found another Hotel. Better price, closer to parade and new to us. Oh and 4-1/2 Star not 3-1/2. My wife picked up the lobby phone about 1 hour after booking and canceled the reservation. Ok we are not the most responsible and did not write down the cancellation confirmation number, but who figures you are going to need it? Well we did! As we checked to our Hotel of choice for the Thanksgiving week vacation, we noticed later that night a $390 charge from the Tudor hotel. I called and explained the painful story to them and without our confirmation number they would not remove the charge and basically said your SOL!! I talked to the Front Desk Manager and Hotel manager and they did nothing except (Not Return My Call). I was not worried as I called my credit card company and disputed the charge and within 48hours had the money back in my account. They lost 3x. 1 for the $390 - 2 for the lost customer - 3 for all of you who will read this and maybe pass on this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel and a fantastic value.”
Reviews.Author: Eauboy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend at the Tudor. I can't say enough about how convenient the Tudor is and how great a value. The room was small (of course) but the bathroom was surprisingly large and well appointed. The staff were gracious and friendly. We could see the river and the U.N. from our room (North tower, 1103), which was fun. It is an easy walk to Rockefeller center, extremely near the Chrysler building. I will stay here again next time I visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & staff but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: GeoffTorquay
Reviews.Content: If you want a central location and not pay a fortune, this one is OK. Not a 4-star quality but the rooms are adequate if somewhat tired, as are the public areas. Easy walking to most attractions and the concierge and reception staff were very helpful. Beware the bar closing before you can walk back after a show.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline booking worked out great”
Reviews.Author: Drad1109
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Tudor Hotel for a long weekend and had a very good experience. This was my first experience booking through Priceline and I was a bit apprehensive about how it might work out. After booking I contacted the hotel to ask about a room with a king bed. The reservation clerk informed me that they would attempt to honor my request at check-in, but there was no way to guarantee the availability with my Priceline booking. As an alternative, she asked if i would like to upgrade for an additional $20 per night, thereby guaranteeing a king bed. As we were staying for 3 nights, I chose to upgrade. Upon checking in we were given a spacious corner room with views of the United Nations and the East River. The room also had a small balcony with a table and two chairs with a view toward the river. The bathroom was modern and spacious with a jetted tub. While I would not describe the hotel as luxurious (especially the rather plain lobby and bar), it was clean, very well-located and our room was fabulous. What a bargain! We would most definitely choose to stay at the Tudor again, especially at rates similar to the Priceline rates.

Reviews.Title: “New York isn't for the hotel anyway”
Reviews.Author: jemica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tudor from the 8-12th of Oct. Nothing fancy. Booked on Priceline for a reasonable price. The room with one bed was TINY, but the room with 2 double was OK. It didn't matter, we didn't come for the hotel, anyway. We came to see New York City! The rooms were clean and there was an in room coffee maker and hairdryer. There is a bar and restaurant downstairs, altho, a bit pricey and we didn't use it. There is a restaurant a couple blocks away called PAX. Great breakfast at a reasonable price. We were only a short walk from Grand Central Terminal and probably about 20 minutes walk from Times Square. Would stay there again, but not at full price, only if I was booked there by Priceline. Didn't find staff overly friendly, but neither was the rest of New York City staff.

Reviews.Title: “Internal Scam Suspected”
Reviews.Author: brucecole
Reviews.Content: Reservations were made directly to the hotel in May 2009 for Oct 2009, for 5 nights.. (Telephone statement verifies the telephone number). Because of the low rate offered, they said they required a credit card payment in advance. An e-mail message was returned to us with confirmation number, address of hotel, phone number They also told us during the phone call that a full refund would be available if we had to cancel. Due to illness , on Oct. 1st we called the hotel to cancel. They had no record of the reservation. Management accepted no responsibility nor offered any sympathy. "You have been scammed" was their answer. We also phoned their corporate office, and did not receive a call back. So yourself a favour - avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Not even 2.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: tcarral
Reviews.Content: The lobby is practically nonexistent, the doors behind the reception desk are falling apart, the carpeting in the restaurant and bar are not clean (we didnt eat there, it looked a little depressing), the concierge I guess is only there in the morning, and not in the greatest of moods (let alone helpful). The rooms are TINY, we didnt know where to put our suitcases, and the carpet, also not very clean, the bathroom, looks old, and again... tiny (although clean). Also, after about 5 or 6pm, there is no one outside to help you get a cab or something. Location is good, a block away from the UN and about 6 blocks from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel77
Reviews.Content: Wow, we really enjoyed this hotel. After reading some of the negative reviews we were really concerned. The hotel is beautiful; listed in the National Register of Historic Hotels. Our room and bathroom were immaculate. I loved the location, just a few blocks from Grand Central and surrounded by restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Great value for your $$.”
Reviews.Author: Loqua57
Reviews.Content: The Tudor hotel was located about 2 blocks from Grand Central station, which allowed us to take the subway pretty much anywhere. The room was kind of small, but as would be expected anywhere in NYC. Overall, good hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “VERY pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: mtonello
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel back in the 1970's and remember it as rather dark and gloomy and not very special. My stay here a few weeks ago was booked for me and I was not expecting to be impressed or even enjoy the two nights I would be staying here again, after all these years. I was totally, and pleasantly surprised. The hotel has obviously been recently renovated and nicely done. My room was quite large (by NYC standards) with a large closet and lots of hangers, a nice seatings alcove with two large windows overlooking the street and a bit of expansive view, a very large bathroom with large window providing lots of daylight. The bathroom had a superb shower and great lighting. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The location is superb (a few blocks from Grand Central Station). I also found the price to be extremely fair. The rate was quite a bit less than lesser quality hotels in the Times Square area, which I tend to avoid as they are normally very noisy at night (which this hotel wasn't). Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: carolyn0219
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were looking for a reasonable and decent room and we found it. The hotel quality was very nice, and the staff was extremely helpful. It wasn't super fancy, but it did have windows that opened, nice toiletries, and a clean atmosphere. I had a much more enjoyable experience than I did at the W Tuscany the night before. The moral of the story? Don't spend more money assuming you are goint to get something better. I recommend the Tudor at the U.N. While you're there, McFadden's across the street is lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - will be staying there again.”
Reviews.Author: andrewaustin
Reviews.Content: I traveled to New York with my wife for a filming project, and we needed somewhere fairly central. When we were looking around for a hotel beforehand, we were surprised to see how much prices were increased for early September - most hotels we found had literally tripled their prices, presumably to cash-in on the increased traffic to the city for Sept. 11 memorials. The Tudor hotel was one of the few that remained at normal pricing and value. The room was clean, modern with full facilities, and the staff friendly and attentive. We liked. The only problem, albeit a small one, was that the doors to the rooms are pretty heavy and secure and cannot be closed quietly (we tried - not possible). Early-to-bed-light-sleepers might wish to take earplugs. We will certainly be booking at the Tudor hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with my stay”
Reviews.Author: EarnyinLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during Labor Day weekend. Unfortunately the room wasn't ready when I got there at around 5 PM. Besides that, the location was great and pretty quiet. There was a subway station about 2 blocks away for the 7 line. I didn't find that one until after I had got off at Grand Central Station. Room was clean and nicely appointed. Only negative to the hotel was that the walls are thin and you can hear your neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirl23
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty nice. The room was clean but small. It was sufficient for us. We didn't spend that much time in our hotel anyways. We got the hotel room at a good price on priceline. $115/night. They told us that our hotel room would be ready at 3pm, but when we arrived at 4pm, it still wasn't ready. They made us wait another 30 mins. I was kinda annoyed about that. Especially since we took a red eye and showed up at the hotel at 7am asking what time our room would be ready. They told us it was 2 twin beds (there was 4 of us), but it actually turned out to be 2 full size beds. So that was a plus. The bathroom was very spacious, but the room was small and always had a musty smell. The lights are controlled from this "master control panel". There was one by the door and one by the bed. The one by the door didn't work. The hotel was a short walk from Grand Central Terminal. It was actually farther from the Metro than I would prefer, but it was not too bad. We had little contact with the staff so I can't really comment on them. However, housekeeping never gave us more soap. We were there for 1 week and they gave us more shampoo and conditioner, but not more soap. Weird huh? Overall, I would recommend the hotel at the price I paid, but not at the full price the hotel normally books for, which is around $200-$250/night.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: ttn204
Reviews.Content: This hotel bills itself as a 3.5 star, but really it should be 2 stars. I've had better service at motels. When I checked in 1 hour before the official check in time, they refused to find a room that was ready, and flatly told me to check my bags with a porter. If it had been really busy, I could understand. As it was, the hotel was only half full. Then when we checked into our hotel, there were not one piece of towel in the room! They made us wait to check in because the "room was not ready", and no towels when we did check in? I'm sure it was an oversight, but why make us wait an hour to check in when it still wasn't ready in the end? The bathroom door was uneven, so we could not close it. And the room reeked of smoke, even though it was supposed to be non-smoking. At almost $200 per night, I would advise all to avoid this hotel. You're better off with a 2 star for less price with the same service, if not better, or to spend a little more and get better service and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service was sometimes lacking”
Reviews.Author: my_travels99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for almost a week in July. A few of our friends also stayed at the hotel. We got a good rate on Priceline. The location is great. It's on the south side of E 42nd St just east of 2nd Ave, up the block from the united nations. There's a Starbucks across 2nd and plenty of restaurants nearby on 2nd Ave and on 42nd St. Like other reviewers have said it's about a 25-30 min walk to Times Square. The closest subway station is at Grand Central where you can catch the green and purple lines. There's no parking in front of the hotel and we had to temporarily park in the diplomat parking zone to drop off our luggage. Hotel parking was $59/night. Our friends found parking for $27/night at Central Parking on 1st Ave (a 15 min walk back to the hotel). The street and area seemed very safe and we didn't encounter any problems even walking back to the hotel at 1am. If you walk back to the hotel along 42nd, the hotel has a neon light sign you can see from a few blocks away to give you an idea how much further you have to go. The rooms were quaint, a little on the small side but acceptable. The queen sized bed was comfortable and the sheets clean. The room and bathroom looked to have been renovated recently. The walls are rather thin though and we could hear the ice machine on our floor at night (note that there are only ice machines on certain floors of the hotel) and people talking in the hallway. One night some other hotel guests came back around 5am and their talking in the hall woke us up. There is a stated charge for internet access but I was able to find some open wireless networks to connect to and use the internet when needed. Now to the matter of the service. Some of the days we stayed there it was severely lacking. First, we asked for some toothpaste but it was never delivered. Then there was the daily game of guessing how many towels we would have to use. The first night we had 3 partial sets of towels (only 2 facecloths) and a bathmat. The next night we only had two sets of towels and no bathmat. Another night we had 2 sets of towels and a bathmat. At least when we asked for an extra set it was delivered promptly. Some days the toilet paper and tissue box weren't replaced. Overall, since we didn't spend much time in the hotel other than sleep, it was more than adequate. The great location more than outweigh the minor inconveniences of inconsistent service. I would stay here again given the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DebOChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I made a four-night reservation for this hotel on Priceline, so I got a great rate. This was the first time that we went for a 3.5-star (boutique) instead of a 4-star hotel in NYC on Priceline and we were just delighted. The location is phenomenal--Tudor City Is like another universe--hard to believe you're just a couple blocks from Grand Central Station. There are quiet parks (with fireflies this time of year), beautiful views down to the East River and the UN, and elegant restaurants nestled in the bottoms of beautiful old apartment houses. The historic building the hotel is in is really charming, and our room was clean, pleasant, comfortable, and had a great view. A couple minor flaws: housekeeping is strangely chintzy with the toiletries--one bar of soap was provided at the start of our stay and was not replenished (however, we asked at the front desk and were cheerfully provided with a couple more), and shampoo was not provided on the first night. Also, the towels aren't great quality and smell strongly of detergent. Finally, the high-speed internet provided by the hotel is rather expensive ($14.95/day)--so much so that I decided to forgo using my laptop during my stay. On the whole, though, we found this to be a great choice, loved that the place had more character than the big chain 4-stars we usually stay in, and loved the proximity to a unique NYC neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at good price in good location”
Reviews.Author: JPCWaterford_CTUSA
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant surprise. At $160, it was a true bargain for New York. The rooms were quiet and clean. The location 2 blocks from Grand Central Station was certainly convenient. Because it was on the East Side, it was actually in a pretty quiet location for midtown Manhattan. Clean, quiet and safe at sub-Manhattan prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and staff”
Reviews.Author: cldst221
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our room and the service provided by the front desk. The walk to Grand Central station was short and you could get any where with a transfer on the subway. One thing I do recommend is a good nyc map with roads and subway it's invaluable. Have fun you won't regret your hotel choice! Oh and the Pax a block and a half away towards the train station has good food that isn't too expensive from a NYC view.

Reviews.Title: “Solid central Manhatten hotel in a good spot”
Reviews.Author: pegster110
Reviews.Content: I wasnt sure what to think when this hotel popped up for me on Priceline but I have to say i was very pleasently surprised. A decent sized room for NY which was extra nice as its was on the corner on a quiet tree lined street. A minor let down was the big bloom on the shower promised much but delivered little. I didn't have much interaction with staff but when i did they were very courteous. One other annoyance is that it bugs me when you cannot print your boarding pass for free in the business center. The location is excellent and is only a short walk to Grand Central Station. Overall a nice quiet hotel which has a bit of character about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for UN Business”
Reviews.Author: gehararigo
Reviews.Content: The UN is within easy walking distance. The hotel gives a good location and the price is moderate. However, the service is basic and I felt uneasy that a lift to guest rooms were not easily watched by any staff of the hotel, ie. just next to the entrance before the reception. Otherwise, it is OK and I do not mid to come back for business but will think about to use during me holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy. Great place to stay if you're sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: Emilie_Atl
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The room was a pretty decent size, especially for NYC. The bed was very comfortable. The room was quiet and didn't have much street noise. The bathroom was a typical hotel bathroom but was clean and big enough to move around in. Service was fast and friendly. We were there during a GA session at the UN, so it was somewhat crowded with business travelers, but even then everything was pleasant. The breakfast is pretty pricey so consider eating elsewhere. The location is great - close to Time Square and the Theater District. Fairly close to the subway and Grand Central Station. Finding a taxi is not a problem. All in all, a great place that I would stay at again with or without kids, for business or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location”
Reviews.Author: LMCJR
Reviews.Content: I´m a travel addicted and I do like to stay in very good hotels. NY is an expensive city and I were afraid when I booked Tudor Hotel, however, it become a very nice surprise! The hotel is located on 42nd just 5 minutes walking from Chrysler Building and Grand Central Station. It´s very easy to walk from the hotel to the major sites of Midtown (Empire State Building - 10 minutes / Times Square - 15 minutes / Central Park - 15 minutes). The hotel itself is simple (not a 4 star), but cosy and clean with a very confortable bed and mattress. The rooms are small (considering the european standard rooms), but very clean with a big flat screen! The staff is friendly and helpfull when asked. I do recommend the hotel for those who are seeking a central base for good resting and strenght recovery for the next day. Very important, FREE WI-FI!!

Reviews.Title: “Subpar...definitely not a 3.5 star”
Reviews.Author: mfost
Reviews.Content: The Tudor hotel is certainly not the hotel for those who like big brand name hotels. Even the holiday inn is better than the Tudor. The Tudor is a decent place to crash if you need a clean bed in a quiet hotel, but the little details that make a hotel stay enjoyable and luxurious are seriously lacking in this hotel. First I'll touch on the positives. Cute lobby, great doormen to greet you, and helpful front desk staff. Our maid was kind, she left us extra towels as requested, although she left us no shampoo for our final day - so we couldn't wash our hair. They offer bath and body works products, which is a nice touch, too. The air conditioning in the room was fantastic, and the tv was big, flat, and functional. The room itself was small and dingy. While the bed area was clean, the bathroom smelled horribly of mold. Our sink wouldn't drain properly and the stench of the moldy bathroom made our room smell awful, too. Everytime I had to go into the bathroom I dreaded it! The phone in our room didn't work, either. I truly felt as though I was in a bathroom that had been surface cleaned but not properly sanitized for decades. Those blacklights they use on CSI would have forsure had a field day! As for the location, I can't comment much on it. We cabbed everywhere because it was pouring, but it's definitely a rather far walk from 5th avenue shopping (probably 20 minutes). We paid $125 per night on priceline, however, I would say that this hotel was only worth 100, not 125, and I wouldn't call it a 3.5 star. Also, for those booking on priceline, this hotel charges a fee of $50 per night if you want 2 double beds, so make sure you're aware of that before bidding. I cannot imagine anyone paying full price for this hotel...I felt a tad ripped off at $125. All in all, if you're looking for a clean and quiet place to rest your head for the night (with no extra ammenities or luxuries), then this hotel will do just fine. If you are scared of germs, hate mold, and in general want more than dingy basics, I wouldn't recommend the tudor. Did it ruin my trip? Not at all. Did it add anything exciting to it? Definitely not.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Nedless
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 days at the end of May 2009. Pleasantly surprised at the high standard of the rooms. The Hotel has recently been refurbished. Good location, 5 mins to Grand Central Terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews was "OFF" on this one! C-”
Reviews.Author: traveljumpingbean
Reviews.Content: I satyed for 5 nights, The room was small, but expected... The staff was unhelpful, short and unfriendly!! Phone didn't work (not a biggy unless U need to call for services etc). Location was not as great as reviews had talked about either! Pillows were small yet FAT - not comfy at all, my neck was stiff every morning. I guess overall... if U get a great deal on priceline "name your own price" go for it, but otherwise it was just a C- for me!

Reviews.Title: “A great respite in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: barbann78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tudor for three nights the weekend after Easter. We had booked this hotel on Priceline for $125/night. Based on reviews I had read here, I was not expecting much. However, we were pleasantly surprised with a nice, clean, spacious room (including an unexpected and unrequested upgrade!). The location of the hotel is excellent - within walking distance of Grand Central, Times Square, and many other notable locations. The hotel was quiet and comfortable which was very appreciated after long days of walking around the busyness of the city. We did have a small issue using the wireless internet service that required a call with their tech support to correct. But after the call, everything worked perfectly for the next few days. We also had one other issue that we brought to the attention of the manager on duty at the time of our checkout. When she dealt with our concern in a way that we were not satisfied with, the Vice President of the property went above and beyond to rectify it. Based on our experience with this gentleman alone, we would return to the Tudor. But even despite him, we would not hesitate to return or recommend others stay at the Tudor.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe for a one night stay over, but that's aboout it”
Reviews.Author: LiLew
Reviews.Content: I had a week long business trip one block from the UN. The Tudor was offering a good rate of $210 per night, so I stayed 5 days. When checking in, the front desk person barely spoke to me other then ask for my credit card. I requested a fridge for my room. That was an extra $20 for the week. I got a cozy room with a queen size bed. Nice, clean bathroom. Second night the toilet would not flush, after taking off the lid discovered tank was empty. I informed the front desk the following morning. He jotted down something, however the toilet was never fixed during my stay. I had to pull a chain inside the tank in order for toilet to flush. How annoying! Walls are thin, I could hear every door slam in the hallway. On my last day, before checking out I reached in the mini fridge for juice and found a dead cockroach in the fridge. Yuck! When I checked out, it was the same stoic staff who I informed about the toilet. I just wanted out, so I did not bother to mention the broken toilet again or the dead roach.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: tennesseine
Reviews.Content: First, the price: USD 300 for a junior suite with terrace and breakfast in NYC mid-week?! So I figured there had to be a catch. Bad location? A block from my client on 42nd, so no. Hard parking? Drop the keys in the hands of a valet who snagged my car quickly. Unfriendly staff? Forget it...nicest people ever. Bad room service? This was my experience with room service: I called down for a sandwich and some wine. The fellow apologized for being out of the pinot noir. I said no worries and ordered another. When the food came up, he said he had realized today was delivery day, so he had gotten the key from security, gone down to the cellar and found they had gotten some fresh bottles of the pinot noir. Who does that?! That is incredible service and hospitality. Stanhope used to be my fave NYC hotel. I have a new one now.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: krisztinastar
Reviews.Content: Great, room was bigger than I expected. No view, but there were two windows. Was quiet, and a very comfortable bed. I was very impressed. I got a great deal through hotwire, however I did not expect to have to pay for internet. This hotel charges 15$ night for internet, which is nuts. I guess when Hotwire says the room comes with internet - that doesnt necessarily mean it's included.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to The Tudor”
Reviews.Author: SaulBH
Reviews.Content: What a delightful surprise to find this gem. Courteous staff, immaculate facility, excellent location and much more. My first impression of a warm and friendly place stayed with me throughout my stay. I highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for touring the city!”
Reviews.Author: Maresha
Reviews.Content: We arrived before the designated check in time and the hotel offered to hold our bags while we went exploring. Our room was immediately upgraded to a room with two beds ( we booked for $123/ night on Priceline). The staff could not have been more helpful at the Tudor. Although there was no outside view in the room, it was comfortable with a working air/heating system. One of the beds was a bit "cock-eyed"- but had no trouble sleeping. The bathroom was large- but had no fan. There are no coffee makers in the rooms. The TV would only stay on a station for 5 minutes. The staff tried unsuccessfully to fix it three times. But we were in NYC and really did not need a TV (on Sat. we toured NBC and saw the actors at SNL rehearsing and we wanted to watch the show). There are subway entrances just up the block and EVERYTHING is easy to get to. Starbucks and CVS are on the corner and a great deli down the side street. We are not in the best shape and we had no problem walking to Times Square, Rockefeller Center or Central Park. Felt very safe at this hotel. It is an old building- but that was part of the charm! If you stay here, walk down the street and climb the stairs to Tudor City and check out their gardens.

Reviews.Title: “will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: adomurph
Reviews.Content: my mum and i just returned from a 4 night trip to the big apple and were very happy with our experience at the tudor hotel. check in was very efficient and our room was modern, clean and although small, more than adequate for our stay. the lifts are excellent and very quick. breakfast is expensive - $16 each - we didn't eat there as a result and found the nations cafe at the corner of 1st and 49th street perfect for our needs and only a short walk away. the area around the hotel is nicely maintained and quiet and while it's 5 blocks of a walk to 5th avenue, we founf we encountered plenty of shops along the way to occupy our daily walk!!!! i would definitely recommend the tudor hotel and will be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, pretty poor service and expensive!”
Reviews.Author: expectthebest10
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I checked into the Tudor hotel as a last minute decision to surprise my parents who were staying there. They were very accommodating to us just arriving and wishing to book a room. The room we had was a 'junior suite' and was fairly large with AC, nice bathroom, big bed and massive TV. The TV however did not work, and neither did the wireless internet the whole time we were there. No fridge in room for water. Lobby looks quite nice and breakfast was good but cost my boyfriend and I $80 - which was on top of our $220 a night rate which we thought bumped up the cost of our stay. The location however is good as you can walk straight down the grand central station and 5th Av etc. However we wanted to book a room for an extra night after our other party checked out and found the hotel very stubborn with their room rate wanting to charge us significantly more for just one more night. We felt this a little unfair, as rates online for that night were cheaper but they wouldn't give them to us, and we left ! We did find some cheaper accommodation but admittedly not quite as good in times square. However for the price you would pay at the tudor there are plenty of other hotels in similar good locations for not much more money with probably better service/facilities i.e. the Hilton on times square etc. Overall 7/10.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, great value, close to attractions.”
Reviews.Author: adamgator
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 3 nights -- we used priceline and got a great rate (under $100 per night) for a Fri, Sat & Sun night in April. Our room was small but was a corner room - even had an East River view - nice. The room was clean - well lit. There was a safe in the room (set your own combo, no fee). Unfortunately, the internet was not free (Something like $14 per night) -- too bad. Also, the business center had a $5 min (even to just print boarding passes) - it is open 24 hrs. The bed was only a queen and the linens were okay - nothing bad, nothing special. The AC was not wonderful - mind you it was 90-degrees outside in April so perhaps it was not prepared for the heat. Bathroom had a nice shower and toiletries. The hairdryer left room for improvement -- it was mounted to the bathroom wall and did not work too well -- plus it kept overheating. Still, the room was quiet and very private with views so not much to complain about - especially given the excellent price. The hotel is right on 42nd street - it's a few blocks west to a subway station - but that station is Grand Central, giving you access to pretty much everywhere. Plus, there are two bus lines right outside that take you to the station (they come about every 5 minutes - we never had to wait more than that -- even on Sunday & late nights. One Bus actually takes you all the way to Time Square (actually, it's only like a mile) but then goes North on Broadway all the way up the West Side -- getting around is very easy. The UN is a 5 minute walk as are several consulate offices. The Tudor Village area is very quiet, scenic and residential -- tucked away from some of the busy streets. There are some nice little parks with river views just upstairs outside the hotel. Despite the few minor limitations, this hotel was perfect -- can't beat the quality and price. Felt very safe and staff were always at the door. Would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location at a great rate. What else do you need?”
Reviews.Author: snootchiebootchies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for six nights in late April. We were concerned after booking this hotel on Priceline and then seeing the reviews on this site. But those worries were completely unfounded! Really, this hotel is GREAT. Our hotel room was quiet, comfortable and much bigger than we had expected. I think they may have upgraded us but I'm not absolutely sure. We also found our room to be very clean although we did encounter a cockroach in the bathroom on our very last night. But we were extremely happy with our hotel room, especially considering the price we paid. My only minor quibble is the high price of their wifi connection ($15 per night) and use of their computers in the business center (works out to be $5 for 15 minutes). However, a nice and pretty staff member did give me 30 minutes of complimentary computer usage when one of their computers froze on me. To maximize your enjoyment of this hotel, I would highly recommend familiarizing yourself with the bus system! The stop for the 42 and 104 is kitty-corner from the hotel. Both buses will take you to Grand Central Station and Time Square. The 42 will also take you the Circle Line Ferry, Port Authority Bus Terminal and the Javitz Convention Center. And both the 42 and 104 will literally drop you RIGHT IN FRONT of the hotel on the way back. I know Grand Central is a short walk but if you have an Unlimited Ride MetroCard, jumping on the bus (which comes frequently) will help save the feet. The northbound 27 and 50 buses can be taken across the street from the hotel to the north on 2nd Ave. and either bus will take you to Rockfeller Center, and some great shopping such as Saks 5th Ave. The invaluable southbound 15 bus can be taken on 2nd Ave. as well and this bus will take you down to the East Village, Lower East Side and down to Battery Park. This bus is great as there is limited subway coverage in the East Village and Lower East Side. On the way back, the 27, 50 and 15 will drop you right in front of the UN. Take the stairs on the west side of 1st Ave and take the short walk back to the hotel through the quiet and historic neighbourhood of Tudor City. As for the hotel location, it is located at the eastern end of 42nd Street. 42nd street is generally a bustling street but it is quiet east of 3rd Ave. There is a grocery store just a block south of the hotel. Lots of dining choices toward the west along 42nd St. and in the north and south directions along 2nd Ave. I recommend trying the Good Burger located a block north from the hotel on 2nd Ave, or the Oyster Bar Restaurant at Grand Central. As for shopping, there is a nice variety of shopping options along Lexington Ave and a block to the west of Grand Central.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay - great rate.”
Reviews.Author: gigide
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4/16 because won rate for $85 / night. Room was small but adequate and decorated comfortably. 9 year daughter thought ghost was in room because light in closet would turn on and off when it wanted. Liked how there are controls at the nightstand that controls all the lights to bathroom and all lamps in room. Hair dryer vent was rusty and fell out when I was drying my hair. Front desk staff was indifferent... not friendly, not rude. Bellman took our luggage from Taxi to front desk but did not offer to take to room. Location was okay. Grand Central Terminal within 10 minute walk and can catch subway. We walked to Macy's from the hotel which isn't bad on a nice day and with comfortable shoes. Nice place to stay if you just need a place to rest your head. Shouldn't be spending too much time in room anyway, right.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice hotel, only issue was the location”
Reviews.Author: l0is1ane
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through hotwire so I wasn't expecting too much, especially based upon the reviews here, but I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived about an hour early but were allowed to check in. Although I had only booked a room with one double bed they gave us one with with 2 queens as we were mother and daughter. The room was spacious with a flat screen tv and a perfectly fine bathroom. The only real negative was the location. I am used to staying more centrally in NY. From this hotel to Time Square is a good 15 minute walk, if not more. There is a bus you can take from outside the hotel (warning: the buses do not accept notes), but I prefer to walk around the city so it was a little far out for me. The only other things to say really are that the coridoors had a very odd smell to them, the coffee machine was in the bathroom, which is rather strange and the television kept re-setting itself to the welcome screen in the middle of programmes. I asked at the front desk for someone to look at it while I was out, but nothing was ever done. Also the concierge we saw on the first day was useless - I asked for details of a tour and he said he had none but if I wanted he could book it, when I said I needed more information, he just shrugged! The concierge who was there on the day I left was far more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: smurf9
Reviews.Content: This 4 day break was a suprise holiday for my partners 40th birthday. We travelled as a family of three. Myself, my partner and my 12 year daughter. Can't actually think of anything good to say about this hotel other than olcation.On arrival late at night we were told the room we were allocated consited of only 1 large bed for all 3 of us to sleep in. Our booking invoice advised of a triple guest room. However the hotel reception advised that this is what was meant by a triple guest room. Not prepared to stay in this we were offered a second room with 2 beds that was dirty with a rusty air conditioning vent over one of the beds. After 2 more room changes that were also totally unsuitable, we were offered a referbished room but with only 1 bed. We had to stay in this as we were told there was no alternative. Next day we were offered a upgrade but which we had to pay extra for. This was not made available to us till 5.30 in the evening and even then they were still wiring the t.v. together! Other issues that arose include room service where the cheese platter we ordered contained mould all down one side on a piece of chedder cheese and tuna that tasted sour. Reception staff were very unhelpful everything that was requested i.e. extra cup for the room never arrived and when we asked for extra pillows we were that they had none but we could fold up sheets to act as pillows. My daughter and I came back with bites from the room on our legs. This hotel should be named faulty towers and is not a 4 star hotel. TJ Manchester

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: twenda
Reviews.Content: As we read in other reviews, we got our booking at the Tudor via priceline. Due to what we had read, we called the hotel to see what sort of room it would be. It would have been one double bed and unrenovated. We upgraded for $30 (so it was $125 total) to a renovated room with 2 double beds. This isn't bad for a decent location in Manhatten. It was a very nice room with a view of the East River and we had absolutely no complaints about the room/bath. It is annoying to pay $15.95 for the internet and the breakfast is expensive ($20 for full buffet and $16 for cold). However, on the next block (between 2nd and 3rd) we found Teresa's - very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location some older rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gord_Mtl
Reviews.Content: We got our room on Priceline for a great rate. I didn't have high expectations considering how much I paid for the room but from the pictures on the website it didn't look too bad. Our flight got in late and we finally got to the hotel around midnight. When we checked into the hotel they only had the older unrenovated smoking rooms available. When we got off the elevator the whole floor just smelled of smoke. For non-smokers like myself that can be quite disturbing. Luckily, the room wasn't too smoky. The room was a typical small NY hotel room. It was clean but did feel a bit dated. The beds were comfortable enough and the hotel was surprisingly quiet. The hotel is located just a few blocks from Grand Central Station. The location was quite good in that you were close to everything but just far away enough to avoid all the noise of the area.

Reviews.Title: “NIce room, good location, good price!”
Reviews.Author: Mark2Tex
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire 3 months in advance at what I thought was a good price ($159/night) for what was described as a 3.5 star hotel in mid east side . We make regular trips to visit our son so we know finding a nice room in Manhattan under $200 is a bargain. You have to remember your ARE in NYC Manhattan where nothing is inexpensive. After blind booking this hotel, I did have some worries when I read very mixed reviews on this hotel at several websites. I am not sure why all the complaints because the lobby, bar ,dining area and room were very nice and the staff seemed very professional. Our room in the North Tower (#1010) was updated with a modern bath, flat screen TV and very comfortable bed and pillows and looked out on 42nd St.. The desk clerk said all the rooms had now been updated. Granted it was a small room, maybe 2 ft on one side of bed and 4 ft on the other and 5 ft at the bottom but that is fairly normal for mid price Manhattan hotels. One nice thing, there were only 6 rooms on the floor so very quiet. Hotel was conveniently located for our main purpose of visiting our son on East 75 St. It is a 3.5 block walk to Grand Central and 8 blocks to Times Square--not bad. A drug store, food market and grocery store all within 2 blocks. We ate breakfasts for 2 at Dave's (as recommended) up at 44th ($24 with tip), or McD's($8) down at 37th or Pax's ($12) on 42nd between 3rd and Lex. Did not use any of the Tudor dining facilities, so no comment. Had minimal need for staff but they all were friendly and solicitous when we did. Would defintely consider this hotel again. But it is more a 3 star than 3.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good area with easy access to all of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Chicagohoosier07
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a few blocks from the subway and trains at Grand Central and within walking distance of Times Square and other attractions. We liked the elegant feel of the hotel, the rooms and hotel were well-kept. The only problems we had were the size of the room (pretty tight with 2 double beds), regulation of the temperature in the room and the bathroom steaming up after showers. Otherwise, good amenities including a small fitness center, sauna, etc. Could use free Wifi and a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location, Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: YYZAC
Reviews.Content: Purchased this hotel through Hotwire for $125/night for 4 days over Easter. Originally rated as a 3.5 star hotel, Hotwire informed me that it had downgraded this hotel to a 3 star hotel based on feedback from members. With this in mind, as well as, reviewing the past guests' comments, I had fairly reasonable expectations. Prior to staying, I contacted the hotel directly to request a non-smoking, two bedded, newly rennovated room (as past reviewers have suggested). Katarzyna, quickly responded and indicated that she would place a note in my folio with my requests, which I realized was all that could be done. I actually emailed Katarzyna several times and she was quick to respond each time and most helpful. Upon check in we were given a beautiful room in the north tower with two beds, non-smoking, and newly rennovated. Considering this was Easter and that the hotel was fully booked, I was quite pleased with the upgrade. Although our room on the third floor has no view, it was quiet, clean and comfortable. The beds were great and the bathroom quite spacious. Yes, the hotel is historic and there are the odd annoyances that one gets from a historic property, but all in all the charm of this hotel is not lost with the rennovations. About the rennovations...at times I had to remind myself that the room had undergone a rennovation. The carpet was clearly new, the window treatments, light fixtures and bedding were all obviously new and upgraded. The walls were painted and the room had a flatscreen T.V. However, there were elements of the rennovation that just did not make sense. For example, the decision to keep the original wooden headboards and wooden furniture, which are clearly out of place with the T.V. stand (modern). Also, for a newly rennovated room, one would not expect the door handles in the bathroom to be coming off, the light switch in the bathroom to be broken, and the complete absence of a toilet paper roll holder in the bathroom. Also, the very automated lighting control panel in the room had incorrect labels on what lights each button controls. In one case someone had written on the wall plate, in pen, the switch for the bathroom. Clearly I do not understand why the rennovation would not be complete instead of piecemeal. However, that said, I really cannot fault the hotel on any other aspects. There are complimentary papers on the bell desk in the morning (Wall Street Journal & The New York Times). There is a Starbucks at the corner of 42nd and 2nd Avenue (turn left when exiting out the front door and walk about 100 steps, it is open at 6:30 on weekdays and at 7:00 on weekends). The bus stop is located at 42nd street and 2nd Avenue (turn left when exiting the front door, cross 2nd Avenue, and the cross 42nd Street to the bus stop) The number 42 bus goes all the way across 42nd street to the Hudson River, passing Times Square on the way. The number 104 bus also goes to Times Square and then up 8th Avenue. The "Grand Central 42nd Street" subway stop is about 2 blocks to the west (again, turn left coming out the front door, walk for about 5-8 minutes and the entry is on the left) A Metrocard for $7.50/person/day is a great option if staying under 4 days. If over 4 days, the $25/person Metrocard is good for 7 days of unlimited travel, which is a great convenience since it allows seemless transfers from bus to subway and subway to bus. (read: "no hassles") The number 15 bus that runs south on 2nd Avenue goes to South Street Seaport and eventually ends up near Battery Park and the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Really enjoyed the Tenement Museum this time in NYC. It is located in the Lower East Side at Allen & Delancy. (Delancy subway stop on the "F" line). I also tried the NYC Transit Museum in Brooklyn Heights and found this to be quite interesting as well. The best and cheapest way from JFK to Manhatten is the AirTrain from JFK to Jamaica station ($5/person) Then take the "E" train, which is express, to Manhatten. We timed it at 45 minutes to 1 hour depending on subway traffic. If going to the Tudor Hotel, you will need to switch to the number 6 train (green line) at Lexington Avenue and take the number 6 train one stop to Grand Central 42 Street. The hotel is only a 10 minute, easy, walk to the east. The hotel is in a quiet area of the city, but the action is only a 10 minute (or less) bus ride to the west. I enjoyed coming back to this area of town at night to sleep, which was quite easy in the very comfortable bed. I had no issues with the air conditioning or heating, of which we used both during our stay over Easter. Overall, I was quite pleased with the hotel, it's staff, and the value that I received for the price paid. I would have no reservations about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our first NYC disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Roger00
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting New York (and other US and Canadian cities) for almost 25 years - usually two or three times a year. Our Easter 4-night stay at the Tudor was our first disappointment. The room they gave us was an adequate single, certainly not a room for two people. Clue: there was just one chair. That chair blocked access to the bed. The small queen bed had a poor quality mattress which meant that our sleep was disturbed. The room was too small for a roller bed. My wife slept on the floor. So much for our wedding anniversary! Our several requests for a room change were met with 'We're full'. Also, the staff unforgiveably referred to our travel agent (Hotwire) in poor terms, saying that their only obligation with Hotwire bookings was to supply a room with a bed. I discovered how much they had been paid for our reservation and am confident that it was much higher than the rates paid for a group at the same time. After two nights of discomfort, my comments may have worked and they agreed to put us in what they called a junior suite. This was far better than our original room. If we had been there for the whole time, our report would have been more complimentary. They advertise a fitness centre. This was closed for rfurbishment. They advertise high speed wifi. The outrageous charge is $14.95 + tax. Internet use in the business centre is $20 per hour if I understood correctly. We declined both. American buffet breakfast is $22 per person. We found a diner round the corner where we were well satisfied for $22 for the two of us. We booked the Tudor as a 4-star hotel. After selling us the room, Hotwire told us they had re-rated the hotel as 3* and offered us $25 a night ($100) off a future booking. If we had wanted a 3* hotel, we would have booked a 3* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back again”
Reviews.Author: jringor
Reviews.Content: Room is old. With the price I paid, should have stayed somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Hot Hot - and not in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: fskirts
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was AWFUL. The room was 80 degrees and even though I told them 5 times and had at least 2 engineers look at it, it was never fixed during my stay. The window pane had a HUGE crack in it that I was so paranoid about it due to the fact that I had to keep the window open the whole time to try and cool the room down. I was in town for an interview and getting ready for an interview is NOT pleasant when you're sweating after getting out of the shower. The room had no tissues and only one bar of soap (only the small bar to keep by the sink - there was nothing for the shower which I discovered while already in the shower). As an added bonus, when I went to call to find out when the check out time was, the phone didn't work either. They offered no apology, explanation, or compensation. I only paid $95/night through Priceline, but it still wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, But Forgettable”
Reviews.Author: jackosan
Reviews.Content: This is an updating hotel that is part of the 1920s "Tudor City" development next to the UN. It remains under construction (no noise when I was there) and the common areas are still pretty run down. The rooms themselves, however, are recently updated (at least the ones that I saw). At first, I was put in a tiny room with barely enough space to turn around. When I went back to ask where the rest of my room was, they upgraded me to a "deluxe room." This is the room I will review here. The room was on the 16th floor. It was irregularly shaped and had a column in the middle. The good news is that it had an extremely comfortable bed, a terrace (with no view) and a plasma-screen TV. It had recently been redone with new carpeting and bathroom fixtures. The linens and toiletries were adequate. It is clean enough and has decent water pressure at consistent temperatures. If all you want is a nice room, this place is pretty well-positioned to compete with a Courtyard by Marriott, albeit in an old, architecturally-significant building. You will not be disappointed if you think you are buying 2.5 star room. You won't scream if it's booked as a 3-star hotel. But if this place is sold to you as a 3.5 star upscale hotel, you wil be sorely disappointed. I blind-booked the hotel, and doubt very much that I would knowingly book the same place. There are many other, more worthy, better-located hotels in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MNHNFNF
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Tudor last week (w/b 23 March) and have no complaints whatsoever. the hotel is perfectly situated for exploration on foot - Chrysler Building, Grand Central and Times Square all within a short walk. Room was great. Only complaint is the very expensive breakfast so eat out!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Great deal”
Reviews.Author: NurseStan
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on this hotel through Priceline and I believe I got more than I paid for. The rooms are average size for a NY hotel, I think their pictures on the website are pretty close to how they look. The location is perfect if you want easy access to the subway/buses to get to other parts of the city and there are plenty of garages around the hotel if needed. You can also park on the street on Sundays - no charge! - just read the signs so you don't park in a diplomat spot. Tudor city is a quiet and quaint part of the city where there are unique building and attractive gardens to view. The neighborhood is so quiet we were able to sleep with the window open! which brings me to my only complaint (of course there's always something) The heating/cooling system in our room wasn't working, we got to the room at 6pm and it was terribly hot for us, 75F degrees! so we turned down the thermostat and left the room for the evening hoping it would be cool when we returned. Unfortunately we didn't get back until 2:30 a.m. and the room was still 75 degrees. Wanting to sleep and not deal with maintenance or moving rooms we just opened the windows which provided some relief. I mentioned this issue at checkout and their reply was that I should have called. I explained to them why I didn't and they shrugged thier shoulders. It was kind of a bad note to leave on but overall I think the hotel is great if you can get a deal and I would definitely stay here if I can get a good price again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable room in a good location with courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: Dubliner
Reviews.Content: The Tudor hotel is a stones throw from the UN so was ideal for my business trip. Grand Central is a short walk away (5 mins) and Times Square is just a bit further down (10 mins) Staff are very polite and efficient. I arrived at 1pm (earlier than check in time of 3pm) and room wasn't ready, however the receptionist completed the registration and had my bags stored for me. When I came back later they upgraded me and apologized for not having a room ready when I arrived. The room I had was a King on the 7th floor. There was nothing interesting about the view but the tv, bed and bathroom were spot on. Check out was very smooth and the bellhop had a taxi and my bags in the trunk in a flash. I didn't eat at the tudor as there is some good diners and restaurants nearby (for breakfast try Johns Cafe on the corner of 44th and 2nd) For a great lunch at excellent prices, the nearby Palm restaurant does a business lunch (3 course) for $21 and I would highly recommend it. Overall a very pleasant experience, especially considering the special rate of $290 for 2 nights through hotels.com

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, surprisingly large rooms for New York”
Reviews.Author: alabama231
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hotel, staff were very helpful, helped with bags, always said hello, helped us get a taxi and the hotel itself is only 5-10minutes from Grand Central Station!! Didnt use any of the food facilities, but there is an excellent cafe / restaurent opposite central station, think it was called Central Bar. The rooms were amazing!! Two large beds, tons of space around the bed, excellent TV and good range of channels, bathroom was large, clean and the complimentary shampoo etc,, were refreshed daily. large cupboards for storage, and beds were made everyday when we returned to our rooms. Only problem me and my sister encountered is we could not figure out how to use the coffee / tea pot, and had to go to a Starbucks nearby to get our fix of a cup of tea!!

Reviews.Title: “some of the stupidest low rent mistakes i've seen in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: traveler35223
Reviews.Content: super shabby around the edges. lamp in room had no lightbulb, and desk girl wanted to give my husband attitude about him asking for one. mattress had no mattress pad until i asked for one - just a thin flat sheet barely tucked in, that pulled out when we sat on the bed. ridiculous. wall-unit hairdryer in bathroom required a socket to plug into - but was installed on a wall with no electrical outlet. where i'm from we call this the redneck handyman special. toilet tank had the wrong size ball on the lever, so the toilet wouldn't flush unless we lifted up one edge of the tank. we don't have a name for this where i'm from. all furnishings looked like they were purchased third-hand from a third-rate hotel going out of business. and who still charges for wireless access, especially in a city where you're likely to be within ten feet of an open signal on any given corner? just plain tacky. ... oh and this was in the "just renovated" wing of the joint. definitely pass on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for price and 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenn_TO
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the quiet side of 42nd street, 5 mins walk to the subway station or take the M42 bus. Booked through Hotwire and got an amazing deal close to the Xmas season. Expect hotel and rooms to be small - that's Manhattan living if one's under budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: pnear
Reviews.Content: I should start the review by admitting that I haven't yet been to New York city and stayed in a hotel that I felt provided decent value. The name brands are always so expensive, and the off-name brands always disappoint. So from that perspective, the Tudor is no different I guess. The room was tiny, and incredibly hot. I'm pretty sure my window was right beside the kitchen exhaust for a local restaurant, because my room smelled like old steak all night, and greasy breakfast in the morning. This hotel is a relic, and not one that I'm likely to stay in again. That said, I felt generally safe and the hotel was clean, so I'm giving it two stars instead of one. Gotta save one star for the truly awful places!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Price Line”
Reviews.Author: disney07us
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through Priceline and was given the Tudor Hotel. There was mixed reviews on Trip Advisor so I didn't know what to expect when I arrived at the hotel. The lobby was very nice. When I checked I did request a renovated room. I was assigned a room on the 10th floor facing the East River. The room was redone and was very clean. I have no complaints except that the breakfast buffet is way over priced $20 +. Ate somewhere else but otherwise I would stay at this hotel again. Thanks Priceline!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Tudor Hotel Great HQ”
Reviews.Author: Cedarhill4060
Reviews.Content: We visited New York over Christmas 2008 for a week and the Tudor Hotel was an excellent headquarters. Located at the quiet eastern end of 42nd Street near the UN, it was a relief to come "home" and get away from the NYC crowds. It is a charming old brick building on the outside and up to date on the inside. A minor beef: We wanted to stay in a classic vintage NYC hotel, but the interiors, bathrooms, etc. had all the historic finishes and features removed during a big renovation. Our room looked out to the Tudor Apartments that give Tudor City its name; the penthouse was in the Spiderman movies - very cool. Our small suite was well priced, clean, warm, quiet and comfortable. Hotel staff and service were excellent. Only ate one meal (breakfast) in the restaurant; give it a miss and go the Pret a Manger cafe down the block. This hotel is close to Grand Central and so perfect to head out uptown or downtown or cross town.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: cocoart
Reviews.Content: The lobby and downstairs of the hotel give the impression that it is a decent place to stay, but it is definitely not. We booked two nonsmoking rooms and ended up with one nonsmoking room, and the smoking floor was absolutely horrible. We could barely breath and ended up opening the windows even though it was around 30 degrees outside. Also, when we walked into our room, the TV and lights were on and a chair was situated in front of the TV as if someone were just watching it. In the other room, one of the mugs still had coffee in it, yet was covered with a white sleeve. The bed was like a board and nothing felt clean. The only plus was that they have nice body products (Bath & Body Works) and the shower had good water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy older hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: boston_tripadviser
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Tudor after having been assigned this hotel by Priceline for $150, which is a great bargain right before Christmas. I was a bit concerned after reading the reviews on this site, but I had a great experience. The hotel is a few blocks from Grand Central Station--very easy walking distance (5 minutes), yet far enough away to be quiet. The hotel itself is a historical landmark and looks and feels like it--it certainly is not a large business hotel with huge lobby and a lot of restaurants. This is definitely more like a charming NYC apartment building. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a suite free of charge, which was a much appreciated gesture. Apparently, the standard room you get through Priceline is extremely small. The suite, though not very large either, had a living room, bedroom and a very nice bathroom with a jetted tub and dual sink. Overall, the room felt a little dated with clunky standard TVs and slightly worn furniture when compared to business hotels, but cozy and almost like someone's apartment. The bed was extremely comfortable. On their website they mention remodeled rooms, which this was apparently not. But again, it was charming and cute. The room was on the 12th floor, and the view wasn't much, though you could see the UN building over the tops of some other buildings (windows actually open, which is a nice feature). This suite did not have a balcony. Service was very pleasant and professional, and the hotel was clean and inviting. There was no room service available, and no mini bar in the room. This is not a four or five star business hotel, but a charming, cozy place ideal for sightseeing or a romantic getaway. Given the fantastic location, great price, and very friendly front-desk staff, I would recommend this hotel--but be aware that the standard rooms seem to be extremely small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: MountainMelody
Reviews.Content: As far as nyc prices go, we got a good deal on the Tudor from priceline. The staff was very friendly. The room was very small but clean, cozy and nicely decorated. The bathroom was nice, except for the drain, the tolietries were awesome! Lemon verbena! It did really suck that the $15 wireless internet service was not working on my floor but I was able to get online in the lobby. We asked for a late check out and I was so impressed that they graciously gave us til 2:00! (maybe to make up for internet not working). All in all, it was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “It's ... Ok.”
Reviews.Author: cbee201
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Priceline and paid about $200 (including tax) so for that price it wasn't bad. The room was small and very clean, but old and worn down for the most part. The carpet was stained and buckling, but looked like it had been recently cleaned. Same with the bathroom - the faucet handle and toilet flusher were wobbly but worked. The water pressure was good and it had a new spotless shower curtain. The toiletries from Bath & Bodyworks were also nice. The bed was comfortable, but the rest of the furniture looked ancient and heavily used. For one night, it was fine, but it needs renovation to really be a 4 star hotel.
