Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor room and bed”
Reviews.Author: kikigreenleaf
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via priceline. It was offered as a 3.5 star. The location is fantastic - a short walk to Grand Central and a comfortable walk to Time Sq, Bryant Park, Central Park, Rockafeller Center. Service was helpful. The room was poor to average. Small room. Ok view. Very dirty windows. Mold in shower. Large crack in marble counter in bathroom that was patched up poorly. Bed was not supportive at all and very saggy - there was about 6" difference between sides and middle - back breaking. It was tolerable because the location was so great. Had I known the room would be like this, I would have bid lower $ on priceline. It was not worthy of a 3.5 star rating - maybe 2.5 or 3. I think the hotel has great rooms for regular paying guests, and has a block of older/dingy rooms for priceline guests. I would definitely recommend this hotel if guaranteed a newer room. If booking thru priceline, you are taking a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and well situated”
Reviews.Author: Moos3h
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel very comfortable - a good sized room with TV, decent bathroom and comfortable bed. We arrived late at night after a flight and were greeted by friendly and attentive staff. We ordered room service which was tasty and brought to us with remarkable speed. This is a huge place, but it felt friendly yet professional. Staff were good, security seemed good and the location is superb for discovering midtown. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “OK for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Pete7919
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK for a short last-minute stay in NYC. We had a standard queen room and it was very small. We kept joking that it reminded us of a stateroom on a cruise. If you are staying awhile and have a lot of stuff the room would be cramped pretty quickly, although there was a closet in the room. We were on the 11th floor and had nothing to see out the window but a brick wall and no sunlight. Lots of noises from the hallway came into the room in the morning as people started to get out. The bathroom was very small as well, with a column or wall bump out right in front of the toilet, making it an awkward experience. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We didn't use any of the services although the mini-bar looked to be empty. It was locked and we weren't offered a key but I didn't inquire. The location was good. It's a short walk to Grand Central Station to hop on the subway, and there is a good breakfast place in-between the hotel and Grand Central. Overall I would stay again considering the price I got on Priceline, but I would stay at another hotel for a better price. All hotels in NYC are overpriced but that's life in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay..”
Reviews.Author: Niamhy101
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in the Tudor Hotel at the start of September, room was small enough, but very clean, as was the bathroom. Its a great location, we walked up from Grand Central when we arrived in NYC, and its only about a 5 minute walk. Also there is a bus stop right outside the hotel which is very handy. The staff were very helpfull and couldnt have been nicer, giving advise on where to go and what to do. And also directions to the Irish bars in the area! (And to what ones not to go too). I would stay here again no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravelista
Reviews.Content: Overall wasn't really satisfied with the Tudor. We did get a great rate through Hotwire and the hotel is in a very central location, also the lobby is pretty nice. However, the room really disappointed me. It was small, dark, and depressing. The bed was lumpy, and the bathroom was really tiny. It just didn't seem clean and it had an old, dated feeling. The towels are really thin and the sheets were really worn. our iron was also broken. I really wouldn't recommend to anyone, even if you get a good price. It's probably worth it to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room in nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Sleepyhead75
Reviews.Content: When we checked in at the Tudor, we mentioned that we were celebrating our 12.5 anniversary, and inquired whether it would be possible to get a romantic room. The receptionist said that the hotel was quite full, but she would discuss with the manager whether she could change the room. The room we got upon arrival (standard room) was nice for NYC standards, although the bed was too small: my boyfriend had to ly down diagonally. Next morning we received a call that we would be upgraded to a junior suite. So we went into town and returned to get the key for the other room. It was quite spectacular I must say (we honestly had not expected to be upgraded, rather to be moved for instance to a room with a view). It was a room with a queen bed (extremely comfortable), very spaceous with a separate corner with couch and chairs and table, and a nice bathroom. It was very comfy, not only because of the space and the furniture, but also because of little things like being able to iron your clothes and having water and sweets on the table (I particularly liked the latter!). The cleaners really did a good job and made sure there was no lack of anything. Spending a few days in this hotel, in this room, really made our anniversary a memorable one. The only downside really was the fact that we had booked the hotel through another website, but when we came home it turned out Tudor had booked some 800 dollars off my creditcard (I'm guessing this was miscommunication on the upgrade). Fortunately it took just one email to get the money back. All in all, if you can get a room in the Tudor at a reasonable price, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Tudor”
Reviews.Author: JaneKirby
Reviews.Content: It was worth investing in a suite at the Tudor, which we did. It was one of the newly refurbished rooms, which although expensive, had everything we needed. The bed was large and comfy, there was a CD player in the room, and the marble bathroom had a jacuzzi bath and nice sink area. Our separate lounge area had a sofa, a dresser, coffee table and lamps. There was a safe in the room, hairdryer and complimentary water. The lobby area of the hotel is a little dated but it's not horrible, like some reviews suggest. The location is two blocks from Grand Central station, so central enough but away from the buzz of Times Square. It's possible to walk to the Empire State Building in about 20 minutes or so. I would recommend this hotel if you can get a good deal and secure one of the newly-refurbished rooms.

Reviews.Title: “There's the good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: WendyWal
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a popular weekend, so prices were high, $300 before taxes. The good is: the room is quiet, as is the the a/c. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom and tolietries were nice. The bad is: the room was a little dusty (especially with the sun shining in) and the hotel had a tired feeling. There was a mini bar, but it was empty and used as a tv stand. We booked a junior suite, which it was not. It was one square room that also had a couch. If we had paid a bargain price, it would have been fine. I do love the location, 2 blocks from Grand Central, but in a quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Tudor at the UN is very charming”
Reviews.Author: tourgirl61
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to NYC. I was there 3 nights and because budget was an issue, I stayed at 3 different hotels, which I bid for on Priceline. The first was the Tudor at the UN. $215. THE UPSIDE: It is a charming, old-world hotel. Each of the three rooms in our party was unique. MY room had two twin beds, which I have only seen in Europe. As I was traveling with my adult son, this was perfect for us. The room was clean and comfortable which was what I needed. If you were to spend a lot of time in the room, it would only accommodate one person, but my companions each had three people in their rooms, their rooms were quite a bit larger and they were quite comfortable. The staff was very helpful and friendly and helped each in our party to get the type of room best suited to them. For one of the rooms this involved a substantial upgrade at no additional cost. The concierge, bell staff, front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, going so far as to give us tips on our destinations for the day. The maintenance staff who I saw here and there (there were no problems that I needed them for) all greeted us with a smile and a "good morning". THE DOWNSIDE: Although the hotel is lovely and in a lovely neighborhood, it is close to the East River and going out can require a cab or a trip on a crosstown bus to Grand Central to get the subway. We walked for the most part, but that may not be for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Conflicted on what to write”
Reviews.Author: susanbratwurst
Reviews.Content: I am somewhat conflicted as far as this hotel goes and whether or not I would recommend someone to stay there or not. We arrived on 9/4 and the two people who checked us in were very pleasant and gave us a room. We dropped off our luggage and went exploring, when we came back around 1:00am we inquired about getting a different room as our room had mold in the tub and in general was very damp. She said it would depend on our reservation, looked it up and said "oh yeah, no we don't have any other rooms available" I had booked on hotwire so I know exactly what she was saying without saying it. Had she said "due to your discounted rate we are unable to move you to a better room" I could have maybe accepted that. But I knew she was blatantly lying to me because I had just checked on the internet and for the length of our stay they still had Superior and Junior Suites available. She just wasn't willing to upgrade us. It was being lied to that has left a sour taste in my mouth with this hotel and the woman working the front desk was extremely rude. So I guess if you book on a discount site for this hotel, that entitles you to a room with mold in the bathroom and damp bedding. With that being said the beds were extremely comfortable (despite being damp feeling) and the room was an OK size for a NY hotel room. We were on the 9th floor of the North tower...no view of any kind except a brick wall, but thats pretty typical in NY. I am also conflicted with whether or not the location of the hotel is convenient or not. I liked the fact that our nearest subway station was Grand Central since most of the subway lines go through there so no matter where we were in the city it was easy to get back to our hotel area. However, every other hotel I have stayed at in NY was a 3 or 4 minute walk from the nearest subway station. While The Tudor is only 2 1/2 blocks from Grand Central it is 2 1/2 NY LONG blocks. Which took about 10 minutes walking at a pretty decent clip. Then because Grand Central is so huge it took about another 5 minutes to get to the correct subway line. So round trip from our hotel we always had to factor an extra half hour into our travel time. There were some very convenient aspects of this location, an Irish bar right across the street (but sadly played country music which I don't care for) a couple of Starbucks within a few blocks, a great diner a couple blocks away (I think its called the Comfort Diner, the hotel Conierge recommended it). The bath amenities in the room were plentiful and were Bath and Body Works, not some cheap off brand. The towels were fluffy (although damp, never dry). When I got home and unpacked my suitcase, all the clothes I had with me smelled musty and damp, so with that as a consideration and the fact that I abhor being lied to I would probably say I will not be staying at the Tudor the next time I am in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: elkerette
Reviews.Content: The Tudor was recommended to me by a friend who had stayed there before for business. From check-in right through my check-out 3 days later, I had a great experience. First, the ladies at reception were exceptionally professional and polite. I had checked with the hotel before my departure about receiving an early-check in (at 9am instead of the customary 3pm) and they were able to acccomodate me with only a brief 5 minute wait while my superior queen room was checked over by housekeeping management. The room, while small by normal North American standards, was a fine size for New York. Everything was very clean and the bedlinens were very soft and comfortable. I ate breakfast at the hotel's restaurant once during my stay. It was overpriced and had the worst eggs ever made in history. Avoid the restaurant if you can. The business centre, while easy to use, charged a very high price for internet access (something crazy like 30 cents a minute!). That said, I would definitely stay at the Tudor again. The neighbourhood is great and I was able to walk easily to the theatre district, Grand Central and the UN.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay for a night in NYC”
Reviews.Author: pinayloca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel one night and didn't have any issues. Upon checking in I was given a free upgrade from a double room to a suite. The hotel staff from check in and leaving were excellent. The room itself was very clean and large given that most hotel rooms in New York were very small. In fact, we had friends staying at the Helmsey Hotel just a block away and they commented how nice our hotel room was and that their room was small and their a/c system didn't work too well. In all, we were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: slm84
Reviews.Content: I was at the Tudor hotel for 3 nights and was really surprised at how lovely it was! Like many other reviews, I quickly came to the conclusion that NYC hotels are very expensive so wasn't really expecting much, particularly as some reviews said the rooms at the Tudor were not very big. However, we clearly got a lucky draw as our room was lovely and really spacious(We had a twin room)! We checked in easy, were never bothered and location wise it is great! A 15 minute walk to Grand Central station and right round the corner from the hotel is a grocery store, subway and Dunkin Donuts shops! What more do you need?!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Average”
Reviews.Author: griga262
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little tired, as some other reviewers have noted. Nothing looks brand-new, as it does on their web site images. However, it was not bad at all. Our room (#1118) was fairly clean and fairly large by New York standards - it had a comfortable Queen bed, a desk with a chair, plus two small armchairs and a round table in the corner. And, most importantly for us, it was unbelievably quiet. We heard nothing, day or night, other than room doors on our floor closing (our door, for example, took a little bit of force to close properly). Overall, I would recommend this hotel to most travelers (unless you are one of those people who won't settle for anything less than the Plaza), especially if you can get a good deal on it. We saw a lot of Europeans at the Tudor, most notably Spaniards and Scandinavians.

Reviews.Title: “Tudor - Perfect”
Reviews.Author: carbonsa
Reviews.Content: We booked the Tudor Hotel New York after reading mixed reviews. We returned to London this morning and all 5 people in my party enjoyed our stay there. The queen superior room was clean, not huge in size but adequate for a city hotel. Check in was ok, there was 4 reception staff on hand, and we checked in at 3pm. One of our rooms wasnt ready but they soon changed that within an hour, which wasnt too much bother, as we had a drink the bar. I had notified the hotel on our approximate time prior to arriving. The concierge/bell boy (Moroccan guy Carlos i think) were v.friendly and answered any questions...recommending restaurants, hailing cabs and touristy attractions. The rooms were cleaned daily, bathrooms had adequate towels and in terms of location...it was perfrect, 42nd Street. Its a 5min walk downhill to Grand Central Station and it took us 15mins to get to Battery Park, to catch the ferry to see the statute of liberty. Its a short cab ride to Broadway, Central park for those who dont want to walk. Conveniently there is a bus stop M42 which takes u up to Times Square...Perfect. We didnt eat in the hotel. I cant fault this hotel. We had breakfast daily at Pershing Square, oppo Grand Central Station.Yes the lobby looks a bit worn but the actual rooms were v.cosy, clean carpets and i saw 2 different Queen Superiors 1404 and 1501, and they were more than comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Put this hotel to bed, it is tired”
Reviews.Author: dhp
Reviews.Content: The best way to describe this hotel is tired. I love, and actually prefer older properties. However, this place has been renovated (if at all) on the cheap. I got their most expensive room (a suite) and boy was I disappointed. Stained carpets, musky smelling room and then just when I had enough, I laid down to watch tv in bed. No can do. No TV! It had been removed. I am sure (well maybe not) if I had called, they would have moved me or brought up one of their tired tv's. Possibly, my expectations are too high, but I don't think I could have slept if I wasn't so exhausted. The bed didn't feel clean and crisp. The restaurant was dank and reminded me of a place I stumbled into about an hour outside of Toronto, not someplace I would expect in NYC. My friend recommended I stay here because she said it was nice. However, it is not nice. It is not even OK. It is not worth any money, let alone what I paid. One last thing, this was during a heat wave and when I walked into the lobby to check in, it was the same temperature as outside. I was envious as I walked to my meetings and passed by newer hotels that burst with air conditioning. Then I went back to the Tudor and to my disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - a little effort could make it excellent”
Reviews.Author: magpie1998
Reviews.Content: Finding an acceptable, affordable hotel in midtown Manhattan can always be a bit of a challenge. The Tudor certainly is both. It looks like a good hotel and, in general, it is, but my experience left me with a sense that, with a little attention to detail, it could be much better. The location on East 42nd provides easy, walkable access to may of Manhattan's tourist draws and short taxi or subway trips to the rest. No complaints there. In general, check in and out was easy and pleasant, the room - although tiny - was clean, the bed was comfortable and the hallways seemed quiet - even near the elevators. But little things just didn't get the attention that a well run hotel - regardless of price - gives. On the first morning, one of the coffee cups was obviously not clean. So much for the paper cover implying that they were clean. On another morning, only one bath towel was left on the rack. Travelling by myself, neither of these issues were significant setbacks, but they both left me wondering what could be next. Would I stay here again? Sure. If I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PasiFinland
Reviews.Content: Tudor was ok ( or more than ok ) for the price. We stayed at Tudor for a week in September 2007. To be honest...looking at their website picture gallery, I did expect a bit more. Room was clean & spacious enough for 2 people. Bathroom was ok..I did notice some cracks in the marble though. Would I stay at Tudor at United Nations again? Definitely. + Great location, 10 minutes walk to the Grand Central Station. + Well kept rooms & good size (for Manhattan).Clean bathroom. + Grocery store around the corner

Reviews.Title: “mmm...... not sure about this one”
Reviews.Author: greeneyedkitty
Reviews.Content: After staying at this hotel for one night this past week, I have not decided weather I would consider going back. Firstly, let me say that we got a really good price bidding on Priceline and got the room for about $100 less than the hotel's website. When we checked in, the staff was extremely friendly. We had booked a queen room through priceline due to the lack of options and we were able to change to a double for the same price. Compared to other hotels in New York, the room was very spacious. However, it was very dusty and the bathroom could definitely have been cleaner. The hotel is old, and it showed in this room. The room offered many amenities: iron, blow dryer, safe, trouser press, a table and a desk, two chairs, a nice alarm clock, and Bath and Body Works toiletries. I had not brought my laptop because I had read that internet was very expensive. There were two mosquitoes in the room that we eventually killed and there was a lot of dust flying around that made my allergies act up. The carpet was stained, but I think it's expected in an old hotel. Since it was already later in the evening, we decided to stay in the room. The next morning, while taking a shower, I noticed spider webs by the window. Also, after opening one of the towels that was folded up, we noticed some brownish-yellowish stains..... definitely not good..... The upside is that when we checked out and showed the towel to the hotel's manager she offered to give us breakfast. The hotel's location really depends on your plans in New York. If you plan on walking around, I would recommend getting a hotel closer to the times square area. I hear that the hotel has renovated rooms, the only way I would stay here again is in a renovated room and for that same cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “I called the dept. of Health!!”
Reviews.Author: travelwiz33
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Tudor Hotel and advise against it! I found a dead rat in my room when I was there. Unfortunately for me, I didn't find it until the morning after my stay as I had gotten in late. Needles to say, I left immediately!! There are so many nice hotels in NYC, there is NO NEED to stay in a hotel that has such poor standards of health and cleanliness. I called the dept. of health after staying here....hopefully they will be fined heavily and not make this kind of terrible mistake again. In any event, I completely advise against staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “NOT 4 star, but OK.....”
Reviews.Author: islandboi
Reviews.Content: My partner and I bid on this hotel last minute as I wanted a cheap - but decent - place to catch some sleep because of a 9 hour layover. We got there at about 130am..the staff were nice. The lobby seemed funky and dated, but decent. It had a tad of an old sad, washed out feeling of days of yesteryears...its glamor days long gone. We went into the room and it was small and dark, dirty feeling and creepy. The beds were sagging a little and I felt like I was in a flop house. The bathroom had been remodeled and oddly really fancy and nice... when I discovered the room had wet carpet, I went downstairs and got another room - and wow....what a difference..the next room was very spacious and nice, very clean. The bathroom was once again, very nice and I could tell had been recently remodeled. I would stay there again, but it would not be my first choice and I would make sure I got a nice room. Since I only saw 2 rooms, one horrible and one nice, I cant really say which one represents the hotel as a whole. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Reviews prompt improvement”
Reviews.Author: spankyangel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline based only on general location. We found the small, old style, dark wooden lobby quaint and a nice change from the chain hotels. It seems after reading some of the other reviews, the staff has made some changes. Everyone we encountered was helpful and pleasant. The young man at the front desk commented on my teenage son's towering 6'3' frame, then proceeded to give us a complimentary upgrade to a suite, since the regular rooms are quite small and they had availability. The room was clean, queen beds with pillow tops very comfy, & the bathroom with jacuzi tub was great. They do seem to have a moisture challenge, the rug was rippled, but there was no obvious molds. The food & fresh fruit at the breakfast buffet was generous & tasty. We would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: H0ppers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tudor 22 - 26 May 2008. First impressions were good, it was before the 3pm check in time but a room was ready for us. Lobby looked good and staff were friendly. We were in room 1614, a junior suite, booked via Expedia for £565 for 4 nights. Room was large with a sitting area, dressing table and decent size bathroom with a jacuzzi bath. No terrace unfortunatley. I have previously stayed at the Edison, Milford Plaza & the Belevedere and it compared well. Bed was comfy, air con worked well, hotel was quiet so we slept well. We had a few drinks in the hotel bar and discovered that some of the drinks were over priced - $12 for a JD & coke! My advice is go to the bar on the opposite corner to the hotel McFaddens(?) as the drinks are cheaper & it has a better atmosphere. The Tudor isn't a flash hotel but it does it's job perfectly well. You can sleep well, it's clean and we found the staff to be helpful. Comfort Diner a couple of blocks up is a must. I would stay at the Tudor Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dingy but cheap”
Reviews.Author: ChoosyFox
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as it was one of the very few in Midtown below £200 per night. My first room was dingy with no daylight and an impression that the lamps were so deem and poorly placed in order to hide the dirty carpet. At night it alo transpired that the nearby lifts were a good match to the Grand Central producing non-stop noise. It would be fair to note that the staff were helpful and re-located me on the first request. The second room was bigger and actually allowed some natural light in. Even though it had the same cheap garish decor it was by far cleaner. Overall, I wouldn't recommend it unless you have a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Aud4mDeise
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mum and dad while on a family holiday over Paddy's Weekend. Our flight was delayed, the airline lost our baggage and the hotel staff upgraded us to a Junior Suite for the inconvenience... Room was lovely, food was fab (little on the expensive side), best place for breakfast is Muldoons around the corner, $11 for a full irish. Walking distance to everywhere. Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: BCGobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: The Tudor hotel was okay for a short stay. The room was lovely and well kept. We had a small balcony facing the river. Was not happy with the restaurant and service there. The food was mediocre and we waited 45 minutes to get a bowl of soup and a small pizza that was not any better than a frozen entre. Seemed very few people ate there. Check in was 3:00 but we had to wait for another couple of hours. We were exhausted from an overnight flight. Arriving at 11:00 in the morning we had hoped to get in our room. No such luck. At any rate, we enjoyed our trip to New York having visited there 3 times in the last year and a half. Lots to do, the Met is the best. Used the subway for the first time and found it very easy to use. New Yorkers are very friendly and helpful. Love this city!

Reviews.Title: “3 star is stretching it”
Reviews.Author: lotsofhotels
Reviews.Content: Property is older, with small rooms. Nicely appointed in turn of the century style. I paid $150 per night, so it is a good price for NYC. Parking is $45-$55 per night, but if you go 1 one block on 3rd Ave. you can park it yourself for $33. It is the same property the hotel uses for valet parking. Also, you pay NYC prices for food ($20 for light continental breakfast that amounts to coffee, danish and fruit cup) and drinks ($14 per single shot cocktails with well liquor). The lobby and public areas were much nicer than the rooms. Fitness center was fairly nice as well as the public restrooms. We stayed 3 nights, 2 of which were in a larger room with 2 queen size beds. The bathroom was older and in need of repair. It smelled musty, there was mold in the shower and other areas. The sink looked like 1950's vintage-though the one in the smaller room was granite, but the mold was there as well. The staff seemed disinterested and aloof. Overall, a good bargain if you don't park or eat there. The 3 star a stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: grandduchess
Reviews.Content: This was my first time using Priceline, so I was a bit nervous. I needn't have worried. Everything went swimmingly. Because I had booked on Priceline, I phoned before I left home to make sure that the Tudor had a record of my reservation. They did. I arrived at 7:30am which was WAY early. The doorman helped me with my luggage to the front desk. I was the only guest present. I asked if it would be possible to check my luggage with the bell staff until a room was ready. The friendly front desk person said that while they wouldn't have my queen room ready for a while, there was a non-smoking room with two full size beds that I could have right then. Since it was just me, I agreed. I was more interested in the non-smoking aspect than in the size of the bed. The room was small, but quite a good size for Manhattan. It was clean but well-worn. There were some spots that could have used a bit more dusting, but the linens and carpet were clean. The bathroom was larger than mine at home and quite clean with ample towels and toiletries. The housekeeping staff had not checked the mini-fridge to see if it was clean, but then again that meant that the sealed beverages left behind by the previous occupant were also still there. The hotel is planning a room renovation and had samples of the future rooms in the lobby. They will be quite nice when the fixtures are updated. But the beds and chairs were comfortable and that was the most important thing. There were only two other rooms on my corridor and it was very quiet. A guest was speaking on a cell phone in the hallway at 10:30pm which was pretty late for me, but not for most people. The view was what I would expect for that part of town, mostly buildings, but I could see a bit of a park off to one side. There was some traffic noise from the street, but again, it is midtown Manhattan. My only two real issues were: the temperature and the lighting. The temperature control was either on or off and either hot or cold. Not exactly easy to get it right either way. The light switches didn't operate some of the lights and some of the light switches didn't do anything. Seems that could be rectified as well. It also would have been nice to know what the charge was to use wireless internet in the room. Since it was not disclosed, I chose not to use it. Didn't eat at the hotel. Didn't really need to. There are plenty of places to eat within a quick walk or subway ride. The hotel is only a few short blocks from Grand Central Terminal and several buses stop right in front so there are many transportation options. Next morning, I checked out at 5:30am to catch a train at Penn Station. I had mentioned this when I checked in and there was a cab out front, even though I had not always seen one there the day before. Made me wonder if they had phoned ahead. I would definitely stay there again and would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: charliepolis
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic deal with Opodo for our trip to New York - £548 each for return flights (from the UK) and 4 nights in the Tudor. We were expecting a 4 star hotel but our standard room was more like 3 star. The bathroom consisted of a toilet, shower and basin. The shower was very good - powerful and hot whatever time we used it! The room itself was a suitable size, a lot bigger than what you would get in a London hotel. It was fairly nicely decorated too. TV showed standard US channels with some good movies. There was no charge for watching (though you did have the option of paying for newer movies if you chose to). The minibar if it existed was inaccessible (we think it was under the TV) but we bought our own drinks down the road at the 24 hour Duane Reade convenience store and the hotel had a nice touch of having ice machines on a few floors so you could go and fill your ice bucket up as many times as you like. We used our bathroom sink as a giant ice bucket to chill our drinks. The bed was comfortable and queen size. There was air conditioning in the room which was good and not noisy. Plenty storage in the form of drawers and a wardrobe with hangers. Also had iron and trouser press. I used the iron once and it was fine. There was zero view from the windows and very little light came through them due to other skysrapers around. Housekeeping did a good job on a daily basis, I think only once did they forget to fill the tissues (not the toilet roll) up which is a minor thing. The room was an ideal base for touring the city. It was on the East side but only 5 minutes walk from Grand Central Station where you could get the tube everywhere! We walked everywhere apart from when we went downtown and to give you an idea walking-wise it was 20 minutes to Times Square and about 10-15 to Empire State. All in all a good central location I felt. The hotel was nice to come back to and unlike other hotel rooms we've stayed in we were quite happy to sit in our room for an hour or two having a drink and resting our feet before an evening out. There was no shortage of mirrors which as a woman I appreciate. One of the only draw backs - the front of house team were miserable. When we arrived, they said our room was for one night. We told them no, we'd booked for 4 nights. Then they tried to give us a smoking room which we said we didn't ask for. They sorted this fairly quickly but were very unfriendly in that they barely looked at or spoke to us. It costs nothing to smile as they say! Other than that, at the price we paid we can't complain and would recommend it to anyone looking for a fairly nice base to see New York.

Reviews.Title: “A Good spot”
Reviews.Author: DublinDave007
Reviews.Content: Hi, We spent the last five nights in The Tudor Hotel on 2nd Ave, 42nd Street. We chose it because of Tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed. The rooms are small, however they are fully equipped and decorated up to a very high standard. I would have no problem recommending this hotel as your place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tudor House is a Good Buy, but could be better....”
Reviews.Author: SLOtripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tudor House for a week in March and have the following observations: Hotel counter staff were disinterested and cool, but the porter was big help with airport transportation. We got a good price on Hotwire - paid $160 per night and they did accommodate our request for two beds. The rooms were a comfortable size and the heating and AC worked well. The bed was very hard and we did request a different room and bed after two nights. After the second try, they did put us in a room with a tempurpedic bed, but this room was near the elevator - faint noise but not objectionable. The rooms need updating and they do intend to update in the future. The linens are medium quality. The bathroom was nicely equipped with hair dryer and makeup mirror (thank you!) and the shower was great. Perhaps booking with Hotwire does not get you the best rooms, and if you can, get rooms on the highest floors. Overall, we were comfortable and the location worked out well. Our friends had a nice view of river from their 15th floor room and we had a view of a church roof and walls above from the 9th floor. A three block walk to Grand Central Station and you are in subway and train heaven, Starbucks is nearby for the coffee fix. At first, restaurants are not too obvious at this location, but we did make a couple of good finds. For a quick, cheap dinner, try Goodburger on 3rd Ave just a block from the hotel. We had wonderful Vietnamese cuisine in a lovely little restaurant, two blocks north and 1 block west, named Boi. The food, ambiance and service were wonderful in this little gem. Dinner with nice wine was $90 for two. You are very close to the UN and a city bus stops right in front of the hotel and will take you straight to Times Square up 42nd Street in 20 minutes. The hotel lobby needs some TLC - furnishings are worn and we wished for a few tables, so we could go over maps and plans with our friends. The only tables are in the bar area and they don't want you there if you are not ordering. Given the high price of rooms in NYC, I think this hotel is a good buy. It is definitely not 4 stars, but well above a Comfort Inn, etc. My other hotel experiences are Hilton Times Square, definitely a 4 star and Hotel Edison, a 21/2 to 3 star. Perhaps Tudor House does deserve it's 3.5 star... more trips to NYC will help us better evaluate.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandItchyfeet
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Tudor Hotel around new years with my partner and I really enjoyed it! Our double room was really spacious and comfortable. Its ideally located (you can see the chrysler building from it!) and is great for families . The service was brilliant. Althought the gym was a bit small it was fine and anyways you're on your holidays you shouldn't be working out!Walking around macy's is enough excersize! All in all we were delighted with this hotel, it had everything you could want and great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “we liked it”
Reviews.Author: bicheno
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline and it was a good deal we got. The hotel lobby is very nice and elegant, the room was very clean if a little tiny. But filled with all that makes you feel comfortable: Coffeemaker, Iron-Facilities, Bathroom with a window to open, and- the room was very quiet. Nice, attendive staff, we would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “ask for an upgrade and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: ClassynRich
Reviews.Content: It was my birthday weekend and I wanted to be near the east side of Manhattan, the Tudor hotel is in a great location. When I arrived the doorman was very nice but when we got to the front desk a blonde Russian girl was working and he was not giving me the "excellent Customer service." I was basically rushed from the front desk, and she didn't even say happy birthday even when I told her that I waS celebrating my bday. she was very rude and threw my credit card back at me. When I went to the room, it was a very small room and I felt a little uncomfortable because I saw a HUGE cockroach in the bathroom. I went downstairs to inquire about a room change and the girl who checked me in said that she would downgrade me in a snotty attitude! I was really shocked!! I immediately wanted to speak with a manager, the manager was rude as well and she didnt even care about my situation! after huffing and puffing the manager gave me a comp upgrade to a nice room with balcony. overall the staff was very rude, and I rather receive exceptional service from another hotel then this one. GOOD LUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Great buffet, clean room, great value”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda21043
Reviews.Content: We saw a listing from Smarttravel about a $169 special for a Superior Queen room including breakfast for 2, and thought that it could not possibly be true. But we were pleasantly suprised! Our room was large by New York standards, meaning that we could actually walk around the queen size bed without bumping our shins. It had an ironing board and working iron, and a pants press. The bathroom in our room was very clean and the towels were soft and plentiful. Usually I have to call the front desk for additional towels, so I was amazed to find more than the usual 3 bath towels in a hotel! The bedding was soft, clean, and looked to be new. The air conditioning was quiet and the room remained cool without becoming overly chilled. The view was nonexistant, but I expect that from an NYC hotel. The front desk staff was helpful, and we were quickly booked in even though we arrived at the same time as a busload of tourists from Italy. The parking was expensive, but it was in-line with what I expected to pay for NYC. The best part was the free buffet breakfast. Service was superb, the food was plentiful and very fresh, and they had the cutest little delicious potato pancakes rather than the tired tater tots or greasy home fries you usually get at a buffet. They had a large variety of fruit, the hot buffet items were actually hot, and we were greeted warmly by the servers who were attentive, refilling water glasses and asking us if everything was to our satisfaction. A waiter overheard me telling my husband that I liked the fruit, and went up and got me some more and brought it to the table without being asked. This was well above the service I would expect from a buffet or at a hotel in this price rage. We were originally from New York, so we didn't need much advice from the concierge, but he was helpful the few times I asked questions. We now live in Maryland, but visit frequently so we have stayed in many hotels in Manhattan, and this was one of the most enjoyable stays we had at an under $400 a night rate. The location was excellent, we were able to take a quick cab ride to the theatre district. Cabs were plentiful and the doormen were always available. I must say I was pleasantly suprised after reading some of the reviews, but we will definitely stay there again this spring and again in the summer, although I doubt we will ever see such a good special offer. Overall, I would rate our experience as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “small, dark, old hotel - but cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle2013
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline for $154/night. The price was right. The pluses of the hotel are that it is clean and a reasonable walk to Grand Central Station. It is not a 4 star hotel, and probably not a 3 star hotel either. Our room was really small, dark and dingy. THe shower is one of those old ones that require 4 steps to turn on (there are instructions posted in the shower). The walls were really thin. We were woken up at 3 am by fighting in the room next door - security came and asked them to please be quiet. THe bed linens arent that nice. THe TV is really old with poor reception. The room keys take more than a few tries to work. THere is nothing inviting about the room or hotel lobby. It was an adequate place to sleep. But I wouldnt want to stay here again. It would be worth a few $$ more to stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mandee1976
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline and you never know what you are going to get. I was very please with our experience with this hotel. I had called after we had booked the reservation so they could note that this was our honeymoon. We arrived at 9am and were checked in immedately and upgraded to larger room with a jacuzzi tub. We really enjoyed our trip and would stay there again in a heatbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrannyManchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in November 2007 with my friend. We had gone to New York to do our Christmas shopping and had a fabulous time. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful. The rooms were an average size with two double beds in the Queen Superior. Didn't spend too much time in the hotel as we were out shopping in the many shops (so many shops so little time!!!). It is in a great area just down the road from Grand Central and within walking distance of Seventh Avenue. The rooms were clean with plenty of wardrobe space and there was a complimentary safety deposit box. I would recommend this hotel as it was convenient, clean ideally situated.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant short stay”
Reviews.Author: nancelita
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tudor for one night in January. Although only a short visit, we found it pleasant and comfortable. The check-in line was long but the staff was helpful, courteous, and worked as quickly as possible. Our room was of average size and although the walls and bathroom were a bit worn, for the price and location in NYC, we found the hotel to be of good value. We will definitely stay here again on a future trip and we would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: rltalley
Reviews.Content: Our family went to NYC while my husband was on leave from Iraq. We stayed on the 20th floor in a 1-br suite. It was really wonderful. The views were awesome! The kids had a wonderful time. The frontdesk and other staff were amazing! Enjoyed every minute and the employees really made for the experience as any question was quickly answered and need immediately taken care of - professionalism at it's finest! Only thing I can say is it is a bit far from Times Square in 30 degrees, but we would stay there again in a heartbeat! The bathroom was WONDERFUL!!! Quick tip, the hotel had the lowest nightly rate on the internet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cerealteri
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel during the week of Christmas. I must say for the price this was a very pleasant stay. The room was a good size, it had two nice sized beds and the room was decorated very nicely. I don't know if we were really tired or what but those beds were extremely comfortable. Also, if you forget something like toothpaste or a toothbrush the hotel supplies it at no charge. Check in and check out was a breeze. I will definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Good location for UN business”
Reviews.Author: RTW_guy
Reviews.Content: Following the advice of another review we phoned in to ask for a "view room". The staff put us on the top floor. Unfortunately the room didn't get warm even when we returned from dinner. We asked for a new room but the desk sent the maintenance man, who said with the cold weather the air had to be let out of the system and since we were on the top floor this caused the problem. A few minutes after he fixed it, the system began to rattle, so after another call and wait he came to fix that. However, during the rest of our stay the room was too warm even with the heat off, so we had to periodically open the windows. At least there were two so we could get draft and cool it down rapidly. Overall the room and bathroom were nicely furnished but hard to navigate with an odd layout and a pillar. Getting around the bed was especially tight. The gym was nice though, but it's in the back tower. There's a couple buses that stop right at the hotel. We got the hotel through Priceline, but ended up with the same price as the hotel website. The elevators were incredibly fast and smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Above average for an offbrand property”
Reviews.Author: dvweis
Reviews.Content: Room was small but not the smallest in town, and the place was reasonably clean. Bed had a great firm mattress. My room had a desk which was great. They had a nice single light switch to turn on various lights and the A/C. 42nd St busstop right out in front. A few negatives: a) The fitness center had some weight machines but they were few, rusty and poorly maintained. There were just 3 treadmills and one cross trainer. Two more cross trainers would help avoid the rush. b) The maid left a wet washcloth in the bathroom. c) Wifi Internet was expensive at $15/day d) Front desk couldn't tell me if the room had a full desk when I checked in - I had to go up to check. Their database wasn't clear about this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yschoy
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was a bit worried before I got here as I had read a bag of mixed reviews. Check-in went smoothly despite some horror stories though took a while but that was because there was other people in front of us which was hardly the fault of the hotel. Arrived at our room, fair enough, it is not particularly big but having stayed in some hotels in Europe, I found it to be a good size and most importantly, it was clean and the bed was comfortable with a large sized tv. No mini-bar though but this wasn't a problem as I wasn't planning to drink in my room. Definitely enough space for two people - each with a large suitcase. Bathroom was clean with large mirrors though a bit dark when you are actually in the shower. All amenities were provided including shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and even mouthwash. What I like about the Tudor was that there was a sign that said the hotel would be willing to provide things you may have forgotten such as toothbrush, toothpaste, and shaving cream/gel free of charge if you had forgotten! Never had that before, normally they have these things available at reception but at the cost of an arm and a leg so that was a nice small perk! Every morning, we got a complimentary copy of a newspaper - I don't remember which one - which was also a nice touch. And when we left the room in a mess, it always came back tidy. Even though we were facing the main street, we were on the 15th floor so it was never too noisy. And other guests were considerate so we were never disturbed or harassed! The location is also good for the price we paid. I expected it to be quite far but it is on the Grand Central Station Metro station on lines 7, 4, 5 and 6 which means it was quite easy to get to Times Square (takes less than 15 mins walking anyway!) and Canal Street/Spring Street which is excellent for shopping. Empire State Building isn't far off as well and you can reach Grand Central Station easily (go to the basement food court area to go to Juniors who easily do the best Cheesecake I have ever tasted!!) and you can actually see the Chrysler Building in all it's glory at night all lit up and pretty!! There's a CVS nearby which is open 24/7 and sells anything that you could possibly need from medicines to drinks to snacks to shampoo and handcream which is handy. It's cheaper than some of the supermarkets nearby too. Overall, really enjoyed my stay here and would definitely recommend it to people I know (and don't know). I would come and stay here again especially for the price I paid - bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Reservations Service”
Reviews.Author: Shimdog
Reviews.Content: Beware of an incompetent reservations desk at this hotel. Their website claims they will beat any internet price. When I tried to get them to do so, I was on hold so long for the reservations desk (over 10 minutes) that I tried to talk to the front desk. They said they weren't authorized to match the rate and I'd have to speak with reservations. So I waited on hold for over 5 minutes more and hung up. I tried again the next day, only now the rate had gone up on the internet. Still I could not get anyone on the phone from reservations to even explain the situation. I then received a recording stating that I could leave my contact information so they could call me back. It is two days later and I still had not heard from them. I just called again, was placed on hold for 4 minutes, was disconnected, and had to call again. I eventually spoke with the manager of the reservations desk, who claimed that the rate I saw was never offered and that they didn't have a message from me. Instead of offering a frustrated potential customer the rate that I saw (which is still very high), he chose not to believe me and refused to bend. He never even acknowledged that the hotel might have messed up. Wow!! Now that's great customer service...from a manager no less! They lost over $850 in hotel revenue and have an irritated traveler on their hands. Does that make sense? This is the first negative review I have ever left. Bad service is inexcusable. Again...beware.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: Booked this place for 4 nights when it was still the Crowne Plaza and was hoping i wouldnt have any problems with check in due to the fact it's now the Tudor. Fortunately i had no problems other than turning up an hour before check in to be told i had to "Wait" for my room by a woman who wasnt the friendliest person i've met. I dropped my bag at the Bell Desk and they were happy to hold onto my bags for an hour. Came back an hour later again to get a guy with a bit of attitude but he issued me a room on the 2nd floor and i proceeded to my room. It was huge and to their credit actually quite a decent room. Bathroom was large as well and had a very generous serve of tolietries! Beds were clean and the TV was a decent size. As i was visiting friends i rarely spent time in my room but i did find it a little strange that my room had no "Guest Services Directory" in it. I'm not sure if it was just my room or if it applied to all rooms. I never did get a chance to ask them. Fitness Centre was nice and on the 2nd floor and whilst i never used the restaurant/bar it was always full of business people and seemed decent. One day i needed to find a post office, I asked for directions at the Concierge and they gave me the wrong directions!!!! It's about a 15 min walk to Times Square and about 5 mins to the Empire State Building. As someone said before i think the problem with this place is bad management and low staff morale. Overall i'd rate my stay as average but found the place a little too far away from everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: u2Pasi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tudor Hotel for 5 nights, really pleased with the hotel. No problems with check in at all. Rooms were small but not too small (and it's NYC after all). Grand Central Terminal is 5 minutes walk from Tudor. So overall good hotel and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Unresponsive staff ruined our weekend.”
Reviews.Author: traveler1002
Reviews.Content: On Friday night, about midnight, the occupant in the adjacent room ran up and down the hallway in his underwear, shouting and cursing. (I can't here repeat what he said over and over.) I called the front desk and they did nothing. By 1AM, he was banging on people's doors, and incessantly ringing his own doorbell. I asked the front desk to call the police. Instead, they sent a security man who did....nothing. At about 3 AM, the occupant sounded as if he were breaking furniture. He again shouted curses into the hallway. Again, I asked that the police be called. The front desk did (you guessed it) nothing. The worst part? The night staff never told the day staff about the problem. The day staff, even AFTER learning about the problem, allowed him to extend his stay! Our weekend was ruined. I actually don't blame the occupant, who clearly had some sort of serious issue. I do blame the hotel. They offered us a complimentary breakfast the next morning. We declined their offer. My advice? Stay somewhere else. While this may have been an isolated incident, it indicates how the hotel is managed. I intend to notify hotwire and AAA about this.

Reviews.Title: “Something dodgy going on with reservations!”
Reviews.Author: ThomasRye
Reviews.Content: On arrival from Europe, after a very long day of travel, we found check in to be very slow, even though we were next in line. When we finally went to check in we were informed that we had no reservation even though I had booked through their website and had the confirmation page with me. Luckily, there were rooms available for all nights except the following one. However, as this was our first time in New York and because we had very short notice to find another hotel for a Saturday night this was an awful experience. We asked check in staff to recommend another hotel and three of them just shook their heads in a disinterested manner and shrugged shoulders . They didn't have any sympathy for our situation. Prior to this I had twice emailed the hotel on an issue and received no reply. I now think that perhaps they had double booked and didn't want to reply as this would be committing a room to us. I know of two other cases where the exact same thing happened while we were there! In one case the reception staff told a guest something about there being no guarantee of a room. I overheard another lady having the same problem.She told reception staff that whoever she spoke to on the phone the day before didn't give her two words and she couldn't get through to the hotel after that. It really was the most awful inconvenience as we had booked the 48 hour bus tour for the next two days and we couldn't begin that both days until about 3pm as we had to check in and out of the two hotels. When we went to check in the second time the new receptionist said we had no reservation but ,fortunately, I then recognised the other receptionist just passing by who had made our reservations the day before. However, despite the nightmare mix up it did get better! I really loved the room and the hotel is great. Walls are thin as I could hear the man in the next room yawning but there are only three rooms on each corrirdor and I think we were alone until the end of the week so for us this wasn't a problem. The air conditioning or fan was very noisy as well but as the cleaning staff left it on all day we didn't need it at night . By the way because of the mix up we had two rooms and it was noisy in both. However, on the plus side our first room was on the second floor overlooking the street but we heard no external noise.Oh I've just remembered when we had to change our hotel for the next night we asked if we could leave our bags with them in the security room until we returned and they weren't willing to do this either. Maybe it was for insurance purposes but they didn't explain that they just said they had no security room but we used it on the day of our departure so now I know there was one. I see others have complained about the location but I found it very convenient. Actually it was perfect for shopping, tourist attractions and transport. I would stay there again definately but I would advise to be very cautious when booking! P.S On a side note avoid using phones in room to make international calls. We made two, lasting less than 5 minutes when you total both and it cost 30 dollars.The film that we watched in our room cost about 11 dollars I think but I was happy with that.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jena16
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel on priceline for $238/night. Initially I was concerned that the hotel would be too far from the action - but it was perfect! I had called ahead of time to let them know that my husband and I were celebrating a special occasion, and to check on the possibility of upgrading to a Jr. Suite. The reservationist I spoke with on the phone quoted me the various upgrade rates. When we arrived at the hotel - they upgraded us to a beautiful Jr. Suite - for free! The room was great - very spacious and nicely appointed - my one complaint about the room was that it smelled very faintly of smoke, but it wasn't a big deal. The public spaces in the hotel are very nice, but I was disappointed that the hotel bar did not stay open later - and room service is only available until 10:30pm. Other than that, the stay was perfect! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good experience”
Reviews.Author: cute4runner
Reviews.Content: During check in (which took a while but it's ok with us), the customers before us were having problems with their rooms. Also the front desk staff looked very burnt out. So when get to our turn, they gave us a room that was not even made (ok with us as well). We went back to front desk and they switched us to another room. Our new room on the 17th floor (the view was OK) was pretty comfortable, 2 double beds were comfortable, bedsheets/linens were clean, room was clean, plenty of clean towels, AC was working pretty well, marbled looking bathroom was clean, loved all the bath and body works shampoo, lotion, bar soap...oh we connected to wireless internet for no charge as well (with our laptop) in our room! Overall, it's a good hotel...even though small and kind of old fashioned, but we definitely enjoyed our peaceful stay, and having free wireless was a plus! Would recommend anyone to stay at this hotel if you are on a budget. Just keep an open mind, since the front staff looked like they worked very hard and burnt out!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: WallybLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tudor hotel for 5 nights,was really pleased with hotel,due to our flight being delayed at Manchester we arrived at 4am,the night staff were very helpful when were so tired & just wanted to crash out,the 2 rooms were spotless & kept tidy by the maids,all the facilitys were first class,must also mention the concierge who couldnt do enough for us when we asked for advice,I would definetly recommend the hotel,loads of places to eat as well locally if you didnt fancy the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: adicecream
Reviews.Content: We just spent four days at the Tudor at the United Nations. We were in NYC for the US Open Tennis and booked the Tudor largely because of its proximity to Grand Central Station and the #7 subway we would take to the Open. The hotel was reasonably priced for NYC (about $220 plus all the NYC taxes) and was clean, comfortable, quiet and upscale enough for us with a bar, restaurant and concierge. The rooms were fairly large for a NYC hotel. The bed was comfortable, the TV/cable worked well, the bathroom was more than adequate with a great shower. The location was perfect -- we walked not only to Grand Central but to restaurants in Murray Hill and around Midtown. My only small complaint was that our room was not ready at check in time, but since we were not in a hurry we had a drink in the bar and then moved in. I would absolutely stay in this hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong there”
Reviews.Author: MickDHolland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Tudor for two nights when visiting Manhattan with my 14 yr. old daughter, who is even more picky then i am where it comes to hotelrooms. She was happy with it.....! Our room on the 16th floor was small but clean and had everything we were promised and it all worked too! Very friendly staff, they even kept our luggage after check-out so i could get my rental car and pick it up later. At no charge! We didn't use the breakfast facilities, as NY has plenty of opportunities food-wise, also in the direct vicinity of the hotel. Location is good too. 5 mins. from Grand Central and maybe 10-12 mins. from Times Square. Prices seem to vary tho', because when i tried to book a room for two more nights after our trip to Cape Cod, the same room was almost double the price..... Booked another hotel for then, review will follow after stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tudor United Nations Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hrzregina
Reviews.Content: Awful service- avoid this hotel Service is awful on ALL levels. The manager, Brian promised me a one bedroom suite with a terrace after Virginia in reservations failed to follow-up on several "issues" she created during the booking process. When I arrived, Brian was unfamiliar with the system and could not distinguish between a room with/without a terrace? I switched rooms twice before I was placed in a room with a terrace by Andre (apparently the only person who knows how to locate a room in the system). I was promised several things that I did not receive. I purchased two double beds (as detailed in my original booking IN WRITING), but the manager tried to tell me that they do not guarantee that (although it was confirmed in writing?). I paid for a package that included breakfast but was told it would have to be confirmed before I was given vouchers (again, this was IN WRITING and included in the price). I recently had knee/foot surgery and when I limped out of the shuttle to the front of the hotel, the attendant did not assist me. He simply watched me get through the door and then asked if I "had it" (after he saw the manager at the desk). The concierge works until 8pm and as I approached the desk at a few minutes before 8pm he promplty ignored me. Mind you, he was still at the desk and acknowledged my presence by avoiding eye contact. I asked if he was "off-duty" and he simply replied that he could provide information only if I had a "quick question". Mold was found throughout the bathroom/in the tub. The floor, door and tile in the bathroom were filthy. House cleaning did not vacuum the room during my stay. The cushions on the couch were ripped and the insides exposed. The hotel staff does not acknowledge guests when they enter/exit the facility. I wish I would have kept my prior reservations at the omni! I would not recommend the Tudor to anyone nor would I book here again. I'm a frequent traveler and am familiar with the issues one can have when in a new city, so I took the time to fully research my choice of accommodations before embarking on my trip to New York. How could I have been so wrong? PLEASE do not make the same mistake that I did with this hotel. Avoid contact with managers Brian and Michelle as neither is knowledgeable regarding the reservation system. However, unlike Michelle, Brian is very personable and apologetic (unfortunately, this did not translate into an ability to correct the errors that had been made). Do not deal with reservation agent Virginia as she has no idea how to navigate the reservation system. Do not rely on the concierge for information as they do not want to work and avoid the attendant as he is not going to help with bags. Had I not paid for my reservation in advance I would have left the hotel before checking in!

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: Kate17
Reviews.Content: All in all, a good stay at the Tudor. I chose this place based on getting a good price on Expedia, though it was still around $200. As expected from a NYC hotel, the room was teeny. It was fine for me since I was staying alone. I imagine that room style is for single travelers...I couldn't imagine having shared it. Overall, it was clean and the staff was nice. A few stray hairs in the bathroom, but nothing alarming. Great water pressure in the shower. The pipes make loud thumping noises, but luckily that never happened while I was trying to sleep. For some reason, my laptop didn't like the hotel...it took forever to turn on, yet once I left the hotel it worked fine. I don't know if there's something in the walls or whatnot. I thought at the time that maybe it was my computer acting up, so I didn't think to ask if others had had similar problems. The bed was comfortable. AC worked fine. Location was good. I would stay there again if necessary and if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: lizLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Reviewer:A trip advisor member,Liverpool UK. We have just returned from a five day trip to New york staying in the Tudor hotel.We had a wonderful time as we were there for our wedding anniversary. Hotel was great value for money our room was very spacious and we would stay there again.Staff were very helpful and pleasant. Weather was very hot and would advise you wear some comfortable walking shoes as we walked nearly everywhere!Saw just about everything we planned, views from Empire State Building were amazing.Times Square was alive with people and a few good Irish pubs.We went to Central Park which was a nice break from all the crowds, didnt see enough of it though as it is so big. Overall we had a fantastic time.Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LTGalloway
Reviews.Content: Very Clean Hotel and overall good location. The Concierge was a bit snooty (depending on who was on the shift) but everything else was great! Be careful to ask if you are in the back of the hotel - there is NO view. We were in a Junior Suite BUT we liked the location of the room because it was very quiet. The room also had very nice Bath & Body Works products. You can hear everything in the hallways but overall it wasn't very bad - we had absolutely no problems sleeping...ALSO, beware of parking fees - they are really $45 for a car and $55 for a SUV and basically only valet available unless you want to go to a deck on your own to park. Call AHEAD in plenty of time for Valet - they are very slow..... The Front Desk Staff was also very nice. I would stay there again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Just stayed here for 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: wallerToronto
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 3 nights. Overall, for the money (approx. $220 for a basic Queen room) per night this hotel is at least average to above. No real complaints. Afterall, how much time do you spend in the hotel when visiting NYC? If you are looking for a clean, safe and well priced hotel for a couple nights this is a good Midtown facility. The address is a little out of the way (again, good if you are looking for quiet after hours) but still a short walk along 42nd Street to Grand Central. A little bit of a small room and some elevator noise. However, clean and nice bathroom. Good to have a safe in the room to lock up valuables. We would stay here again if we wanted to be in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Review of the Tudor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ab316
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was really good. Very clean. Jim at the conceirge desk was awesome. Everything he recommended to us was top notch. Problems Check-in was really slow. And then they gave us a room that was occupied by someone else. The front desk apologized, sent us to another room. An upgrade or a rate adjustment would have been nice. Especially since we could have walked into a room where people could have been "busy." If you are in the north tower, they only have 1 ice machine at it's on the second floor. If you are on the higher levels, it's a pain. The south tower has three ice machines.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base for our first trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: FrankieEB
Reviews.Content: We booked here for 5 nights through Expedia for our 1st Wedding Anniversary. It was our first time in NYC and this was an excellent base. The reception staff were great on check in and let us check into our room before midday despite it being a 2pm check in. The room was a great standard - spacious and clean. Lovely bathroom. Large tv. The cleaners each day were fantastic. When visiting NYC location is important and this was an excellent location - near Grand Central Station and the Crysler Building. Easy walk from Times Square. My only moan would be that we were not given much help by the concierge in booking our transfer back to the airport. They would only book the Company recommended by them which were quite a lot more expensive. We did however take advantage of the hotels free telephones and sorted it out ourselves. We will definitely be going back to NYC and would definitely consider returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: iqq
Reviews.Content: Juts spent two days with my wife. Arrived late and were given a non-smoking room that smelled like smoke. They immediately changed us to a new room -- Room 1811!!! It was a treat. Bed was extraconfortable, great linen, pillows, toiletries etc. Service in all parts of the hotel is excellent and the common facilities are really nice. Temperatures in NYC were really high and a small drawback was that the ac could hardly cope. We wished the ac would have worked better but it was OK. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “An adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: pointpetre
Reviews.Content: My wife saw a super deal on this hotel for $19.31 per night. I immediately went online to book, but such deals don't last, and I was out of luck for Friday and Saturday night. I got a fairly good deal through Hotels.com for those night and took the 19.31 through the hotel for Sunday night. We had a great stay in New York. Saw "A Chorus Line" on Friday evening after dinner by the statue and fountain in Rockefeller Center. A great lunch on Saturday at Dawat on 58th Street before seeing "Curtains." Toured on Suday and saw "Spring Awakening" on Sunday evening. Our room was small with no view, but quiet. The room could have been cleaner, but was not out of line for New York. I haven't stayed at a New York hotel yet without some mildew in the shower/tub grout or dirt in the tiny corners. There was a puddle of coffee under the coffee pot on check in. Room amenities were great-extensive, even a pants press, as well as ironing board and iron, etc. Shampoos, lotions, mouthwash, etc. They'll bring you a razor or other toiletries gartis if you need them. We only got decaf coffee for our room pot. That was a new experience for me. The staff is warm and helpful. The bed was very comfortable with superior linen. The fitness center is small but adequate. There are ice machines on the second and eighth floors. They gave us complimentary breakfasts one day due to one minor mix up. Omelet was soggy ala England and the bacon ala England as well, but okay overall. Very nice waiters and room maids. I regard the room deficiencies as more a management/training issue than a staff issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: nicegirl512
Reviews.Content: The Tudor Hotel was one of the few places I could find in Manhattan for around $200/night (though taxes and fees and whatnot added another $40). I was not quite sure what to expect at that price, and was extremely pleasantly surprised. The room was large, clean, and newly refurbished. The lobby is quite nice, much nicer than you would expect. Checkin and checkout were smooth. The toiletries were from Bath and Body Works. The bed was comfortable. It's a three block walk up from Grand Central. The only even remotely negative we had was the guys in front (bellhops? I don't know what their title is) wouldn't hail us a cab to go crosstown. Whatevs. We are from DC and know how to hail cabs. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: advisorSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. Staff are friendly, there is a concierge. Excellent location, close to Grand Central (train main station), 2 minutes away from the subway and close to the United Nations. I really enjoyed my stay: spacious room, extremely clean, not noisy, room with AC, restaurant with good food. I will definitely stay here again, and thanks since I discovered this hotel on this website!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Jayne9723
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 3 night stay at the Tudor Hotel yesterday and have to say I was very pleased. It was booked through My Travel flying with Globespan (who are the worst airline I have ever used but that's another story) and I paid £500. First of all the service was very good. At check in we were automatically upgraded from a double to a queen superior without having to ask. The room was a good size with a full marble bathroom and the air con was good. There was absolutely no noise coming from outside even though our room was at the front of the hotel. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. The Information desk next to check-in were also great - they gave us details of where certain shops were located and provided maps which they marked for us, or gave information on where to go to eat if you want the best cheese-cake etc which I can inform WAS the best place! (Jimmy's, Grand Central Terminal). Downstairs there's a very stylish looking bar and lounge with nice leather seating and a relaxed atmosphere. There is also an internet access room further down (5 dollars per 15mins). On check-out our bags were labelled and securely put away in locked room by the luggage desk so we could go off and continue to explore the city before we had to catch our flight. I would say this hotel is more like a good 4 star than a 3 star. The service was courteous and the hotel very clean and well kept. I would recommend this hotel to anybody (but don't fly with Globespan!).

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations for a 3 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Moramare
Reviews.Content: This hotel - though located in a more quit area than midtown west - is great value for money. The rooms are not big but comfortable and clean! Unfortunately most taxi drivers don't know that this hotel is now the Tudor Hotel, so ask for the Crowne Plaza at 42nd...

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: bemahl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Tudor for four nights, May 30 through June 2. Having no other recourse, with hotel rates on all sites crazy expensive in NYC for these dates, we crossed our fingers and took the Priceline plunge. We were pleasantly surprised on many counts. The hotel is in an amazing location, just a short walk to Grand Central Station on the quieter and more reserved east side of midtown, and still easy walking distance to Times Square, Fifth Avenue, and Central Park. Priceline only guarantees a double bed (ugh!) so we contacted the hotel directly before arrival to request a queen or king, and to let them know that we would be checking in late. The overnight front desk clerk was less than helpful and said that she knew of no such request, that we had a room with 2 double beds. We spent the first night there, the air conditioner was great (freezing) but there was hair in the bathtub (yuck). Also, it was a "migraine room", something that I experienced several years ago on a trip to NYC with a friend...all of the windows are blocked by different parts of the building, so the sun never comes through..not easy to wake up in the morning! Next morning we again requested the upgrade at the front desk, and were treated wonderfully by Vito (manager?) who upgraded us to a "Junior Suite", standard size room, which is large by NYC standards, great bedding and pillows, and outstanding views of the East river! I couldn't bring myself to complain about anything since they were so generous with the upgrade, but...the jacuzzi tub was unusable, even as a regular bathtub, since the drain plug didn't work, and when I pulled it up to possibly see what the problem was, the stench and rusty funk on it almost knocked me over. Suffice it to say we took showers. And the a/c barely blew, which was miserable since it was 90 degrees in New York last week. The Tudor has huge potential, but it needs some cleaning up. But for what hotels were going for, even if we had stayed in the first room, I definitely feel like I got my money's worth and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Ask the right questions!”
Reviews.Author: dmspooner
Reviews.Content: After booking this 3 star hotel through priceline ($175/night) I promptly called the hotel to request a non smoking room. The reservation department required that I leave a message and they would get back to me. Three left messages later no one had returned my call and I was to arrive in less than 4 hours. I asked the front desk to help me with my request and within 10 seconds time I had reserved a nonsmoking room and was upgraded to a queen bed with little more than a please. At no extra charge I might add. When I arrived the room was quite larger than priceline's other 3 star ranked hotels. Bathroom was roomy, A/C was on and cool, no smell or other oddities. One thing that I must say is that we stayed in room 1217...(North Tower) This has to be the quietest room in all of New York City. No traffic noise whatsoever.
