Overall since I don't get to decide where I stay with priceline it's always a gamble, I never book through them for anything less than a 3 star and from some of the other ones I've seen I happily give this room and hotel an ALMOST 4....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, got a free suite upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: ukdave0
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights May 18. Arrived at 1:30 pm and not only was the room ready, but I got upgraded to a suite. Very quite, nice bed, good shower, jacuzzi. Shows some wear but about what I expected. Ate some bad egg salad from a nearby deli. Had to sleep all day Saturday, nice and comfortable, with little noise.

Reviews.Title: “Pants”
Reviews.Author: montygommers
Reviews.Content: Messed up our booking. Had booked 2 rooms, and only one was available. Should have been twins. The one available was a double. Had to take that and then also pay for upgrade on other ropom to a suite. Suite was nice, double was rubbish. Very tatty and smelly. Front desk staff were useless and sent an important message to the room even though we had checked out and had told them we would be waiting in the bar for this message. Whole place is shabby and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience at the Tudor!”
Reviews.Author: CAASanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times, when it was the Crowne Plaza UN and have enjoyed the service, price and location. Recently I stayed for 2 nights at the Tudor, and it was like a Jekyll/Hyde experience. Awful! The staff were brisk and rude - I had asked to change my room and when they noticed that I was a Priority Club member, they said that they could do it the next day, and to pack my bags and leave them in the room and they would change the room. I did that and went out for the day, and then came back to the hotel and they said that they didn't have the rooms to change - in other words, they reneged on their promise. I went to the old room, and my suitcases were there, and the maid had not come to clean the room! The toilet was plugged from the day before, and when I called maintenance, they did a swift plunge and declared it fixed, when obviously it was not. The wireless did not work, and I was charged. And the room smelled bad, but was covered up by a strong deodorizer that I was allergic to. I decided that I could not stay at this hotel and checked out the next day - they gave me a hard time because of my advance purchase and originally weren't going to refund me the extra nights (I had booked 5) when I only stayed 2 nights. I had to fight with the manager about this. I will never stay in this hotel again. An awful experience

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JulianandGillian
Reviews.Content: Booked a short weekend break at this hotel for a family birthday. Location couldn't be better. Check in serivce a little slow but very helpful and they upgraded the birthday boy. Nicely furnished rooms, small but just what you'd expect of a NY hotel. Would definitely stay there again and recommend it to all. Shame a previous reviewer had such a poor experience

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Skabyrrd
Reviews.Content: The hotel recently changed names (from the Crowne Plaza to the Tudor Hotel), so perhaps this is why my experience is nothing like the last poster's. I received a complimentary upgrade upon arrival, in part due to the hotel's "Opening Special" and part due to arriving early at check-in. The room was completely clean, comfortable bed, lovely bathroom and nice to have windows that open. The rest of the furniture and the hotel did not seem to be "falling apart" and I found the accomodations quite nice by New York City standards for a room that I paid $199 for! The staff was extremely considerate - and the only issue that I had is having to pay for high-speed internet access (a little pricey, the last few NYC hotels I was in offered it complimentary) and there wasn't enough tea/coffee for more than one person. The location is also great, just a few blocks from Grand Central terminal. I'd highly recommend this hotel as a very nice place to stay for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: CaHfm
Reviews.Content: I had checked this website before booking this hotel so I thought everything would be ok. I thought wrong. The hotel staff was rude and not helpful. The room smelled bad and we kept running out of toilet paper and it would take forever to get some sent up to the room. I will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Adders
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, good service, did not eat there so cannot make a comment on food. Rooms are ok in size and are clean. A little worn in places but does not get away from it being quiet enough to sleep and only a 5 minute walk from Grand Central. There are plenty of places on 42nd street to get breakfast and Grand Central is a great place to eat, try the cheesecake.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: city_rambler
Reviews.Content: Stopped at the hotel for a 3 night break and we couldn't have asked for more. Room was clean and a good size. Breakfast was very good - we ate and stocked up for the days sight seeing. Only downside is that the drinks in the bar were a bit on the expensive side, but it is a hotel after all!! Views weren't great from the hotel - unlike the views we had from the Millenium, but you can't have everything. We would definately look to stop in this hotel on our next adventure to New York as I think it offers great value for money and is ideally situated to get to any part of the city in a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel on the East Side”
Reviews.Author: WashDCMan
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza UN is a beautiful hotel sandwiched between an old church and other tall buildings just off Third Avenue. I only stayed there one night and didn't spend much time in the hotel--but I was impressed. The rooms are of course small; this is New York, after all. If you've ever stayed in a full-sized Japanese hotel room, you know what to expect. However, it was really nice. Luxurious linens, very clean, and a great shower. They even provide a little gift bag containing (among other things) earplugs and a sleep mask, placed on each bed. Very thoughtful, considering that anywhere you stay in NYC, you're gonna hear some sirens. In the small stereo in the room, there's even a CD of new-agey fall-asleep music--which has hilarious commentary at the beginning. Check it out! The view out the window was of the building next door; but what else would it be? I walked past the lobby bar a few times, and it looked very nice, with lots of well-heeled-looking people having drinks there. It looked classy and cozy at the same time. The front-desk staff were also very nice, and checkin/checkout were a breeze. At just over $200 (corporate weekday rate), this wasn't a steal--but hey, it's New York. One other thing: I posted a comment on the hotel's website to suggest delivering some newspaper other than the USA Today in the mornings. I mean, it's New York, and the New York Times is one of the best papers in the world! (And no, I don't work for them.) I received a thoughtful e-mail from the manager saying that they'd consider this suggestion. The Crowne Plaza UN isn't terribly close to many of the main tourist attractions--but it's not far by subway, and walking to them is doable. And I would be this hotel is quieter than those near Times Square or in Lower Manhattan. If you have business at the UN or elsewhere in Murray Hill, staying at this hotel is a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: JammyLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a long weekend (Thurs-Sun). We found this hotel very good. We was on the 8th floor in a standard room and although the room was small with just enough room to walk around the sides of the bed it was still good enough. The bed was really comfy and the room came with an iron, ironing board, trouser press, coffee maker, hair shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, CD player/clock and a safe that you didn't have to pay for which was excellent! On the bed was a welcome package which included lavender linen spray, an eye mask and ear plugs. I did hear some very slight street noise from our room but it was literally just sirens a couple of times in the whole 4 days. There was no view from the room though - only of a brick wall but then we didn't go to NYC to look at the view through a window! We found the staff fine and the place clean. It was in a great location as well - not to far from everything you want to see but far enough away that it wasn't noisy. The picture i've posted was taken from right outside our hotel so as you can see the Chrysler building isn't far at all and Grand Central Terminal is right next to it. We managed to walk everywhere from this hotel except down town to see the state of liberty as that really is far! We would definately stay at this hotel again when visiting NYC!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Yal
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star hotel regardless of the official ratings. A lot of things are the way they are in this hotel simply because its New York and that includes the 4 star rating. This is a cheap hotel by NY pricing standards, and its not that bad really. The rooms and corridors are small and cozy. Sheets, bathroom, bedroom were clean. Nice restaurants nearby on second avenue. If you love to shop 57th street beckons and its a hop, skip and a jump to central park, UN, and the sights and museums between. The problem is you get the feeling that the hotel is falling apart beneath its beautiful exterior and interior and the staff is just praying that everything holds together long enough for their shift to end. DO NOT bother contacting the front desk for anything unless you want to charge something! Service in New York has always stunk but a hotel is one place you think would be immune to it. Not this hotel! Front desk was absolutely no help when we found out that the heater had broken down on our floor so we had no heat all night. Luckily it was an unseasonably warm night or we would have checked out or demanded a new room. Think of this as a good 2-3 star hotel and you will be happy. We were :)

Reviews.Title: “Make sure they don't give you the room under the air con extrctor!”
Reviews.Author: I-want-to-be-home
Reviews.Content: Hi Make sure that they don't give you the room opposite the lift on the top floor. Its right under some kind of air conditioning vent the size of a small house. Sleeping in that room is like sleeping in a large drum. They will move you if you ask, nicely. They moved me in September 2006...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel 3 blocks from Grand Central”
Reviews.Author: ironcross31
Reviews.Content: My husband had to go to a museum in NYC for one of his night classes and at the last minute, we decided to book a room and stay over. We were pretty much going with the cleanest room for the cheapest price. After looking on Expedia, we chose the Crowne Plaza. Neither of us had heard of it before. When we pulled up, two doormen were hailing cabs and handling luggage. The clerk at the desk allowed us to check in at 11:30 AM, even though I think check-in was supposed to be 2:00 PM. The room was small but very clean. It came with an iron, ironing board and pants presser. It also came with a coffee maker, and had conditioner and body lotion as well as shampoo in the shower, which was also very clean. The bed was a good size and really comfy. On the bed was a welcome package which included lavender linen spray, an eye mask and ear plugs ( none of which were needed but it was a nice thought anyway ). There was also a clock/CD player which included a "soothing sounds" CD which you could time to play as you went to sleep. We didn't use it but again, nice idea. The hotel also had what seemed to be a nice restaurant, but we were trying to stay outdoors as much as possible, as part of my husband's assignment was to take photos. That being said . . . We walked south on 2nd Avenue and found a GREAT 24-hour diner/restaurant near 36th street called "Sarge's". Best breakfast I ever had. All in all, for the money, this hotel beats the crap out of every other NY hotel I've ever stayed in. If the price stays close to the same, we're going back next month just for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: dvespa
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this Crowne Plaza for almost 10 years now because a major client of mine is located across the street, so it is very convenient for me. Staff service is consistently good, and the lobby bar remodel is a welcome one. Even though I'm a priority club member and have been staying there so consistently, I always get very small rooms that look out onto a brick wall or, in one case, a big air duct. That is pretty depressing. During this latest stay in Feb 2007, my room was looking pretty tired -- carpet was starting to fade, walls and doors were nicked, even the cleanliness was a bit wanting. When I checked into my room, my sink did not drain. An engineer came up immediately and was very nice about checking it but couldn't do anything about it so late at night. The next day another engineer took a look at it and it was a bit improved, but it was still very sluggish and when I washed my face and brushed my teeth, I had to deal with a full sink, an off-putting experience. Most of the rooms I've stayed in here do not have desks, so it is difficult to work. Even though this has been a pretty convenient place to stay over the years because of its proximity to my client, I may look for another hotel next time around. The staff do try, hard but the property is showing its lack of upkeep.

Reviews.Title: “4 night break”
Reviews.Author: thame_hoops
Reviews.Content: Having stayed all over New York in previous years, I decided to try a different hotel, mainly for price reasons as I booked late to see some family. I booked this direct through intercontinental website as they appeared to be cheapest. I got a good rate of approx £100 a night including tax's for a double room. I read various reviews on trip adviser and got a bit put off by some but I thought I’d take a gamble. In short, I will summarise. Some people complained about the location, its 5-minute walk from grand central station, and 15 minutes from Times Square. I hung out all over NYC so location wasn’t too much of an issue but the 15 minute walk back from times square at 2am in -10c weather was annoying so I took taxis for like $4. Prices in the hotel for food and drink were on a par with the city but hey, your in New York, who would want to stay in the hotel and eat/drink, there are bars surrounding the hotel. My room was clean, bed was comfy, bathroom was swish (marble and granite) but I didn’t spend too much time in the room, it was a place to shower and sleep. Granted it’s not of the same quality as a UK crowne plaza but it’s a cross between a Travelodge and a cosy English Inn. The TV had some cable channels, picture quality wasn’t great but it does the job. Like all hotels the pay per view movies were new but expensive but I didn’t watch any. The telephone in the room was expensive; I even had to pay $2 every time I used my calling card via toll free number. I didn’t go for the breakfast option, as it looked expensive so I can’t comment on that but I like going to local cafes to get the NYC atmosphere. I probably wouldn’t stay here again because I like to try different places and personally I’d like to be closer to Times Square for all the action but I certainly can have no complaints. Yes, it used to be called the hotel Tudor and there are still bits in the room with Tudor hotel written on it buy who cares! If I was on business and had planned to be in the hotel a lot more then maybe I’d go for a better quality hotel but for a 4-night stay I just wanted a bed and shower, which were more than adequate! Nice touches were the doormen and canopy outside which give the impression it’s a quality hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not your usual Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: zorro100
Reviews.Content: Well, the good news was that I got this hotel through priceline, cheaply, on the day of the stay. It's an old building (actually a registered landmark in NY), but what that means for the hotel guest, unless you're an architecture buff, is small rooms and just a general "old" feel. The room was rather small and worn looking...I was staying alone with one bag, and felt cramped. Like many older buildings in NYC, there seemed to be problems with water temp. and pressure (I woke up at 4AM one morning to get a hot shower). Also, there are no minibars in rooms (despite the literature in your room telling you to get a minibar key from the front desk) and little good light. Restaurant was overpriced (even for a hotel in NYC) and, although many travel websites tell you this hotel is near Grand Central Station and its subway station, you can't make that walk in the winter without freezing. On a good note, the staff, and particulary the doormen, were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value,Great Service,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mikeg119
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. From the time I walked in the lobby I felt like I was a valued guest and was treated as such. I arrived at the hotel around 9:30AM and was checked in immediatley. (check in time is 3PM) The front desk staff was courteous very helpful anytime I had a question. The consierge and bell captains at this hotel are first rate and made my stay a memorable one. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay at a nice hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Overall Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: nikkysmith
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New York and I was very skeptical about the hotel after reading some of the reviews but I took a chance. The price of the hotel was great and the location was very convenient. There was a great pizza place within one block and a baskin robins and dunkin doughnuts. Grand central is a short distance away and there was never a shortage of cabs passing by for us to flag down. Times Square was about a $5 cab ride away. The staff was very helpful from the beginning by letting us check in early and not charging us extra for our two extra guests. When we called for towels the staff was very prompt. The hotel lobby was great with a bar and lounge area but the elevators and hallways are very small. The elevator just barely fir 4 people but they were prompt so it was okay. The room was a little smaller than I expected since I booked a junior suite and was expecting a separate living room but it worked out okay. The closet had plenty of space and built in shelves. The bathroom was average size, could provide more room without the bade. I have to add that the concierge was outstanding. We asked numerous questions and were able to get exact directions and some great tips. Overall we had a very pleasant stay minus the freezing weather. Oh the heat lamps at the entrance to the hotel were a plus when waiting to hail a cab!!

Reviews.Title: “Small Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: modernn
Reviews.Content: Small, worned out rooms.The room did not appear to be cleaned well. Front desk staff were rude and seem disinterested in their job. The overall feeling was one of unprofessionalism and poor value for the money. Had a Guarenteed non-smoking room reservation and was given a smoking room. Hotel denied I had a reservation and when I showed my email confirmation they suddenly found it. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Experience”
Reviews.Author: trippin_it_up
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review upon visiting the CP UN last year. While not negative, I did not find many positive things to say about the place other than the rate. I stayed at this hotel again in January mainly because the rate was great compared to other hotels of equal quality. This time, I booked a junior suite. I was very satisfied with the room and the front desk appeared to be more interested in their customers this time. Again, the location is great for Grand Central, the rate is usually good, and the rooms are nice if you get a junior suite or even a superior room. The standard room is not too good, though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: petrol1967
Reviews.Content: Was origionally booked into the Crowne Plaza Times square but decided it was too "in your face" being in the middle of Times square, so opted for the Crowne Plaza United Nations. The dates we stayed 25 - 28th Jan 2007 Where do I start... We Arrived at JFK,and got a taxi to the Hotel (cost was $45 plus toll cost $4.50 plus tip) Arriving at the Hotel, we were ushered to the express check in area, being a Priority Club member and was upgraded to a Junior Suite..NICE ! We were in New York to celebrate my 40th Birthday and the reception staff wished me happy birthday, with no prompting at all. Arrived at the room as was surprised as the room was a good size and the bed was very very comfortable. Large bathroom with a Jacuzzi bath. Had a great 3 night stay all the staff were great. Left the cleaning maid a couple of bucks a day, and she always left extra soaps, shampoos, body lotions, towels e.t.c. Nice touch was that there was a sweetie jar on the desk full of nice sweets, which we helped ourselves too on the way out for our long walks around the great city that is New York. I would highly recommend this Hotel, its in a great location, close to, and on the same road as the Iconic Chrysler building and Grand Central Station. If you fancy a beer on your way home from yor travels, there is an Irish bar opposite the hotel called McFaddans, which was fine most evenings, it was heaving on Saturday night, full of a young crowd but no bother. All in all great location, great Hotel, and will stay there again, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Oh come on you guys! This hotel is quite nice.”
Reviews.Author: MayorMike
Reviews.Content: After booking on Priceline and getting the Crowne Plaza for 110.00 per night I checked reviews here and cringed expecting the worst. Come on! E. 42nd at 2nd ave. Quiet location for NYC, a few blocks from Grand Central or the East River (if you want a quick swim) or anywhere you want to go. The hotel has small elevators and narrow hallways. So what? Great photos of old NY in the halls and only 10 max rooms per floor. The room we had had a terrace! A terrace! The room was huge and ...gasp...had a bidet! Which was refreshing though my wife wouldn't touch it. The staff were absolutely fine and friendly and gave us a great room even though it was Priceline and sometimes you get less than the best. The bathroom was marble and plenty large. The mini bar was empty and locked. But who cares! Oh no! What to do when hungry in middle of night? Come on you whiners..... this is NYC not Omaha and there is more great food right outside your door than anywhere on Earth! I loved this hotel, I've stayed all over NYC in unpredictable spots and rooms and I would choose this hotel even at full fare. One thing: this is a high parking rate area. cars cost 45.00 and my pick up truck cost 55.00! If I had to do it over again I'd park in a less high rate area and cab to the hotel. This was a great location to catch a cab any time you wanted it. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Grace613
Reviews.Content: I booked several months in advance for an overnight stay, and was not sure what to expect given the reviews. I trusted it would be just 'OK', but it turned out to be a very good experience. I added a friend onto the reservation, and the hotel did not charge for the change in persons per room, as I had been told may occur. The front desk volunteered to find a room with separate beds, again a deviation from my reservation but immediately taken care of. We enjoyed the rooms: modern, clean and comfortable. As travelers with certain dietary needs, upon our request we were promptly given the name and number of a particular food establishment. This took place while still signing in. The internet capability was a bonus. It could be said to be a bit expensive at $14.95 a day. Well, that is the price we pay as professionals who need the service, or as people who just want the luxury of instant access to the world. All staff was courteous and helpful, and made our trip to New York City a positive one. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EnglishLady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a girl friend for a 4 night break to shop and see the sights. For two women this hotel is in a great location, very close to the subway and in a very safe area. It is only a short walk to many attractions and near the shops on 5th Avenue and Lexington Avenue. We got a taxi from and to JFK airport which only took about 25 minutes each way and cost $45 plus tunnel toll and tip. We booked a superior room with 2 double beds and it was very comfortable, the beds were good and the shower excellent. This hotel should not be confused with a Crowne Plaza in the UK which would be of a much higher standard, I cannot agree that this hotel has 4 stars as it is more like a 3 star. It used to be the Tudor Hotel up until about 10 years ago and it has seen better days. It is looking tired and needs updating. Saying that the staff were very helpful and it was very clean. We did not eat or drink in the hotel as there are so many other places to do this in NY. We did experience an awful lot of noise in the hotel, some people obviously cannot shut a door, they prefer to let it slam behind them. I would definitely stay there again with a friend but if I was with my husband I would like somewhere a bit more plush.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough !”
Reviews.Author: PB&SK
Reviews.Content: Was a little concerned having read a couple of reviews but worked out fine. Location is good for a tourist as its about 15mins walk from Time Sq (and less if you take the Grand Central shuttle) and the same from Empire State. Subway is easy to other places from Grand Central. Hotel is typical city centre - a little anonymous and smaller rooms - but certainly clean and big enough (we were there for a week). Breakfast is ok but not worth $20 especially as there's plently of cafes around - luckily we were on an inclusive rate otherwise we wouldn't have bothered.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: turkeyOgel
Reviews.Content: Probably the only hotel in NewYork where you can not get the New York Times.When I asked for it they told me that they did not have anyone to go out and get the newspaper for me.How very weird? Comfortable bed,the room decor needs upgrading but the bathrooms are very clean .A little distant from everywhere but still a good buy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic: Jacqui from warwickshire England”
Reviews.Author: fraser7
Reviews.Content: I go this hotel through priceline at a competitive rate, however, the priceline experience service was not quite as good. As for the hotel it was great. The location was fab with plenty of bars and resteraunts close by. The concierge recommended some great resteraunts and places for breakfast. Our favourite was Mamma mexico. The food here was amazing especially the gucamole. The hotel was clean and tidy and the staff were all very helpful. The rooms were spcious and the beds were very comfortable. The area was quiet at night and the rooms were always well service. i have stayed at other crowne plaza's which were better decorated but overall this experience was as good. I am surprised by the negative reviews because are experience was great. I would recommend Johns and the comfort dinner for breakfast both good and reasonably priced. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd pass on this one.”
Reviews.Author: goo0325
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few nights in December 2006. The hotel has a lot of character. Public space is nice, hallway corridors are narrow and charming. Guest room had alot of charm and the hotel seemed like a boutique hotel. Rooms are worn and in need of an upgrade. They do not have the typical Crowne Plaza Pillowtop mattresses and 5 pillows per bed. I had a room that had only two pillows and a small satin decorative pillow. The room was very clean and the housekeeping staff was friendly. The big negative here is the front desk staff. I encountered 4 different females at the front desk at various times during my stay. I am not a high maintenance guest, but found all of them to be rude and surly. The first impression was at checkin around 2 pm in the afternoon. There was a line of about 6 people. 2 attendants were at the front desk. One stopped in the middle of what she was doing to go in the back office and get money for food she had had delivered. She was in the back for 3-4 minutes getting money to pay the delivery guy I guess. When she finally got to me I said "Good Afternoon!" She rolled her eyes and said -"Last name?" On the second day of my stay, I called to the front desk to request a key for the minibar. I was told that the minibars are all out of service. I asked for a soda vending machine- I was told there were none. I asked where I could get a soda. I was told the restaurant was closed. I asked where the closest place I could get a soda would be. After a sigh-- (I am sorry for annoying this girl) but this should not be a difficult request. Another time I approached the front desk for directions. The young lady was on her cellular phone. She pointed for me to go to the bell stand for directions. The bellman was busy talking to the doorman, so I walked next door to the Helmsley and got directions there. It is really a shame, as this is a nice hotel. With new staff at the front desk, this could be an excellent hotel. I paid $400 and change per night. I received better service at some economy hotels. Shame on the manager of this hotel for not being more visible and taking care of these curt employees. Who pays their salaries? I would not stay here again and will write to Crowne Plaza Corporate Offices as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: pixiejade
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business from 11-17 November. I was rather worried after having read all the negative comments on this website. However, the room I had was very okay. It was as asked, non-smoking, with a queen size bed, and in a quiet corner of the hotel. The size was definitely okay for a NY hotel with sufficient space to put bags etc away. The linnen was crisp and the bathroom and room clean. The free wireless internet connection in the lobby did not work (but that may have been me not knowing what to do....) but the high speed internet access in the room worked very well (expensive though). The staff, while by no means being friendly, was correct - most of the time. The location is excellent. One can easily walk to many places, and the subway is just ten minutes walk away. I tried roomservice on the first night, but that is something I would not advice. The prices for a sandwich were 4 times the price for the same sandwich in a deli 150 metres from the hotel. As I discovered on the second day of my stay, there are plenty of good restaurants and deli in the neighbourhood, so there is no need at all to eat in the hotel. Overall, this is definitely a place I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Alex_and_family
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza at the UN for 4 nights in September 2006. This was the only hotel around with rooms available at that time so I was "obliged" to stay there... No other choice. The room is ok, clean and relatively modern with minimum accomodations (the mini-bar is locked however). The rest of the hotel is clean as well. There is a business center and Wifi available everywhere in the lobby (I had no time to check prices). The thing I would like to report is first the very high prices in this hotel. They are charging local calls at astounding rates. Even calls to the lobby are charged. Ordering a pizza (by the way the food is extremely bad) in your room will cost you a minimum of $40. Second : the staff members are unpolite and they simply don't care about you. At the desk they will barely answer your questions without even looking at you. Bad service, bad prices, bad experience, I will never go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experiance ever!!”
Reviews.Author: dralanir
Reviews.Content: To begin with, there is'nt a ramp for strollers/wheelchairs in the entrance of the hotel. We had to wait for 3.5 hours (till 5.30 pm) in the small lobby before we were assigned to one of our 2 suites. We had booked a junior suite which turned out to be smaller than the standard rooms in other Crowne Plaza Hotels. There was a very unpleasant odour in both rooms and the carpets were filthy. In one of the suits there was no shampoo, no clean towels and dirty bedsheets in the sofa bed!! When we complained to the manager on duty about the problems above, he was very rude and refused to cooperate, sayin that these were "New York standards". In conclusion, we would not advise you to stay there as we would never again.

Reviews.Title: “Give this a miss!”
Reviews.Author: tmemedia
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again. Yes, the location is great, especially as it's within walking distance of the UN, but this is a 2 star property at best. First of all, though I booked a queen size room for a whopping $320 a night (yes, that's right), when I checked into my room it was a wheelchair access double room, which I know from the website was cheaper. I called to complain and the front desk told me they had no other rooms. (Not sure I bought that, but whatever). When I pointed out that I shouldn't be charged for a room I didn't get, they agreed to charge me what the room was worth -- after 15 minutes of arguing and being left on hold. The next day they moved me to the queen sized room I'd asked for in the first place, which was better at least, but these rooms are very tired. There's mold in the bathrooms, the air-con is noisy, the carpets stained, and the beds are a joke. Cheap mattresses! The lobby looks like a hallway, you wouldn't want to spend much time there, and the elevators are tiny and out of order alot of the time. I can't believe this hotel is charging these rates, but I guess they can and people like me pay it -- once. There are way better places to stay in this location, trust me.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location”
Reviews.Author: six_in_the_city
Reviews.Content: I am being very nice to tell you this, so listen up: They are doing refurbishments and if you don't mind the sound of hammers, drills and other unnecessary and unexpected noises during your holiday, then go ahead and book a room there, otherwise forget this place till september. I am being a LOT nicer to give this place a 4 rating. The location is PERFECT. East 42nd street, 5mins to the UN (to the east) and 5mins to the chrysler building(to the west). and you don't even have to change your vertical bearings, just keep walking in 42nd street! 10-15mins to the west will take you to times' square and that's where it all happens. Excellent friendly staff, internet connection in the rooms (but a little expensive, just take ur laptop to a nearby starbucks opposite grand central station which is again on the 42nd st.) So remember, they're doing work till September and the elevators might be out of order sometime during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ludiandrade
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza UN from 7/21/06-7/24/06. This hotel is situated in an excellent location as it is walking distance to all main attractions in NYC. The rooms are small as to be expected but not quite as clean as I anticipated but livable. I had read in prior reviews that this hotel did not have an iron - yes it does and a trouser press at that too! Mini-bar in room and good cable channels. Bathroom could use some updating. We were assigned room 1120 with an otherwise not pretty view but who is in NYC for the hotel view? Clean sheets and towels all the time. Only two of the three elevators were operable and slow at that. Room service was excellent. Presentation of food was good too. Staff very friendly and helpful however, we did notice that there was no door service or luggage service on Saturday and Sunday. Perhaps since the hotel is in the middle of remodeling.... The going rate was $159. Booked through Site69 as a last minute package- beware of this third party site it does not offer good customer service. Our flight was cancelled due to mechanical problems and Delta was unable to put us on another flight until the next day. Called Site69 to ask for assistance and they are useless insisting that Delta was responsible to remedy the situation. After explaining to Delta personnel that Site69 was unwilling to book us on another airline or credit us for the prepaid night at the CPlaza they made every possible effort and put us on a connecting flight through Atlanta that same evening arriving in NYC at 1:30am instead of the anticipated 9:15pm and FIRST CLASS at that! Reminder: always use a credit card or better yet, American Express to purchase travel. American Express almost always defends their customer - YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed ..”
Reviews.Author: okname
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Crowne Plaza on a Friday and Saturday night. The location of the hotel was great and the staff very helpful. Upgrading their elevator system..abit of a pain, but overall we enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: MariaAndersson
Reviews.Content: Nice up to date room. High quality linen. Quite big room for NY. Very clean. Effective air-condition. Good location. Paid 199 USD for a twin executive room-good price for being NY.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Hoped For!”
Reviews.Author: OnBoard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza at the United Nations and loved it! After reading multiple reviews about the dinginess and the small size of the hotel rooms in NYC, we had lowered expectations but were pleasantly surprised when we were given a large room on the 18th floor. Room included a king sized bed, a seating area with couch and coffee table and a desk. Bathroom was a good size and included a Jacuzzi tub. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room faced East towards the river so it was very quiet. My only small complaint was that the curtains in the room didn’t completely block out the light like most hotel room curtains do, but not a huge deal. We just got up at regular times instead of sleeping in ‘til all hours of the day! My favourite part about the hotel was the linens…they were soft and comfortable. The comforter wasn’t made of that itchy nylon material. The staff at the Crowne Plaza were friendly…doorman and front desk staff always smiled and said hello as we passed. No problems leaving luggage there until our later flight…and they didn’t charge for this service! Location of the hotel was perfect…just a few minutes walk from Grand Central and the Metro. Other hotels in the area were the Helmsley and the Hyatt. Took about 20 minutes to walk to Time Square. We couldn’t have asked for a better location…it was away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but still centrally located to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: skoc50
Reviews.Content: I have to give it a better than average rating if for no other reason than its location. Not far from Times Square or Grand Central, it's location is ideal for what most tourists are looking for in New York. I was a little hesitant that it would be too far east (I've stayed in a hotel off 3rd Ave., further north) to have any restaurants nearby, but that proved to be of no concern. There's plenty to choose from for either a quick bite or nice dining, or even a quick pick-up for breakfast in the am. Yes, the room is a little on the small side, but it is an old building. Not really a big deal. The bathroom was totally updated & nicer than any other I've stayed in in a long time. And what a treat to be able to open the window for fresh air. The female concierge really didn't seem to like her job although I would never say she was rude or inefficient. Just didn't seem to want to be there. We affectionately called her Smiley! The male concierge on the other hand, was very helpful & professional. I am a travel agent and didn't seem to get any preferential treatment, which I don't want! I want to know how my clients would be treated if I send them there. All in all, I'd say for the price & location, it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quite OK”
Reviews.Author: viaggiando
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in this hotel for the Easter week. We got a preferential rate of 170 USD, which would be rather expensive for European standards but was the cheapest decent option we could find in NYC for that period. The room we finally got was nice, with two windows, marble bathroom and a comfortable queen bed. However, before getting it, we had to complain with the reception because the first room we were assigned was small and with one twin bed for the two of us! The same happened to the friends travelling with us - they got a dark room on the fourth floor, with only one window facing a wall, and they had to ask to change it for a brighter room (we were staying one whole week, so comfort was quite important). We did not understand why we should be assigned bad rooms when better ones were actually available. Another weak point was the business centre - the Internet is very expensive (12 USD per hour) and I actually did not manage to use it as the machine for payment did not seem to work (nobody was there to help). Television has only American channels - a bit discomforting when you want to know what's happening in the rest of the world. Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay a lot. We found the location to be very good, as it is central but also quiet. The restaurant seemed expensive, so we had breakfast in the neighbourhood, there are plenty of good options.

Reviews.Title: “Poor front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this hotel. I had reserved two rooms as we were a party of 5, thinking this would be fine as the e-mail confirmation I received stated both rooms had two double beds. Prior to arrival I contacted the hotel to confirm the reservation and was told that they were not aware we were a party of five they thought we were only 4 people and that the rooms had twin beds, not doubles in them. Explained that I had made it quite clear when reserving that we were a party of five and that we needed the bigger beds. Also my reservation had been mixed up with another guests checking in that day with the same intilas and as such they could only be certain that I had one room reserved. The staff whilst not rude certainly were not reassuring and said they could do nothing until I had faxed confirmation of my booking. After at least 4 calls leaving messages and trying to speak to someone in authority, plus fowarding e-mails and sending the fax I still did not receive any help. In desperation I phoned Crowne Plaza in the UK and was put through to a very helpful customer relations assisant who promised to contact the hotel and phone back. This she did and said the problem had been sorted. She said she had convinced the hotel to allocate a suite with three beds. She also said the hotel wanted to charge an extra third person rate for this room but in good faith asked the hotel to bill customer relations for this amount. On arrival at the hotel we were allocated one standard room with twin beds ( certainly not doubles) and a suite with a king size bed and a sofa bed. The sofa bed was not made up and there was no acknowledgement of my many attempts to receive a response form the hotel. On checkout the hotel tried to bill me directly for the extra charges for the suite room and had to explain (again!! ) that customer relations were going to pay these. On the plus side the hotel is in a great location, the beds were very comfortable. Great to be able to open windows. The rooms were clean and serviced very effecintly each day. The Bell Captain was very helpful with luggage and sorting a taxi for JFK. Concierge helpful also. The hotel is looking tired and needs a refit. Also rooms and public areas very dark. I would stay there again but only if my arrangements were very srtaight forward and the rate was cheap enough.
